Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasJws
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest stays at a hotel we have experienced. The room was beautiful, the surroundings were beautiful and the people were some of the nicest, politest people we have dealt with in a long time. We plan on doing it again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Dinner and breakfast at Trellises”
Reviews.Author: AlanJohnP
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stopped by for a Friday night dinner. Live music was playing, live roses on every table and the overall dinner was excellent. I liked it so much I came back the next morning, Pati took care of everything; after enjoying an excellent breakfast, I enjoyed great coffee (with fresh cream) for about an hour while reading from my iPad and enjoying the garden views, didn't want to leave. The menu prices were a great value. I use 20% as an average for tipping, Trellises earned 30% for exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “California State Athletic Directors 2012”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: Great service from check-in to banquet and check-out. Tom Bisesi, sales manager, Bengt Samuelson, convention services manager, Rhianna Cultrona, catering, Pisey Oum, reservations and Jim Roth, audio visual. The very best service from 30 years of experience. We had a great conference because of these people.

Reviews.Title: “Huge place, too busy to be great”
Reviews.Author: Simon123
Reviews.Content: This place is massive, and just walking around exploring all the grounds is an hour or two. We had no complaints, and would stay again if we had too. Service was good, and it is in a good location, but due to the 1000's of people staying it was too busy for the hotel to offer Great service. We would probably look for somewhere a lot smaller if possible, unless of course we got another good price...

Reviews.Title: “Sprawling resort, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: R0nC
Reviews.Content: This is the oldest resort/conference facility in San Diego and is showing its age. The facility has a lot, but the rooms are very dated and service was not great. Food provided in the conference facility was good and there are several good onsite restaurants. The meeting rooms were also fine and the facility is convenient to city and mall and has an onsite golf course and spa. A site- seeing trolley stops at the facility. But charges for parking and internet service are excessive and parking spots near your rooms is very limited (must park in a parking garge which was a good distance from the rooms. Many other newer facilities were in the area at a much lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Best service!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBeat
Reviews.Content: I came down here for a massage convention, had a great time! Food is great and the servers are amazing! My favorite was Pati Muklevicz at the Trellises. Absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Coopsaremad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a conference and found that everything was fine --- in a word: average. There was ongoing renovations to rooms on my hall which didn't really bother me and my room was sufficiently clean with furnishings in good shape. The resort has decent offerings for lunch and is conveniently located to the trolley and fashion place mall if you don't have a car to use. The pools looked decent while I didn't use them. The gym was unimpressive and there was a tacky $5 per day charge for its use which frankly wasn't worth it based on the quality of equipment and size of it. Further, there was no locker/shower facility at the 'spa.' Other than the below average fitness center, I found everything else about the location (including the convention room facilities) to be adequate but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable relaxing spring break”
Reviews.Author: Marlena Q
Reviews.Content: We had a cute little cottage style room which was perfect with our 20 month old no one above us and no one below us and right in front of one of their pools. So if you have little ones request the rooms behind check in!

Reviews.Title: “Banquet Department Service/ Socorro Enriquez”
Reviews.Author: Sandy B
Reviews.Content: I have been attending the San Diego Spring Round Up at Town & Country for the past four years. Service is always outstanding. One of the staff in the Banquet Department however always goes above and beyond. This year I took time to thank her personally and her humility was touching. Socorro Enriquez told me how she loves her job and did not think that she did anything more than what was expected. I smiled and thanked her again but I know that the service she provides is above and beyond. I commend her dedication and quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: cwithp
Reviews.Content: the gardening is beautiful and I liked having our rooms in the gardens. But no ac or fan so when other people were outside smoking it came right into the room. Beds were fine but pillows bad. Bathroom small but shower very good. We ate one night at Kelly's, the steak house on property and it was good, the service was great. We tried to eat breakfast in the Trellise one morning but after being seated, 5 minutes for coffee to be served, then another 10 minutes went by and we still had not seen our waiter or placed an order. We left.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly maintained with beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: portlandorer
Reviews.Content: The maintenance of this facility is amazing. Everything was in exceptional condition. The room was spacious, the bathroom even more so. Storage was excellent. The grounds are gorgeous and maintained extremely well. The staff is very helpful and exceedingly pleasant. It's a couple minute stroll to the tram that will take you to old town or, with a coordinated transfer, to the gaslamp district of downtown. There are decent eateries a 15-20 minute walk away. It is a little dated, but all the offsetting factors and the value make this an easy choice. You do feel a little nickle and dimed as they charge for wireless (which isn't the greatest as it ebbs and flows significantly) and the food was expensive for what you got (we quickly learned there were much better choices within an easy walk--Boudins--or trolley ride--gaslamp district with a myriad of eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: sandiegokatie
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had our wedding here in 2006 and came back for a "staycation" during and even we attended. the property is so lovely and the staff is always very helpful and kind. the spa is WONDERFUL. the rooms are always clean, neat, and most have a beautiful balcony. we recomend this resort for everyone from families to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you have to.”
Reviews.Author: Alocke78
Reviews.Content: The line to check-in was long. The front desk help, however, was the highlight of the hospitality at this hotel. The room service was a joke. I ordered a salad with my meal and they forgot my dressing and my glass of ice water. By the time they brought them up, an hour had gone by. Needless to say I was tired and no longer in the mood for salad. The decor is very dated in both the rooms and the restaurants. The food was "OK" so I wouldn't say it was terrible. My main complaint was the service (both room service and restaurants) and the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are very nice, Rooms and Meeting areas not so much...”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a conference. The grounds are very nice. Brick Walkways, heavily planted and mature trees are all over. Very nice. The rooms however, are very dated. Same with the Conference areas, additionally, missing or dirty ceiling tiles. One other small complaint, is there is a $5.00 charge (per use)to use the work out area. All machines had headphone jacks, but they didn't have any to loan out. Odd. Never had a hotel charge me to use a treadmill before. On a really positve note, Kelly's Steak House was excellent. Melody was our server, and she was very attentive and had a great personality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but old”
Reviews.Author: houstonisraeli
Reviews.Content: Clean but old rooms like my grandmother's house! I stayed at Town in Country in q1'12 for a conference. The grounds are particularly clean but everything looks (and smells) old. I suspect it was built in the 60's. All the rooms decorated with blue carpet and blue bedspreads with flowers. I didn't have a desk in my room but part of a cheap wooden dining room table to work off of. Very strange. Staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Kelly's steakhouse, the gem of the Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: G L
Reviews.Content: From my many visits to the Town and Country hotel the one part that continually stands out is Kelly's steakhouse. Not only do they have the best crowned filet in town, but the piano bar provides a nostalgic atmosphere unique to the Town and Country and lacking elsewhere in San Diego. The Restaurant staff are always very hospitable and the bar provides a relaxing atmosphere making you feel like a regular even on your first visit. The superior hospitality found at this restaurant is no doubt a reflection of the standards of service upheld by the management. If you are looking for a delicious meal, refreshing pint, or good conversation...walk into to Kelly's and you are sure to be met by a smiling face.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sallytraveler81
Reviews.Content: The grounds are lovely with well-tended gardens and beautiful roses. I loved the proximity to Fashion Valley mall. It was easy to walk there to get a quick smoothee from the food court. The trolley stop is very convenient. I took the trolley to the Gaslamp Quarter and Lilttle Italy. In short, the location was fine. The room, however looked as if Louis XV stayed there in 1965! One evening we arrived back at the room to find that the maid had left us with very little toilet paper. We called the front desk with a request for more. After 30 minutes it still had not arrived so we needed to call again. It arrived in 5 minutes after the second call.

Reviews.Title: “This is a conference center...not a typical resort.”
Reviews.Author: EJPVA
Reviews.Content: Think of a colllege campus on steroids -- there are multiple hotel towers and separate wings. All room access is exterior corridor style. LOTS of walking, with two major conference center buildings and numerous meeting buildings. I never did find the Spa or bar. Rooms are very clean and real maintained, but design tends to be more formal...many of our attendees referred to expecting to see the Rat Pack. However, the gardens are fabulous and the staff is superb. Wait staff supported formal dinner functions flawlessly, and no matter where you went, someone was offering to be of assistance. AV support was excellent, lighting was good, and support of a large food show was very good. One hint: Sinks in bathrooms are REALLY low; I'm only 5'2" and had to bend to brush my teeth, so if you're tall, expect to do a LOT of bending over! :-) Plenty of hot water however. The pillows are awful - think ancient and hard!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendyAlaxParker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference and was excited about staying at a place that was going to be so nice. The webpage does not look like its webpage at all. The rooms are old and the hotel grounds are very large and confusing. The 1950's never left this hotel, the 1950's floral and gold chandeliers are in need of a great deal of upgrading. There are tents in the back parking lot that hold the "old broken" furniture and mattresses that the hotel owners will not let the hotel get rid of. It is like having a garbage dump right in your face during your time at the hotel. The staff is great though and attempted to make up for the shabby hotel. They offered discounted attraction tickets and even drove us to the store for free.

Reviews.Title: “At the hotel for a symposium - okay, but could have been much better.”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: e stayed at the Town and Country for three days, and the room was adequate. It was clean and the beds were made regularly, but there was little or no hot water in the bathroom sink. Plenty in the shower, but washing up was cold. We ate at the cafe three three times out of necessity, but ate elsewhere after that. The cafe was loud, understaffed, and overpriced, but the manager Anna was all over herself willing to try to make up for the terrible food and service we received. Unfortunately, we were too burned to return and try again. The deli served Starbucks coffee and was open until 10PM each night. Good. My biggest surprise? When my husband developed a severe toothache in the middle of the night, they had NOTHING at the front desk - no aspirin, tylenol, Advil...nothing. We had to crawl out at 2:30 A.M. and drive to an AM/PM to buy ibuprofen. I have never stayed at a hotel that didn't have a stock of basics available - even for a price. All that said, I might try it again in future. Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Town & Country - A great place to stay in San Diego for work or fun!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieVanPelt
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Town & Country for business; however I can't wait to bring my family for vacation! The staff is always friendly and professional. The resort is centrally located in San Diego with Downtown, Old Town, Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and beach cities all within about a 10 minute drive! Fashion Valley, an upscale - open air shopping mall, is within walking distance as well a Riverwalk Golf Course. The pools at Town & Country are clean, inviting and relaxing. The property is large and beautifully landscaped. It's like a secret resort getaway in the heart of San Diego. The rooms are always well kept with great views and the food is always OUTSTANDING. Whether you order room service, dine at Kelly's Steakhouse or have an afternoon lunch at Trellises, the service and food is always top notch. I will be back soon, next time hopefully the family is with me!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: My 13 yr old son & I vacationed here from Ohio, and felt right at home as soon as we walked in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The rooms were clean & the grounds were very well groomed. The location is just a couple miles from SeaWorld which was very convenient. We will be back to SD in the fall & are looking forward to staying at the Town & Country again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Town & Country Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roger U
Reviews.Content: Director of Sales & Marketing Katherine McCarthy worked a minor miracle to accomodate our last-minute decision to stay at the Town & Country for the IPC-APEX tradeshow. Rooms were clean and well-appointed, and we were greeted with wonderful gifts baskets. Hotel staff most delightful! Our stay at Town and Country was a very pleasant experience. We have already booked rooms for 2 future events. RNU Accu-Tech Laser Processing, Inc.

Reviews.Title: “A sad start”
Reviews.Author: Pad B
Reviews.Content: Checking in a 10:30 PM Tuesday we grab the door and it is locked, in a 1,500 room hotel? No one at the desk. Someone arrives and buzzes us in. I state my name and we have reservations. "I need a credit card and ID", No welcome Mr. so & so, no sorry no one was here. He initially states the room is free, then changes his mind, maybe he ought to read his screen before he talks. He then states a package is in the hotel for me, but no one is available to help. After checking and signing the funky computer screens, we are directed to the parking lot. Arriving to our tower all the luggage carts are locked and cannot be used. Picking up a courtesy phone we ask for help and are told a bell boy will come, but no one is available. We lug the luggage to an elevator whose inspection expired July 2011 and check into a room with a murphy bed pulled down. hmmm. I take a shower in the hottest water I have had in a decade and wonder why they don't temper domestic hot water. the bathroom is kinda gross with the tell-tale signs of darkness in the grout, paint drips on the tiles and little marks all over. All in ONE HOUR. Oh well. this is my third convention here in 10 years NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday”
Reviews.Author: moncinna
Reviews.Content: I just returned from San Diego where my husband took me for my birthday. Coming from Las Vegas and having worked in the Casino business for over two decades I know how important customer service is. We stayed at the Town and Country Resort and from the time we got there until we left, which was six days later, the poeple at the resort could not have been kinder, nicer or had more customer service. I really enjoyed my day at the spa and then there was the convience of the big mall just a short walk over. We enjoyed the meal we got at Kellys' at the resort. The location of the resort made it very easy to go anywhere in the area which we did everyday. I highly recommend this esort for family trips as the pool is big and the area is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Veronica M
Reviews.Content: The service at Town and Country Resort was really great! I was there for a meeting and the staff was very attentive to our needs. And the beautiful grounds were a definite plus! I would definitely return and have another meeting there.

Reviews.Title: “some good some not so good notes”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel due to a conference that was held within the hotel's conference facitilities. When we first arrived they said we had to wait for a room in the towers (which is where we asked to stay based on previous reviews) because they were still being cleaned. So we passed a couple of hours by walking around the grounds, which were beautiful, and eating lunch at the Trellis Restaurant, which was very pleasant. The hotel is right by the trolley but not close to downtown. The area is a little bit sketchy and the restaurants in the area are chains. I did find a good running route along Friar Road behind the hotel which was good because the hotel charges $5 a DAY for gym access. I found this ridiculous. The gym was just ok. The TVs were old school and the remote did not work anyway. The hotel internet in the Royal Palm Tower was not a strong signal (I was on the 9th floor) but better in the conference rooms. They initially tried to charge us a daily internet fee but quickly recanted. The maintenance staff was prompt and very helpful. The Trellis Restaurant's waitress I had each night for a glass of vino was absolutely the highlight of my stay here. The deli staff was disgruntled. The room itself was a bit dated and the coffee machine had no pot. The bathroom was not super clean but acceptable. For the nightly rate I would have expected more. As I said, we stayed in the Royal Palm Towers based on the advice that they were less dated however we found them to be very dated so I am guessing the cottages (I did not see one) were even worse. The TVs were very nice though and the room was large and facilitated some work during the day. The whole place is dated and feels like you have stepped back into another era. They did do an excellent job with the conference itself (as an attendee not an organizer) and the facilities worked perfectly for us. I would recommend the conference facilities but would never stay here again. It was just too dated and not clean enough for my tastes. Also the location was not ideal (not close to downtown or other attractions). The highlight was definitely the helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “interesting reviews”
Reviews.Author: kandy746
Reviews.Content: Well the staff was great, but the rooms in the courtyard were ok. would of preferred the original rooms in the main hotel wouldnt stay in those rooms again. The kids in our group was scared of the picture in the room of the little girl,some of the rooms smelled like smoke, ane the rooms did not upgraded items like the main rooms did in the main hotel. the beds were comfortable,but small rooms. security told parents to keep it down and to go in their rooms around 1am when they were just sitting in the courtyard talking. there were times when the housekeeping did not respond and bring up items that were asked, along with the lack of communication at the front desk. But the group sales employees that dealt with my group were wonderful and vey professional.Also I feel that its not as handicap accessible or stroller friendly as far as the stairs and no elevator in the courtyard and just going to different locations around the hotel.The breakfast buffet had a variety and was great. The girls really enjoyed it. The pool was a great activity for the girls just as well. The overall stay was ok, just some minor issues that I wish could of been taken care of while i was there. I did love that my group sales did have the keys ready at arrival.I would stay again only if in different rooms. But a lot of the families with our eam wouldnt unless in different rooms, and or just a different hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: SiouxBarrett
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Town and Country Resort Hotel for a weekend conference in this year, and our experience was mixed. This property is in some ways very impressive: two swimming pools, a hot tub, a variety of places to eat, a day spa, a conference center on site. If you are attending a conference at the center, I would strongly recommend staying at the hotel: you will get a discounted rate, and the convenience adds a great deal to the value. Even so, there will be some things to be prepared for. There are two different sets of rooms at the Town and Country: one set is in older style, rambling buildings, only two stories tall. The others are newer, and in more modern towers. The older rooms are small, and over furnished. The "English country" style chosen is overbearing and the furniture leaves the rooms cramped even when they use double beds instead of the more common queen beds. With that, let's talk about the place. THE GOOD The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. When you call for more towels, help with the HVAC, etc, they are there promptly and get things taken care of. This speaks well for the establishment, all the way around. The restaurants are clean, well-lit, efficient, and the food at the Terraces cafe is quite good. I will recommend the breakfast buffet there - it is a good value for the price. They have hit the sweet spot between variety of foods and price, at least for me. I've already mentioned the convenience if you are staying for a conference. They are also very convenient to all of the San Diego attractions. The property is right off the 8, and very close to the 163. THE BAD: I've already mentioned the cramped rooms in the older part of the hotel. There were three of us sharing two double beds: my husband, me, and our 14 year-old daughter. It is a good thing I am short (5'1" if I'm standing very straight) because otherwise he and I wouldn't have fit into the double bed provided. The furniture left very little room to live out of a suitcase, which is common for a weekend or other short stay. There is a shortage of convenient parking, at least for the rooms in the older section. I had quite a hike from the car to the room with our luggage. Thank goodness for luggage on wheels! There appears to be plenty of parking, you just have to be willing and able to walk a ways to get to your room. The property clearly does not cater to the "connected" crowd. While they have wireless internet, it does not reach all the rooms. Our room was not at the edge of the property by any means, but we could not connect to the internet from the room. We had to go outside, to a gazebo, to be able to connect to the internet. This is a real negative for us. THE UGLY While the English country look was popular in the 80s, it is less so now. The property is well cared for, but the juxtaposition of box hedges and banana trees is jarring. Originally, it appears that the Town and Country was built when the South Pacific was the most romantic getaway (did it ever really stop being that?) and so many of the buildings have the curved roofs reminiscent of a tropical island hut. The pool courtyard was done up to resemble a European garden courtyard, but the buildings around it were round with the curved shake roofs of the original "tiki hut" style. This may or may not be a negative in your book, but it does give one pause. If the owners are this confused about the decor, what else are they confused about? All in all, an acceptable place to stay, especially at the reduced rate. You won't find better rates this close to town with this many pluses without having frequent visitor status.

Reviews.Title: “interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSURocks1
Reviews.Content: this is a big hotel of a different era (as noted by other reviewers)....while dated the place is clean but it's unfortunate little details seem to be a problem for much of the staff. Check-In All of my charges were being taken care of by someone else however they asked for a credit card at checkin - when I stated all of my charges were being paid for by someone else the desk clerk acknowledged that was correct (not sure why they'd need my credit card then) Guest Room I'll just say the decor is interesting 3 light bulbs burnt out - well not really burnt completely out, they liked to flicker off and on during the night (different bulbs would go on and I had to go from fixture to fixture turning them off) Alarm very loud and would wake anyone up at 6am - unfortunately I didn't set it but it was set Note to hotel management - Is it easy to overlook light bulbs and alarm clocks - sure, do good hotels have processes to ensure they aren't overlooked absolutely....you should establish a checklist of items to be checked by housekeepers each and every day so they can be corrected before the guest (me) finds them NEW LG LCD TV's!!!!! Nice enhancement - decent channel lineup (no premium channels like HBO) Bathroom - decent size, water heated up quickly, was very clean but while using the room I was able to see the face of the sink counter was put on in a quick fashion and was 1.5" lower on the right side than the left....the amount of dust bunnies in that 1.5" was enough to make someone's stomach sick but I could see how this could easily be overlooked because of the where the issue was (but still should have been caught long before now given the age of the room product) Internet Fast - matches the best I've used in any hotel Breakfast Restaurant (Trellis?) - awesome servers....all of them - some of the best!!! Deli - opposite of the above servers...popped in to grab a quick drink (pepsi) but no staff was found, after a few minutes I began to call out - no one answered, finally after at least 10 minutes (yes I did start to time it) someone showed, no apology, no energy he was just "there" Sports Bar - see Trellis, great servers This hotel does tend to nickle and dime a bit, charges for Internet (like most full service hotels so I expect that) charges for parking (again like a lot of hotels but that doesn't mean I like it) but the one I do mind is the daily charge to use the gym.....I can't think of the last time I had to pay to use the gym at a hotel Be Warned - "daily" does not mean any day that ends in a "Y" at this hotel!!! When it comes to restaurants you're best to contact the front desk to find out what "daily" means for each specific...I understand the hotel's occupancy will vary given the conferences/conventions but given the large size of the hotel it's a PIA to walk to a location only to find out today isn't one of the "daily" days it's open....at least put a note in the room giving the revised hours Overall it's a decent hotel for a cheap rate - certainly not the worst I've been in and if you're looking for the Marriott there's one just down the street

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: Tara C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the T&C for 3 lovely days. This was my first time to San Diego and my husband and I wanted a nice room, with a big pool and jacuzzi. The hotel certainly delivered! We stayed in the Palms Tower, ate in The Terrace both days for breakfast and really enjoyed the hot buffet with a large assortment of fresh fruits. One of the nights we ate at Kelly’s which lacked in décor but certainly made up in delicious, hearty food and personable waitresses. The bartender personally delivered the drinks with a wink and a nod. Since we live in Los Angeles, we were especially excited to leave our car parked in the lot and walk across the street to the $5/day trolley. The bellmen were exceptionally helpful by providing us maps of San Diego and how we could hop on and off all over the city. We visited the zoo, Gaslamp, and Old Town which were all great fun. A real bonus was the exceptionally comfortable chairs by the pool and plenty of towels. The morning sunshine and a swim in the pool and I was really able to relax. Thanks Town & Country for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “best place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Carino O
Reviews.Content: We have been to the town and country resort several times. I just made reservations again for July 2012. the women on the phone was so helpful and interested in my needs that we got the best deal with the best attiturde. I am sure our needs and wants will be taken care of. not to mention the beautiful grounds and many pools. everything you need is right on the property. the staff is very helpful, kind and efficient. we usually stay in a garden room which is absoluty wonderful and peaceful to open your curtains and see roses, gardens and walkways where you can sit and rest under a gazebo and relax while you drink your starbucks(which by the way you can get on property). wonderful stay and I will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: floatingsoul
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel (would not call it a resort) for a conference and stayed there for three days. Knowing that this place would be packed for the conference, I made a reservation 2 months ahead, thinking that I could get a better room. When I made the reservation, I reserved a room in the Royal Palm Tower, which is supposed to be the biggest room with two quenn bed, nice view, and a balcony. However, when I got there, although the front desk told me that I had a two-quenn bed room, when I got to my unit, I found it in a complex (not the tower that I reserved) under a stair case, no view, with two double-beds instead. The beds were not comfortable to sleep on. Since the place was packed with two conferences going on at the same time, I did not ask for a different room, which was a mistake. In addition, the hot water boiler was way over the other side and it took forever just to have loop warm water. When we checked out, I mentioned to the front desk and was told that there was nothing they could do and that queen beds were available "on requests only", which I thought I did. It's not like I was asking for compensation or anything. A heartful apology from the manager would've done it. In addition, this place did not have enough parking space to hold two conferences at the same time and we were having hard time finding parking space after we went out for lunch. The last day of the stay, we went to one of their restaurant there to get a bite before I had to go and do my presentation. The place was full of people but only with one waitress. We had to ask three times and it took 20 minutes before the second waitress finally showed up. By the time the food got to our table, I had to leave for my presentation. You would think that the management would realize that there were two conferences going on and schedule more people in those restaurants. Obviously this place only cares about the money and not the customer services. I would not go back there again. And if the conference is going to be held here, I would not go to that conference. This is how much I do not like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent nearly a week at the Town & Country and we LOVED it. Our suite in the Regency Tower was beautifully decorated and incredibly comfortable - especially the beds. There was plenty of space for our family of five, and the kids loved the views from the room, the gorgeous grounds and the great pools. The resort is great because it has a variety of restaurants and is centrally located in Mission Valley - you can literally walk across a footbridge to Fashion Valley Mall. The staff was really friendly, and Barbara in sales was particularly helpful in setting up all of the details for a really excellent week. Overall, the Town & Country was a wonderful place to stay and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some drawbacks, topnotch staff, but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: travelinpalladin
Reviews.Content: I stayed about a week at Town and Country resort for a convention I attended. The prices were very reasonable, and the staff exceeded the bounds of hospitality. It is a great place for a conference, because it is so self-contained. Further, for shoppers, a mall is a five-minute walk, and a golf course is next door. While the resort is not downtown, one can easily catch San Diego’s famed trolleys for five bucks and ride to one’s heart’s content. Taxi rides are a bit more costly, though, so be warned. The resort boasts two nice pools, beautiful grounds, a bar and grill, steakhouse, a breakfast/ coffee bar with outdoor seating and yet another good restaurant, the trellis. Try to get a room in the Royal Palm Tower, which has more updated rooms than some of the other parts. The rooms are the one problem with the resort. Some are rather dated, and they are not really set up for business use. None has a safe, for instance, that I am aware of. Some are oddly decorated. One woman I know actually had a Murphy bed in her room. Overall, we had a great stay and an excellent conference. But if you want to be able to walk to a variety of restaurants, bars and nightlife, there are doubtless more strategically located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: BradW_61938
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference because I normally like to be on grounds, I think it makes things easier. I stayed for a week in February 2012. I wasn't sure what to expect from reading the reviews but soon found out that for the most part the reviews were pretty honest. Some of the best parts were the conference center,with the exception of "the meeting room" I belive it was sunrise, the building smelled horrible and was musky and old...the staff was very good and the food we had during our meals was awesome!. The grounds were amazing and great to look around. I ate breakfast at the cafe and it was ok, the fruit was awesome, the staff was really good, I had a cup of coffee in front of me within minutes of walking through the door even if they were busy...was to over priced for what you got. The bellman group was also very helpful and good...they did an incredible job. It was quick to tell that the training between them and other groups in the hotel must be done by different people as the level of service is not consistent. The rooms as mentioned in other places are outdated, small things could be done to make it better but they just are not taken care of. In my room the bedspread and curtains were very old and were either very cheap or worn out. The bed was very firm, I happen to like firm beds but could see where some people would have a problem with it. The housekeeping staff is not consistent or even very good for that matter, they need to learn how to dust, the tv stand, picture/mirrors, desk, and the curtain thing above the bed all had dust on them. Each day the room was left in a different state of cleanliness. The mirror in the bathroom was never clean and had what appeared to be toothpaste splatters (not mine) on it and the frame... I did call and request a room service menu but never got it not sure who was supposed to bring it but I figured if they didn't want to give it to me they must not want me to use the service. I did notice that for the people that did get to use room service their plates and dishes were allowed to sit on the floor for hours sometimes over night...I know on one day breakfast dishes were left on the floor by the elevator from around 11:00 in the morning until the next day. Overall I enjoyed my stay and the conference(didn't stay in my room much). I am not sure I'd say here again although I do plan to attend the same conference, I did check out a couple of the nearby(walking distance) hotels while I was there for future reference, they were not only cheaper but appeared to be much nicer, more updated, and offered better services. I enjoyed the $60 hotel I stayed in before I flew out to S.D. much better. If you are staying here for a conference might be ok for you, you might want to check out the other options that are right beside this hotel...not sure I'd stay here if I was just vacationing. They will need to work on training some of the staff teams to be more consistent and better at what they are doing and updating the rooms and decor.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Enzo L
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every year for our anniversary. This year we stayed in downtown San Diego. Big mistake. Town and Country makes it so nice. Our room was great, clean, and roomy. My wife spent time at the spa, while I went to the pool ! Parking is so easy, and wow, how we took that for granted. You can walk to the Fashion Valley Mall. Everything you need. Minutes from the beaches, attractions and downtown. This is my place from now on.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: THis is a hotel out of the early 60's and it has a nice charm. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are more than average. All of the staff were friendly and nice. We had dinner at the Steakhouse on site and it was good and the prices were not very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: G K
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the large tower (Palms?) . The room was a very good size . I had a friend stay in the bungalow and those rooms are smaller and don't have coffee makers. The room was clean and the decor is dated but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaMidwesterner
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very nice hotel. Beware - the restaurants are not always open during posted hours. Staff are friendly. Hotel is clean and quiet. Well maintained grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at Trellises”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: We had wondeful food and great service at Trellises this past week. We were offered a free breakfast with our conference but turned it down to go back to eat at Trellises. Pati Muklevicz was our server and she was awesome! Not only was the service prompt and friendly, it was also a great atmosphere. Thanks Pati!

Reviews.Title: “Never again, if I can help it”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference that I was working at. My boss had warned me that it wasn't the best hotel, but I had to go anyway and I figured it couldn't be that bad. Well, it was. I arrived about 10:30pm to check in after a long day of travel. The room they had me in at first was not only dirty, it was also on the ground level with an exterior door and two full screen windows that couldn't be effectively locked. As a woman traveling alone, I immediately went back to the desk and requested a new room. This one was at the back of the premises in a dilapidated, dark and damp building with no security or front desk. There were stains on every towel, and the sheets. There was also a huge stain on the carpet. I ordered room service twice during my four day stay and the trays stayed there for over a day each time. The food itself wasn't great, but at least it wasn't terrible. Luckily, there's a huge mall across the street that I ended up spending most of my free time at. What's sad is that you can tell that this hotel was originally nice. A lot of time and money must have been spent building that hotel. You can tell that they spend a lot of time on upkeep of the grounds. But there just hasn't been any maintenance or upkeep and it's all gone to ruin.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the 70's”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in Sept 2011. There were so many people with the conference that checked out of the hotel and moved in to another hotel. I would have never picked this hotel to stay in. Our joke the entire trip was that the 70s called and wanted their hotel back. The hotel is in major need of renovations. The smell next to the pool was of sewage. We came back from dinner one night and a huge rat ran out in front of us. It looked like they planted the flowers and plants 20 years ago and forgot about them. The only good thing about this hotel was that it was across the street from the fashion district.

Reviews.Title: “Commendation for Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bertha G
Reviews.Content: Our out of the country friends, (2 attorneys) stayed at the Town and Country while attending a seminar at the College of Law in San Diego. They were very impressed with the quality of the accommodations and the excellent service they received during their stay. The staff was extrmely helpful as this was their first trip to San Diego. They were very pleased with the location as it is very close to shopping malls, restaurants, Old Town San Diego, Gas Lamp District, and, of course, the beautiful San Diego Bay and Seaport Village.They certainly received the most value for their money. There is no doubt they will be returning again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolPerry1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Resort for 4 nights and were extremely pleased with the accommodations. The rooms were lovely--furnished with a canopy type bed and large armoire with lots of storage so we could unpack our clothes. Grounds are beautiful and well manicured. Hot tub was quite large with nice jets. The breakfast at the Trellis restaurant was delicious--their eggs benedict were the best we've tasted!! The hotel is located within walking distance to an upscale mall and the trolley line which will take you to Old Town, Seaport Village and downtown San Diego. We would certainly stay there again if we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Four days in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Harry W
Reviews.Content: The facilities were quite nice and had a certain charm. The room was clean and the restaurants had a wide variety of choices. The quality of the food was very good and the quantity was sufficient. The staff was very cordial and helpful. The proximity to the mall is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great week”
Reviews.Author: RoliQc
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for work so I may have a little bias because I didn't pay for my room. However, my stay at this resort was excellent. I had a large room on the 4th floor on the main tower. The room was clean and while it does not feel like a ''modern'' hotel, it had all the amenities that I needed. The gym is large and had a lot of equipment. It was not included in the price however (5$ per day). The whole resort seemed well maintained. Service was great in all respect, nothing to complain about here. I would agree that the value is certainly not the best, especially if you are not looking for a ''resort'' experience. However, since I had a flawless stay, it would be hard for me to give a bad review.

Reviews.Title: “Old and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Patricia B
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where these other folks stayed, they seemed like they were coerced into writing really nice reviews. Walking into the lobby reminded me of Grandma's house, it smelled like a museum and the furniture and decor was very old. My first clue should have been the old font style on the signage outside. Well, the hotel has been around since the 50's and no doubt, it has not been updated since then. Walking to my room looks like the walk through a cell block. Once in my room, the royal blue carpet is dirty, the bedspreads are faded and the underside is yellow, pretty gross. The bathroom's have never been updated, the fixtures are so old and scratch that it is hard to tell if it was chrome, copper or brass. The shower head touched my head and I'm only 5'7" tall. On the third night, a letter was left on my bedside table stating that they were turning off the water between midnight and 3am. Fine, no big deal until it was shower time, everyone in the hotel experienced a cold shower. The convention center was also very old, they served the luncheons on plastic plates with plastic utencils. Trellises, the restaurant onsite: food was decent, service was wonderful, but the waitstaff begs you to go to TripAdvisor to give them nice compliments. They provide you with a hand written business card with their name so that you can include their names. So Pati Muklevicz and Angelina Stephens, thank you for your fine service. And Robin for your hospitality during dinner. I think the cost of $147 for a room is way out of the range of value for what you get. I get more value spending $100 at the Holiday Inn Express. Parking is $8 per day, I guess that pays for the attendant that let's you out. I think the General Manager needs to go to a Vegas Hotel to see what you actually get for $147 per night, I think he would be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Darryl C
Reviews.Content: Great stay, hospitality and ease of checking in and out. Parking is ample and close to rooms which makes it easy to get in and out. Thanks for a great nights stay

Reviews.Title: “Great night away”
Reviews.Author: 27BDH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great night at Town & Country in December after a company event. Our room was clean, large and met our expectations thoroughly. The grounds are always very well kept and beautiful, and the location is extremely is to get to with plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: L I
Reviews.Content: The holiday banquet we attended went extremely well. The service and attention to detail provided a flawless experience. The rooms were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: EPaul423
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience at the Town and Country Resort. From the extremely efficient check-in process to the high quality banquet dinner and attentive service staff to the amazingly comfortable guest room. I highly recommend the Town and Country for any group/conference looking to hold a convention/meeting/event in San Diego or for the individual traveler. I know it will be a very successful and memorable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: N S
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more pleased with the service received at the T&C. The room was a little outdated and the painting of the little girl is a little creepy. That being said, still a nice property with plenty of things to do and in a stellar location.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale accomondations and services”
Reviews.Author: Margaret G
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot now since we are newly retired, so the past year we have spent many a night in hotel rooms. On our visit to see our daughter, we chose Town and Country for its convenient location. From check-in to checkout, we had a positive, pleasant experience with staff and services. The room was spacious and clean with a patio overlooking the well maintained property with plenty of food options. It was soooo nice not to be disappointed by your hotel stay when you travel. I do commend all the effort the Town and Country takes to keep their facility one you would want to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: vickie h
Reviews.Content: Though the room decor could benefit from a little updating, the staff was truly outstanding. My colleague and I recently spent several days with T&C while in town for a conference. From the front desk staff, AJ at the bellhop desk, and especially Pati, who not only served us a wonderful meal at Trellises, but gave us great advice for things to do during our small amount of leisure time, they were the best all-around hotel staff I've met in my life! Kudos to the entire staff! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Be”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: Our organization just got back from another fantastic conference at the Town and Country. What makes this property different, besides how lush and welcoming the outdoor areas are, is the people who work here. Mark Yunker, our convention services manager, was fantastic. But, so was every staff member we encountered. From management, to housekeeping, to the whistling gardeners we would come across in the morning. Though it is hard to be away from home for two weeks, the Town and Country helped to make us feel like part of their family.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!!”
Reviews.Author: Christine E
Reviews.Content: My trip to San Diego, California was made most memorable by my stay at the beautiful Town and Country Hotel. The surroundings were magnificent and most exhilerating. The staff were very helpful, courteous and friendly. Everything was carefully provided that I needed. I would encourage anyone to stay at this wonderful hotel. I hope to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Asphaltman
Reviews.Content: We were attending the Pavement Live Expo in Dec, and I had read some pretty bad reviews about this place, so I was very skeptical. I go to SanDiego often, but had never stayed here. I wanted to stay here since our show was here, and it would avoid the commute from another hotel. Several people brought the reviews to my attention, which of course freaked me out. I ended up booking another hotel as well, just incase this property was as bad as some of the reviews. Well, long story short, I think things have changed, because I ended up canceling my backup, and spending the week at t&c. Service was excellent, the staff couldn't have been friendlier. We were allowed to check in early, and given a room in the back tower. Parking was also reduced to 5 a day, which was much easier to swallow compared to the normal 14. Our room was very clean and nice. I was actually so surprised by how nice it was I began calling and texting others that knew I was worried about it. The property grounds were very beautiful that for time of year. My only real issue were the on site restaurants, their quality and price points. We ate as a group one evening at Trellises and found the service to be very slow and the food quality to be five out of ten, despite a very expensive menu. We at The Terrace every morning and found it to be very expensive with the quality being near or less than Denny's. Aside from the food, we had an exceptional time, and hope our convention returns there next year. I think changes have been made and continue to be made, nd as such T&C is now one of my favorite SD places to stay. I would like to see the room prices a little lower, they seemed expensive compared to others near it. Oh I forgot to mention that is is very close to the mall and a trolley stop that takes you right to old town. This property would be great for families given the location and large property. Thanks T&C for a great experience.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Convention Services! Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Dana F
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at the Resort, both for work conferences (that we were running). We worked very closely with the Convention Services and Banquet staffs and were extremely pleased- I would like to give a special shout-out to Mark Yunker, who went above and beyond to keep our group happy at all times. Moving rooms, making sure we had outdoor heaters, umbrellas on the one rainy day, available 100% of the time. See you again in a couple of years!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Site & Service for Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: MxAnn
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend for convention planners! I am a novice event coordinator but the T&C staff made me look like a pro. We needed three large meeting rooms with special requests for computer & electric cabling. The pre-planning was done expertly by Jim & staff so when we arrived the set-up was just as we requested. Niki in Conv. Services was very organized & attentive addressing every need ensuring our event was highly successful. Lauren worked with us on catering to stay within our budget. Kristin in Sales provided the detail and expertise to match our needs perfectly. Every employee was friendly and helpful. The property is great for your meeting attendees. Location is ideal for airport pickups within 10 minutes and a tram available to downtown. Hotel rooms are slightly dated but very clean and comfortable. Property offers great outdoor spaces with water fountains, table & chairs, pools in a well groomed garden setting. Great quality and delicious food served at on-site restaurants. Fabulous mall just behind property. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Carl W
Reviews.Content: I was on a quick trip and went to the Town & Country. If you've never been there, it would be a pleasant surprise at how beautiful the place is. It's not like going to the usual hotels with just a parking lot and swimming pool. The entire grounds are beautifully landscaped and looks like a tropical resort. I had lunch poolside at their Trellis' Restaurant. My server was Pati Muklevicz. She was very polite and attentive. The service was excellent as was the food. Two of the managers (Suzie W and Mike P) stopped by and greeted me asking how my stay was going. They too were very nice and well represented the hotel. I felt like a rock star!! The only thing missing was a free lunch!! My room was neat and clean. My only complaint is a "small" one. The TV was so tiny. My advice to the owners, ditch the armoire and get some bigger size tv's. All in all, I had a great experience and would highly recommend staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Location”
Reviews.Author: JoshPatz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Mission Valley with easy access to the malls and the trolleys that take you anywhere in San Diego. We stayed there for a couple nights for a short getaway and it was a good choice. We stayed in a tower room, which was spacious and clean, the restaurants had a wide array of choices and were reasonably priced. The gardens and pool areas were immaculately maintained and created a very relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere. I would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds-Great Location-Good Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Flufton
Reviews.Content: Located in Mission Valley area on hotel circle. Hotel circle is the frontage roads on both sides of Interstate 8 which runs from the coast on the west out eastward to the mountains and deserts. All the hotels here are a few miles inland from the ocean so there are no scenic views of classic San Diego beaches. To make up for the lack of view the Town and Country has made their property an oasis of gorgeous landscaping. The location is very good for proximity to all attractions in San Diego. 3 minutes to Old Town, 10 minutes to Sea World, 10 minutes to Balboa Park and the Zoo. Just behind and adjacent to the Town and Country is the Fashion Valley shopping mall--literally walking distance. There is a trolley station right there, too. You can hop the little red trolley and go to Old Town, Down Town to the Gas Lamp Quarter, and transfer to the line that runs all the way to Tijuana, Mexico if you want to... and back for just a couple of dollars. One of the best things about this hotel is it's restaurant called Trellises Garden Grille. The food is fantastic and the ambiance is wonderful. On weekends there is a little live music trio and all the locals come in to dance. (It's an older crowd.) All in all a great place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Experience in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: GigifromGA
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property and it blew me away. It has a lot of different sections, so know what you like before you book. The first time, I stayed in one of the single or double level rooms. I didn't like them because the door and window open on to the main 'street' which made it easy to hear people walking outside. Once I moved to the Royal Towers, though... much better. I liked having that 'hotel room' feel, with a balcony. But it was really the staff who made my trip special. Check in was quick. If you are a business owner, I definitely recommend signing up for their Executive Star club. It's a great deal and includes shuttle transport to and from the airport, wireless internet and daily breakfast for two. They checked me in promptly. I do wish they had the vouchers for the shuttle driver right at the front desk when I arrive because I felt badly that he had to wait (with other customers in the shuttle) for them to get it. Other than that, check in was great. They have a courtesy shuttle within a 2-3 mile radius. And with the largest mall in San Diego right behind the property... no problem. The bellman/valet dropped me off at Target and they came back and picked me up when I finished. When I called for down pillows instead of foam, they were delivered promptly. I needed a refrigerator for my medications and even though they couldn't guarantee it in advance, they were able to get it to my room within 30 minutes of my arriving. The staff and service was great. I did not use room service due to my strict diet, but my friend did. She was disappointed with the breakfast. Overall though, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Poolside Room”
Reviews.Author: ArdyceP
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego this past weekend to visit family and were very pleased with our decision to stay at the Town & Country. A kind bellman helped us find a parking spot close to our room. We were placed in an elegant room right across from one of the 3 pools, which was great for the nice weather San Diego had over the weekend. The large four-poster king bed and bay window were more than we could have asked for. The room was clean and the grounds are so well kept, recently renovated I'm sure. I imagine there would be roses everywhere had we not come in January. The staff at the Front Desk was very helpful in helping us find a location to eat breakfast at one of the many restaurants at the hotel. we appreciate Lauren Petersen for helping us book our room and we will definitely be returning to the Town & Country on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Frozen in Time”
Reviews.Author: superroadtripper
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if I should give this place a 2 or a 3...here's why. I stayed here for work...so I didn't pay for my room. If I had have been paying my own money I would have been very disappointed because this hotel is not at all modern or luxurious. My idea of a great hotel is one that is decorated in a modern fashion and "wows" you with little extras, and this is not that place. It is frozen in the 80's at some point. It reminds me of a hotel museum. In fact, we kept saying "this place must have been something else in it's day." It's super clean...I'll give it that. It's cleaner than some "modern" hotels I have stayed at in the past. I wasn't grossed out to stay there...I just kept thinking "it's clean and it's free!" Also, it's right by the transit line and it's very easy to get around from there. They could improve by doing a complete reno on this place...but in the meantime they should remember that the small things make a difference. They need to have small fridges in the rooms and they need to have safes-they have neither. Perhaps, some complimentary bottles of water or something special for the guests. Also, they charge $5 per day to use the gym and that's just cheap. Overall, if you stay here for a conference and you're not paying for it, you'll do just fine. But, if you're paying your own money and you want a nice place...keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake”
Reviews.Author: 101Traveler101
Reviews.Content: It’s like a huge Laquinta Inn. The property is very old and needs to be updated. The doors to the hotel rooms lead directly to outside and not an enclosed hallway. The flower upholstered white chairs and green carpet was in no way contemporary or even modern. None of the rooms had a wetbar nor a microwave. None of the lecture rooms/halls are connected to the Royal Palm Tower, so if it’s raining you’re stuck walking outside. And finally, the wireless internet connection is worthless. It’s a poor signal, slow, and not reliable which is very frustrating for business travelers like myself. Depending on the time of day or maybe your location on the property, it may work for 15 minutes. I can’t wait to go home. The staff is nice (hence the 2 star rating and not 1 star)

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed at Town and Country Resort. I stayed for one week on business.I must say the staff was friendly and the room and the grounds are well kept and extreemly CLEAN! I took advantage of the many dining options they have on the grounds. If you stay at Town and Country I would recomend Kelly's Steak House IT WAS AMAZING!! I have ate at all the best Steak Houses in the country and thier prime rib special (15 bucks!!) is as good as any that I've had. Our server's name was Melody and she was nothing short of a pleasure! she was funny, hospitable and kind! If you stay (worth it) be sure to check out Kelly's steak house on Tuesday night (that's when they have that prime rib special) and I bet you can't say I told ya so! Ask for Melody and you'll see why we enjoyed the experience that much more!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: kortkass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country last year and am back again now. It has large rooms and is very clean. I love the firm mattress and the warm pool. It is nice to have a few options to eat at on the hotel grounds and that it is so close to the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings!”
Reviews.Author: EVGR
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if I will stay here again or not. My best advice is to be sure and stay in one of the towers or be careful if you get one of the garden or ground level rooms. I had to ask for a transfer as there were people walking past and chatting after 11 pm and I had been up very early on the east coast. Then I was awakened at 4:30 with a food cart going by. I was transferred to the Royal Palm Tower and then slept very well. Internet was weak. Hotspots near restaurants so you could either wait on it in your room or find a hot spot. Bellman were exceptional! Desk staff as well. TV repairman came right away and took a few minutes but found the TV had to be reset and then had no more problems. Room was fine but it would have been nice to have drapes over the windows as it was very bright with the light outside the window at night. I did have my sleeping mask so that helped. There was a curtain rod but no curtain. Otherwise the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Tuna melt to die for......”
Reviews.Author: BevTrips101
Reviews.Content: I am back in San Diego at the Town and Country Hotel. I have been looking forward to coming back for many reasons one in particular is the wonderful treatment my team and I receive from Mark Yunker and his staff, they are optimal professionals. We feel like this is our home away from home and would not make it through this meeting without their dedication and hard work. Another reason I love coming to this hotel is the tuna melt from the Terrace Cafe. It’s a must have if you are at the hotel or in the vicinity. It is delectable. Your experience will be even more enjoyable if you get Tyler Le March as your waiter. He is the epiphany of a waiter. I will be having the tuna melt every day and will take some home with me. I just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: SandyS123
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have stayed at this hotel in years and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. It looked like the rooms were recently updated, room was spacious, Air Conditioner actually worked well and circulated through out the room including the restroom. Hotel staff was very nice and room service was prompt. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gardens”
Reviews.Author: travel4funRA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Tower Room with a King Bed. The room was very spacious. If you like a firm mattress you will like this one. This hotel is very convenient to the Light Rail and also the Valley Fashion Mall. They are both located across the street from the hotel. I have to say that the Buffet breakfast is not all that great. Not many choices and the food was average at best. The grounds are really well taken care of. So many trees, roses and other beautiful flowers. Very nice to walk the property and enjoy the beautiful outdoors. The pools are really nice. I would stay here again. The hotel is also close to the interstate and makes it easy to get to and from.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable after a long drive”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely, comfortable room after a long traffic drive. I was disappointed to find that I had a shower only room, and I was hoping to take long awaited bubble bath. My treat while on business travel! Oh well, everything was fine. Breakfst in Trellises was also very good, I have even re-created one of their signature breakfast entrees for my family! Lovely room, convenient to my meeting, and delicious food! Great find after a long drive.

Reviews.Title: “look for more modern”
Reviews.Author: paul r
Reviews.Content: The ground s were nice ,,parking is a mess, restaurants are dingy and food is subpar,, rooms are old and smallish,, one can do better with less money ,,overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit for Dixieland Jazz Festival”
Reviews.Author: Francis061
Reviews.Content: The most convenient place to stay if attending Jazz Festival. I was there in 2008 and recently for the 2011 Jazz Festival for 7 nights. Mostly the experience was good, except for first morning at breakfast in the Terrace Cafe. For the rest of my stay I had breakfast in the Trellises restaurant, and what a difference. The lady that looked after me, Angelica Stephens had a cheerful greeting for me every morning and went out of her way to please. The hotel is lucky to have such a person in their employment. I had a room on the 3rd floor in the Royal Palm over looking a swimming pool, which was a nice location. I will stay again at this hotel if attending the 2012 Dixieland Jazz Festival

Reviews.Title: “They do it well!”
Reviews.Author: Qbbroa
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity of going to San Diego for a conference last week and stayed at the T&C. What a great stay, very friendly people, facilities while not new very comfortable and clean!! Location is terrific, with the trolley service to downtown and gas light very convenient. Thanks for your work T&C.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I remembered”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: It has been several years since I stayed at this hotel. I had forgotten how lovely and convenient the resort is but I was reminded of this soon after my wife and I arrived. The room we stayed in had a good sized patio ovelooking one of the several pools on the property. The room was nicely appointed and quite spacious. The TV was an old style but the reception was adequate although I wish there were a few more channels to select from. The service personnel were very attentive and helpful. I plan to visit again within the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “Living on it's former Fame”
Reviews.Author: CUB45
Reviews.Content: I understand that this was once the conference facilities in the San Diego area that everyone went when having meetings.. The resort rooms are in need of some major renovations. The grouds are very nice but are getting dated and the conference center was adequate nothing great.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Resort - clean and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cruiser911
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort for a conference, the site is beautiful. The rooms are very outdated and are in need of a huge renovation. The pools and outdoor areas are well maintained. The food at the restarutaunts on the property was aveage.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tracy Y
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to set my girlfriend and I up for a nice girls night out in downtown San Diego but all the hotels downtown were booked for a conference. He ended up booking us at the Town and Country because of it's convenient location to downtown. The room was very and the bar at Trellace's treated us very well. We were planning on eating out downtown but the food at the restaurant looked so good we decided to eat there. It was a great choice. After a great night out downtown the bed at the hotel slept great. I would go back there anytime. The weather was not warm enough to go swimming but the pool area looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Only if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: thecarfamily
Reviews.Content: We were sent to the "tower," which is essentially a tall motel with about ten floors. We asked for a ground floor and were given one of the fourth floor. The rooms are a nice size, the television way to antiquated, and the AT@T internet service a constant problem. They charge extra for the service so make sure you can connect. The number they give you for service is useful, but time consuming. A hotel this size should do better. The hotel is large and the meeting room are widely spaced making getting from one place to another a real trial. The place is isolated from most of what is happening in San Diego. There is a nearby mall that is extensive. I would recommend that if you can get a deal on the room, $120 range, it is worth it. Anymore and look for nearby hotels and motels...there are a lot.

Reviews.Title: “1 Week was long enough”
Reviews.Author: RiccardoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: On entrance to this hotel it looks glorious.Flowers & ,greenery everywhere. I was there for the San Diego Jazz festival for the 3 rd. time and the conference centre suited the purpose. However the place is a bit run down The rooms are dull and the bathroom was tiny for 2 people with no shelf space. although there was plenty of hot water. In one of the restaurants the wrong food was served and in another the service was very slow and the buffet breakfast was cold. I was told by a staff member that that was the way the Americans liked it. !! The staff in Charlie's bar twice said you can have 1 game of pool then we are closing. It was 11 pm on a Friday & Saturday nights. Kelly's Steak restaurant was much better but the 10oz. Rib eye steak could not have been 5 ozs even allowing for shrinkage. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful except for one of the bellboys whole told us to get off the trolley at a station which was at least 3 miles from where we should have been. We had to walk for ages because the return trolley's had broken down and the area is so desolate that taxi's don't go to that area...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sassyjlopez
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with a great location! The people here were great and all the best shopping is directly behind the hotel. I didn't have to leave the resort because they had 3 restaurants that had outstanding food! I enjoyed the spa, salon and gym which the gym was bigger then typical resort gyms! I will stay here again, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: thedom1234
Reviews.Content: We went back to the Town and Country Hotel again this year. It was booked for a wedding party. The newly remodeled Venitian rooms are beautiful. The service and staff were outstanding. We arranged massages at the Bella Tosca SPA on property and it was AWESOME. The food in both, Trellesses Fine dining, and the Terrace Cafe by the north pool had super good food and service was very quick. We love the grounds property. it is extremely beautiful and the Rose gardens all over are OUTSTANDING. wish we could grow them like that here in Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Town and Country!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene L
Reviews.Content: I attended a wedding in San Diego and the guests stayed at the Town and Country. They had a cocktail party and some of the activities on the resort. Service was great, food was great, and overall we had a great experience even with a rainy weekend!

Reviews.Title: “JAZZ FESTIVAL 11/23--11/27--2011”
Reviews.Author: dike n
Reviews.Content: my wife & i attended the jazz festival and stayed here. the staff were very accommadating. the facilities were excellent. very clean, inside and outside

Reviews.Title: “Aida Orantes”
Reviews.Author: mfried3248
Reviews.Content: We ate breakfast at The Trellis Restaurant for 3 days and our server Aida Orantes was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Room Discription”
Reviews.Author: Travelertraveler55
Reviews.Content: Booked a King Size/ Non-smoking room. Was given a room with a barely Queen size Murphy Bed. Front desk attitude was insulting. We brought it to there attention and their response was to look up our room number and guarantee us that it was a King Size Bed. I sleep in a King size bed every night at home, which I believe qualifies me to know the difference. We were offered a coupon for a free cup of coffee that next morning. Probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but not great for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: MarylandAnglophile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a convention. The place is huge; it has a sort of campus, with two high-rise towers and a host of smaller garden and cabana style rooms. The staff was always pleasant, and the place was clean. There were roses all over the grounds and they were in bloom, so it made a beautiful setting. We were outdoors a good bit, which is nice in San Diego weather. The place has several bars and restaurants. The steakhouse was overpriced but Trellises was nice, and Charley's had the best beer selection. There was also a large mall in easy walking distance, right near the trolley and bus stations. You were nowhere near the beach, though, or any of the typical sightseeing destinations, so you need to allow for time to get around. They also charged a good bit per day for wifi, and it wasn't great wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Saul G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Town and with my wife and the hotel was awsome experience for me and my wife The staff were so friendly . The grounds were so beautiful . My room was so clean and comfy. They had all the need that a couple might have on a travel. I am going to recommend this place to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay ,”
Reviews.Author: alicia a
Reviews.Content: My husband myself & our 2 children, only stayed last week for a friends wedding , the rooms were exactly as discribed on the web site , the resort grounds were very clean & tidy , No line ups at the reception counter we were greeted by pleasant reception staff who helped us with anything we needed , once all settle in for a few days we didn't see anyone apart from other hotel guest , the beds in our room felt like we were constantly sliding off so a few sleepless nights , the price of the rooms was gr8 as we were there with a group of 200+ friends for a wedding so we had cheaper rates , we had breakfast at the Deli Cafe one morning that wasn't nice at all .. eggs were dry and no bacon for a long time .. on the other hand we had a yummo brekky in the Trellises Grill and Pati our waitress was fantastic !! food was to fantastic all over dining was gr8 !! one evening our bride and groom to be hosted a Aussie night for the australian guest also held in the Trellises Grill the staff on the evening all dressed for the occasion and were all fantastic , the only thing that was quite annoying was no microwaves in the rooms the heat baby bottle or baby food and no bar fridge to keep baby items cool also , apart from that we enjoyed our stay ,

Reviews.Title: “A Large Hotel with Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: Ted R
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Chapter of the Sons of the American Revolution recently hosted its State Board of Managers meeting, which required extensive dining,, meeting room, and hospitality facilities. Our advance team planning the event was immediately impressed with the T&C's friendly Event Planners, who were able to meet all of our requests at a very competitive cost. The real surprise was the helpful, friendly and courteous treatment we received from EVERY employee, whether they had anything to do with our meeting or not..This says a lot about their management who are able to inspire their employees at all levels.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant visit ,thank you!”
Reviews.Author: paperparker1
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Town & Country for years and have always had a wonderful time.The grounds are beautifully kept and the multitude of roses,camellias etc.seem to always be in bloom! How do they do that! The many restaurants are lovely, the food excellent, and the entire staff has always been helpful and courteous. And to top it all off,on this trip, the weather was more spectacular than usual! See you next time. - Barry Parker - paperparker1@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Town and Country Hotel Circle -- Amazing Visit”
Reviews.Author: Jerry B
Reviews.Content: Town & Country Resort on Hotel Circle My wife and I recently stayed at Town & Country Resort on Hotel Circle, in San Diego, California, and found the experience to be absolutely wonderful, relaxing, fun, and the Trellises Grille was superb. I'ld like to recognize Jose Cabrillo, at the Trellises, as we found Jose to be professional, most accomodating, and very pleasant at his job. We also met a very friendly spanish gentleman, Danny, who provided "room service" delivery on a 3-wheel bicycle. We found him very interesting, and he was just happy being of service at Town & Country. Very nice gentleman. Service is everything and they surpassed our expectations. We have stayed at the Town & Country many times over the years, but I want to take the time to compliment this resort for their beautiful grounds, flowers, exquisite landscaping, and very clean buildings. I read a review where a gentleman wrote some negative comments recently. I personally feel some folks can simply not be pleased. I do not agree with his comments. I assure you this location is most lovely, relaxing, and after five nights, we were truly saddened to depart and return to South Carolina. I cannot say enough good about the bungalow. We will make a point to stay in the bungalowes from this point on.
