Our room was large and comfortable, our bed was a king sized four poster bed, and we had a lovely garden view that was just stunning with lovely roses and Bird of Paradises everywhere. Amazing. The hotel location is adjacent to a fun mall that you can easily walk to by crossing a small bridge at the rear of the property (at parking lot). The property is in close proximity (approximately 1-2 miles) to Old Town for great food and shopping, and the best beach in San Diego "Mission Bay". Sea Port Village shopping is an experience all it's own, the Convention Center is very accessible, and the famous Zoo is world class. Personally, I think the Town & Country is a perfect location, with easy on / off driving to Interstate 8, Interstate 5 , or Freeway 163. There is also a trolley at the mall area for easy-to-use public transportation. We feel the property only makes great sense, and when you get into the resort property you feel you have gotten away from the feel of the big city. It's very relaxing. The pool area and spa are great, with lot's of room to enjoy the out of doors, and the weather in San Diego is absolutely perfect. Jerry & Karen Butler Aiken, South Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Town and Country several times and have enjoyed my stay every time. I work in the industry and therefore I can be picky when it comes to the amenties the hotel provides. Town and County did not disappoint. I love the size of the rooms and the amenites inside the room, (water, coffee maker and hair dryer) and I found the beds and the linens every comfortable. Walking through the gardens I felt like I was in an oasis, plus the on site Starbucks provided just the caffenine boost I needed daily. This was my 2nd time at Town and County this year and I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Needs Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Edward S
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful but the accommodations are very much in need of refreshing. I stayed in one of the low rise buildings. When I entered the room, I immediately noticed that the carpet showed lots of wear. The bedding was old and outdated and the mattress was very uncomfortable; I woke up several times during the night with a sore neck and back. The pillows were old and offered no neck support. The wi-fi was not usable in my room, the signal was not strong enough to be used. The bar smelled of mildew as soon as you walked into it. Once again, the staff was wonderful, but it was unpleasant to spend any length of time in the bar. The best part of the property was the location. The Fashion Valley Mall is walkable out the back of the property so shopping and restaurants were convenient. Additionally, there was a transit center with access to buses and the trolley for easy connection to other areas and to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: yuckyfaghag1
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here for a business conference and was disappointed. I am EXTREMELY happy I had gotten a discount on the room, it was not worth what they ordinarily charge. First of all, this "resort" doesn't have anything but pools. They are all outdoors and only one is heated. The restaurants on the property are extremely expensive, which is to be expected, but the food is nothing special. I paid 9 dollars for a small plate of hash browns and coffee. One cup! There is a "Starbucks" in the cafe, but they were using different coffee and flavors but keeping the Starbucks prices and names. The line for the cafe went out the door and around the pool, they would only help one guest at a time and wait for their coffee to be made. Our room was extremely small with an old tv, and smelled like it was 100 years old. They need some fresh air. The nicest part of the "resort" is the convention area, which has been mostly renovated. The rest is a 60s flashback. There are no hallways and the whole place is motel style. You have to pay for wifi and the gym. There is no complimentary breakfast. All of the restaurants served on dirty looking cups/plates and smelled gross. Our convention had paid for breakfast, which was 25$ per person per day. I am very happy I didn't pay for it, all we got is hard sausage and watery eggs. Although the property is in bad condition, the guest service is very good. We were satisfied with the maid service and the bellhop was very good with driving us around. Although the guest service and conference went well, you can't put lipstick on a pig. I would not stay here. It is not worth your money. Needs a renovation badly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaycee D
Reviews.Content: I visited San Diego with friends from work to go to Sea World. We chose to stay at Town and Country, and what a great choice. Check in was fast and easy the staff was kind and offered assistance if needed. Rooms were nice clean and beds comfortable. The hotel was close to Sea World, and close to a shopping mall and downtown San Diego. Will absolutley, stay at Town and Country again on my next visit to San Diego....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: josh m
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the San Diego area with a friend and we stayed at the Town and County Hotel. We arrived well before the 3pm check-in time but it was no issue at all and they checked us right in. The rooms were clean, spacious and odor free ( no stale smoke smell). The grounds are enormous with multiple pools and restaurants on the property. We ate dinner at Kelly's Steakhouse one of the night of our stay and it was great. The portions are huge, I had the T-Bone which was cooked perfect. From check-in to check-out the staff was friendly and helpful. The Town and County is a great place to stay and I will definetly be staying there again the next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Town and Country A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Consuelo B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit rough looking on the outside but the rooms, Trellis Hotel and Convention center were very nice inside, nice decor, clean and very attractive. The grounds are beautiful, well maintained. Pools, fountains are beautiful and clean. Lots of neat places to sit, read, relax. Beautiful environment. I was here on a business trip for 4 days at a conference and didn't get the chance to spend as much time on grounds as I would have like to. Trellises Restaurant is excellent, good food appropriately priced, excellent clean linens. Server Pati Muklevicz was courteous, attentive, excellent service. Kelly's was fair, food was way over priced. Staff was courteous. I would recommend this hotel. They are working hard to earn business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicky S
Reviews.Content: We were only going to be in town overnight for business and chose the Town & Country for it's proximity to everything. We checked-in easily, the receptionist was very friendly and courteous, as were the rest of the staff we encountered. Most comfortable beds we've slept in for a Hotel in a long time. Would definitely return and recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I expected some service and got none”
Reviews.Author: CASummers
Reviews.Content: I worked in the service industry for years, so I was particularly appalled by the astonishing lack of service at the Town and Country Resort Hotel in San Diego. I was rooming with a business associate who'd reserved the hotel room for the World Fantasy Convention the last week of October. Despite the fact that I was named on the reservation, the hotel front desk not only wouldn't let me check in until my associate got into town over five hours later, but was completely unconcerned when I told them I was about to have back surgery and needed to lie down after a seven hour flight. After my associate arrived, the damage was already done and I spent five days in absolute misery. The hotel pool did not have clear hours posted--in fact the only posted hours were next to one of the three entrances to the pool area and in complete shadow. So the first night when we went in to the pool to swim unknowingly after the pool was closed, we were alarmed to be confronted by armed security guards with their guns out. Then, despite trying every restaurant on the resort property, we received horrendous service in every one. In the bar designated as the convention bar, only one bartender was on duty. Not only was he slow, but he was also rude and incapable of keeping the bar or tables bussed. The low point of my experience came upon discovering that a gift basket had been sent to the resort for me on Thursday, October 27, and that the hotel not only didn't bring me the package, but didn't even bother to tell me it had arrived. I found out on my own (October 30) when the sender asked if I hadn't received it. A busboy drove me to the package room in a golf cart--much appreciated--and once I finally got to where the gift basket was, I was charged a five dollar handling fee. Yep--charged FIVE DOLLARS for NOT receiving a package. I found this experience to be the signature attitude of the hotel and its staff (excepting one bellman, one server, the maid service in our room and one front of the house manager) throughout the whole of my stay. No one seemed to care that the entire hotel was providing NO service at all. This hotel was an unmitigated disaster, and the entire business convention ruined as a result of their lack of care for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wisconsin travelers”
Reviews.Author: Muffy V
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay--very clean and well kept grounds--close by shopping mall and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanya T
Reviews.Content: We were only there overnight for a business meeting and had a great experience. At first we had neglected to inform them that we were staying two per room (had three rooms), and were placed in single bed rooms, but as soon as we called down they arranged for new rooms, sent the bellhops to us with new keys, who in turn helped us get situated in the new rooms. All in all a very pleasant experience, people were very friendly, plus hotel is close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: JenniferL10101010101
Reviews.Content: I arrived in an uncharacteristic downpour and was given, as requested, a room close to the convention center. However, the room smelled strongly of mildew (I have allergies) and had only a handicap accessible shower. I was longing for a hot bath. I called the front desk. I knew the hotel was really booked because I was there for a convention. I spoke to Sonia Coleman who found me another room, close to the convention center with a bathtub! Then she sent a bellman over with a cart to chauffeur me to my new room, keeping me as dry as possible in the continuing downpour. I felt like royalty. The response was prompt, more gracious than I expected and simply exceeded my expectations. This is a lovely hotel, many old fragrant roses, courteous staff and clearly a spot I hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven. Internet isn't free”
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for World Fantasy Con. For the price, it was okay, though "resort" is overstated. Think "motel" plus rose gardens. First, the positives: 1. The roses. They were blooming beautifully everywhere. The gardeners are getting it right. 2. The bell-boys. Friendly, prompt, helpful service. Arrived in ten minutes. 3. The server at Trellises restaurant at 9 a.m. on Oct 29th. We were a big group; she was cheerful and helpful and got the orders right. 4. Decent number of power outlets in the room, so I could plug in everything that needed plugging in. 5. Lots of clean towels stashed in the room, and a coffee-maker that worked (but only a small amount of supplies). The negatives: 1. A really unhelpful attitude at the front desk. I wanted a late checkout. They gave me 1 hour. Seriously. One hour. 'Are you sold out?' I asked. No. If they had been, they said, they wouldn't even give one hour. It was hotel policy. I asked for the manager, who may actually have been the same person because she brusquely repeated the same thing. All resorts charge, she said. No, actually they don't. I was at the Ballantyne in Charlotte recently, where they were perfectly gracious about it. (And that really was a resort.) 2. The front desk was so understaffed that it looked like there was *always* a line at the desk. Their attitude bordered on brusque. 3. NO FREE INTERNET. AA $10 per day charge for the Internet. It adds up over 5 days. Are you listening, all hotels? Charging for the Internet is ridiculous. This is 2011, not 1991. 4. The room lighting was really poor: two table lamps for a fairly sizable room with darkish decor. One had a loose contact. 5. No fridge in the room. Even motels have those. 6. The place felt a bit rundown, like a large estate whose owners have fallen on hard times. The convention was great, and a lot of things did work. I got the impression that the grounds-keepers, the bell-staff, the house-keeping staff are pretty good. The restaurants are understaffed (after hearing from other people at the convention, I completely avoided them except for the breakfast mentioned). And the front desk -- understaffed, under-trained, and with no understanding of what "hospitality industry" means. I understand that having a thousand people flooding in over a weekend can strain the system -- except, that's what this hotel DOES. Conventions. There was a geothermal convention before, and some church group after. They should be geared for tidal waves of guests, and they clearly are not. The other thing they seem not to recognize is that at conventions, word spreads. If a guest is unhappy, a hundred people know about it the same day. My own satisfaction with the hotel was adversely affected by the negative experiences recounted by my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever Happened to the Town & Country?”
Reviews.Author: JeanneTGC
Reviews.Content: I want to preface this review with some past history. In the mid-to-late '80's and the early '90's, my family and I used to go to San Diego for vacation at least 4-6 times a year, sometimes more. We stayed at the Town & Country 9 times out of 10. We LOVED this hotel. We've stayed there a few times since on San Diego trips -- have loved it still. I did then and have up until this last trip recommended the Town & Country to anyone asking me where to stay in San Diego, confident that I was recommending the best hotel experience at a great cost. So imagine my shock and dismay when I discovered that while the Town & Country still looks the same, it's gone downhill faster than a top skier at the Olympics. World Fantasy Con was at the T&C this year. That's 1,500 people, at a convention hotel that presumably can handle many more, since they weren't at capacity by any means. I could literally write an entire novel about this experience, so I'll list the "highlights". 1. The hotel refused to allow my roommate -- who has been on my reservation for 6 months, AND who, listed on the reservation, would be in either pre- or post-op from back surgery -- to get into our room before I arrived. She asked them to call me while I was on the road -- they refused. She offered to pay for the first night -- they refused. She was told they had to have my credit card and ID physically in their possession. They hadn't needed this when I made the reservation, but now, now it was vital. When she mentioned she was pre-surgery and by doctor's orders needed to be lying down for 50 minutes out of every hour, she was told this wasn't the hotel's problem and ignored. Ergo, she spent 5 hours outside on a pool chaise. Yes, it's San Diego. But at the end of October the Southwest gets cold, and it was indeed cold. And did I mention she's about to have back surgery? Yeah, great way to start your convention. 2. Service was abysmal. The bartender at Trellis' didn't know how to make drinks. Or clean glasses. Or clear tables. Neither did the 1 or 2 cocktail waitresses that were occasionally around. If you got good service from someone at one meal, said good service wasn't repeated the next time you saw this staff member. As near as we could tell, the staff were all working 11 and 12 hour shifts, doing several jobs, and therefore, none of them well. 3. Food was average to awful, and the restaurants ran out of staples like vanilla ice cream and mushrooms. There are 4 restaurants on site -- what property with that much food service runs out of vanilla ice cream, particularly when there's a convention? Especially when there were conventions immediately before, concurrent, and immediately after ours. 4. Everyone's a supervisor if they think you're unhappy. Every single time we asked for a supervisor, the person we asked always said, "I'm the supervisor." Either the entire staff is "in charge" at the T&C, or they've learned how to avoid getting complaints, by taking a complaint about their own awful service and not sending it up to management. 5. The beds are like slabs of concrete. I know some people like this, but no one I spoke with happened to be among this group, myself included. I realize upkeep on a large convention hotel is costly, but when your average Best Western has better beds, you know it's time to invest in a decent set of mattresses. 6. Complete lack of interest in guests' needs, enjoyment, etc. I've never stayed at a hotel of this size where literally no one gave a damn about whether or not the guests were happy. We were not happy, and it was obvious, and stated many times, and yet almost no one cared. 7. We were charged a "handling fee" for a package that was sent to our room. Only, we never got it. We only found out that a package had been sent to us on Thursday when the sender called on Saturday to ask if we'd enjoyed the gift. Upon searching, we were able to get our package, which was clearly marked. They didn't have change for a $20, though, so that had to be charged to our room. No one cared that they'd had a package of perishable items for 3 days without even trying to deliver it. It wasn't their problem, which is what we were told. 8. Pool hours are not clearly marked, especially if you're trying to go to the pool at night. Which we did. We were the only people in the pool because it was late at night, but the pool's location has excellent acoustics so we were discovered by two armed guards. How do I know they were armed? They had their guns out as they came to, I guess, shoot us out of the pool, since we were there after hours. After giving two dangerous women a stern talking to about how we were pool hours rule breakers, and after we explained that, since there were no signs anyone other than Superman could actually see, and asking if the pool was really off limits, why the heck were all the doors without pool hours signs on them open, they went of to protect the property elsewhere, guns at the ready. 9. The "hostess" at Kelly's Steakhouse refused to put two 4-tops together so my party of 7 could eat together. She told us to go to their bar and turned her back on us. We went into said bar. The hostess then sent about 20 more people in after us. The ONE waitress for the bar was, unsurprisingly, overwhelmed. The restaurant never sent in another server. One of our meals wasn't put in, and when it finally arrived, 1 minute before we were leaving, it was so well done it was like shoe leather. I could go on. And on. And on. Let's look at the few, far too few, positives. 1. Housekeeping was awesome. Our maid (Josephina) was excellent -- possibly the best, most consistent maid service I've had in years. Housekeeping was quick to handle requests and pleasant while handling them. 2. The grounds are still lovely, lush, and well maintained. Same for the pools. And the whirlpool. 3. Some servers heroically managed good service at least one time each, so I can point to a lunch at Trellis' (Angelica), a lunch at Terrace Cafe (Andrea), a drink at Trellis' (F&B manager, who, due to circumstances we were in at the time, we weren't able to take aside and speak to about our many issues with his staff), a front desk clerk (Jeremy), and the night manager (who was on, literally, her last night on the job when we spoke to her and shared all of our dismay) who all managed to give us some good customer service. Our most enjoyable meals, other than the ones where a T&C employee managed to give us the kind of service you expect at a resort/convention hotel? They were at Pam Pam's Restaurant and the Valley Inn Coffee Shop on the other side of Hotel Circle. Those are attached to the Day's Inn and the liquor store, respectively. But their food was good, their service excellent, and they were actually happy to see us and our money. And they weren't understaffed, and all of our food arrived at the same time and cooked perfectly. Go figure. Speaking of going, I'm saddened to say that I doubt I'll willingly go to the Town & Country ever again. Which is too bad, because I'm back to going to San Diego regularly again. But since all my fond memories are tainted by this experience, I don't want to taint my family's memories, so the Town & Country is off our list and we'll talk of it in the past tense from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Linda O
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful! The front desk clerks were kind, thoughtful, helpful. I can't say enough nice things about the staff throughout the weekend of a conference I attended. The room was exceptionally comfortable to me-beds, TV, balcony. The little things make a difference. Friendliness and helpfulness from everyone I met-housekeepers, dining room, valets, bellmen, I especially appreciated Socorro, Diego, Josie, and Orlando who helped me feel comfortable at a conference. For instance, Orlando drove a golf cart to help me and my bags get to the rooms. I enjoyed the pools. There are several different pools in various locations so that helped as far as helping people be comfortable. I really enjoyed the grounds and the location because we were able to catch public transportation easily for our times to sight-see. The food was great, too!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this beautiful resort was exceptional and it will certainly not be my last. The grounds were just beautiful, very well maintained. And the staff was very friendly and just couldn't do enough for us. From the reservation clerk to all the staff we encountered, they really showed that they value their guests. The room had 2 very comfortable queen beds and a spacious sitting area and a balcony overlooking the pool. The Terrace Restaurant was perfect for breakfast and we enjoyed a great prime rib dinner in their pub restaurant for a very reasonable $14.95! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: cattycurl
Reviews.Content: I had no idea what to expect upon my arrival to the Town & Country Resort Hotel. I knew it was close to the zoo and other San Diego attractions so I booked it at a great rate. It was an awesome stay! The grounds are beautiful with lush landscaping and tons of walking space. The bed was very comfortable and the sitting area was great for breakfast. There are several restaurants on site to choose from but our favorite was Trellises Garden Grille. Just a short walk from our room overlooking the pool. We decided to sit at the bar and I'm so glad we did. We had the best service and met the bar tender for the night, Rez. He had the best recommendations, made the best pear martini EVER and helped us decide on dinner. The food was top notch and the service from Rez was even better. We had a great weekend here at the Town and Country and will definitely come back. Several things within walking distance, short walk to the zoo, tons of food and Starbucks on site and a great spa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, but not for business”
Reviews.Author: Michael076
Reviews.Content: I was at the Town and Country Hotel Resort for 3 days for a conference at the attached Convention Centre. The property appears to be an aggregation of a number of older properties, and rooms range from one to two story motel type rows with either parking (at the front of the property),or a large courtyard (mid property) out front, to a tower with outside walkways (back of the property). The ones with parking out front are subject to noise of passing guests and vehicles. My room was one of the former and was quite OK (except for noise), even a bit more ‘homely’ than your average conference hotel. Beyond the parking areas are nice gardens, courtyards and walkways – which again was a good diversion from the Convention; families will like that part. There is an Avis office on site which is convenient. One large negative was the poor quality of wireless internet. For $5/day it’s an AT&T coupon service and a number of people complained about its slowness. I initially had a downstairs corner room which had no internet reception, so weak was the signal. I changed rooms and got a very variable service – very slow to OK, but never fast. Also, for a place that’s hosting possibly over 1,000 convention-goers, the eating choices are small and thinly staffed. Both breakfast and lunch usually involved long queues. One time, getting a coffee from the deli took 10 minutes. Overall, as a convention hotel it was a bit better than the usual soul-less hotel tower but I’m not sure if I’d want to stay here as a regular traveller, especially when there is a convention, due to the strain on facilities. And it’s no good for business unless the internet service improves.

Reviews.Title: “Yeesh!”
Reviews.Author: lumpy_the_great
Reviews.Content: This is an ancient, resort hotel. From the looks of the place, the last remodel was done around 78-82. I had a room in the big tower at the back of the property and the room was definitely a blast from the past. The dark blue carpet, dark wood furniture and the cinder block construction took me back to the days when I would be sleeing in on that blue carpet with my brother. If you wanted to wear your liesure suit and gold medalion you would fit right in. Someone told me that they intentionally kept the decor like this as some sort of retro Chic thing. I doubt it. I will say that the sheets were clean, the towels were clean and good quality and the room overall was clean and well kept. there was a funny smell like old cardboard or particle board in part of the room but nothing too horrible. These sort of places love to tell you how everything you need is right there on the property so you never need to go anywhere. And, if you like mediocre food, over-priced souvenirs and horrible, slow, awful , bad service then they are right. We ate at several restaurants on the property and the service was invariable slow and not particulary friendly. But that may just be because it was California. The food however was always mediocre at best and lousy was a more common adjective. There is only one reason you should stay here. And that is if your company sends you to attend a trade show in one of the big halls on the west side of the property. Even then you would probably do better renting a hotel downtown(I spent Friday and Saturday at the Sheraton for a comparable rate and a MUCH better stay) and driving in.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Diane C
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful grounds and good restaraunts. Right across the street from transportation which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: Drew M
Reviews.Content: My family was in town to visit so I spent lots of time at the hotel and it is an absolutely wonderful place to stay. It is as centrally located as possible, within walking distance to Fashion Valley Mall, close to my work and numerous attractions within the city. Very solid staff, friendly and always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: nia406
Reviews.Content: I was only there for a short time. The property seemed nice but the buildings were difficult to identify so navigating between segments of the conference was not the easiest. I did receive excellent service at breakfast from one of the servers, Pati Muklevioz. She really knows how to treat customers! I wish I could say that about the server I encountered the previous night.

Reviews.Title: “Make this your first choice”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Make this your first choice when in San Diego.The name of the resort says it all "Town and Country". Perfectly located near downtown and the airport as well as some major shopping but has an overall secluded,"country" feel when inside.The staff was excellent and more than informed on local events and things to do .The rooms were clean ,comfortable and well appointed.Overall warm friendly and knowledgeable staff. The breakfast buffet was a very nice treat with a great variety of offerings .It included everything from the traditional bacon and eggs to a fruit bar and a cereal selection for the kids. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this resort anytime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful time at the T & C. The service and accommodations are first class. The grounds are beautiful and vey clean. My wife is thankful for the short walk to the shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Rach093
Reviews.Content: We had booked three nights here, we ended up checking out before we even spent one night. The parking fee is 14 a night (if I remember correctly), they don't have any "extras", they do have eating establishments on the property, but if you are on a budget, this isn't feasable. I say- pay a bit extra and stay at a nicer place! The rooms are VERY outdated. They only have one heated pool and it was no where near our room. If you are only looking for a bed, this place will do, but if you want anythinge more- go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: SparkyStLouisMO
Reviews.Content: This is a old, beautiful,extremely well maintained property,heated pools a 10' X 20' hot tub. My only complaint is if you don't get a discounted parking rate, it is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: Karl W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at your resort and I just wanted to say that my experience at your property was beyond phenomenal. Robin Davis specifically went above and beyond to see that my stay and my experience at the resort was an experience like none other. Your food, hospitality, service, and overall experience in your main dining area was a ten out of ten and I just wanted to thank you for the wonderful experience I had. I also would like to give a special thank you to Robin for really making my stay at your resort a very special one and I look forward to visiting your property again when I come back out for work.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there was an option for "minus stars"”
Reviews.Author: K G
Reviews.Content: Horrible. Peeling paint, rust in the tub, food on the floor in the room when we checked in. Broken chair w/nails sticking out that took 3 complaints and 2 days to get them to remove it (they didn't replace it, just took it out). The maids would take towels but not replace with new ones. Lamps flickered, no fan in the bathroom. None of the outer doors have locks. When we complained about that we were told they have 24 hours security so we didn't need to worry about it. Everything was extra money, the fitness area, the business area, etc. We were there for a conference. If there is ever another conference there I will be staying off site at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable conference stay”
Reviews.Author: BeeceeBeach
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my stay here for a conference. My room is a little plain, but quiet and clean. The service is very pleasant and helpful. Dinner at the Trellis was quite good. The grounds are pretty. I was very worried after reading recent reviews, but everything has worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful San Diego~”
Reviews.Author: Gordon W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country on September 21st and later sent an email to Barbara thanking her for making my reservation and to let her know what a nice time away from the Arizona heat I had in beautiful San Diego. She recommended posting my comments online. I had a great visit with my cousins, while there for business. We sat on the patio enjoying the night time view overlooking the Town and Country property and pool area. I enjoyed breakfast in Terrace Cafe prior to leaving for my meeting. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I am giving Town & Country 4 stars for great follow up”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: My stay at Town & Country was mixed with highs and lows. Highs--beautiful pools and grounds, great meals and service at the Trellises restaurant. Lows--the desk clerk who wouldn't check my confirmation # and insisted I had not reserved a room in the Royal Palm Tower when I had a piece of paper saying I had. Too tired to argue, I went to the room she said I had reserved not knowing that I was getting a room in a bungalow hardly a stone's throw from US interstate #8. When I complained, I was assured I would be able to get a room in the Royal Palm the next day after 3 pm. When I opened the door to my new room, I could see by the open luggage that it was already occupied. I know this sounds like quite the adventure, but the bellhop Ador was a real gentleman and called the front desk. That's when we found out that there were 2 other people staying at the resort with the same name as I. They had given my room to one of the others and now I was a woman without a room. Ador did not stop until he took me back to the front desk and helped me get another unoccupied room-not on the highway. Thank you, Ador. The next day, a beautiful lady in registration Waneda helped me get checked into a lovely room overlooking the pool in the Royal Palm Tower. She also made sure my account was being billed with the correct person--me. I thoroughly enjoyed the rest of my stay--4 days in all. The Royal Palm is very close to the trolley and bus for getting around San Diego. It is also within easy walking distance of a major shopping mall. Another plus is that the rooms are reasonably priced. The grounds and flora are outstanding. When I returned home, I e-mailed Town & Country with my experience hoping that they would answer me but not really thinking they would. They did!! Thank you, Nancy and Suzanne for following up! They have apologized and assured me of staff retraining. I will go back and I am going back with my husband next summer. I can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Older property but nice.”
Reviews.Author: nanamol
Reviews.Content: The bellman were all very nice and helpful. I was with my 92 year old father and everytime we called for a cart to take us to another part of the resort, it was there in a few minutes. I do agree that the place is overpriced. But it does have an atmosphere that you will not experience at Holiday Inn Express.Loved all the plants. The rooms were clean, beds a little hard for me. No microwave or mini fridge. I would not choose this place again just to stay say on vacation but I would come back to a convention or conference if needed.

Reviews.Title: “It's All True”
Reviews.Author: Kathie C
Reviews.Content: I usually take these kind of reviews with a grain of salt, but in this case they are true. This hotel is overpriced and underserved. The only redeeming value is the rose bushes. Unfortunately, the restaurant garnishes every desert with a rose leaf. A rose petal would be prettier and edible, but that's just an example of how things here are just not quite right. My room was clean, but one friend got a room with a filthy Murphy bed - when's the last time you saw one of those? - and the other got a room with a non-working shower. I was the lucky 1 out of 3. It's a crap shoot. This place looks like the 1966 high school future city planners' first rough draft. To add insult to injury, wifi is $9.95/day. What country am I in?

Reviews.Title: “STRAIGHT OUT DISGUSTING/RUDE BELL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: j j
Reviews.Content: I returned from a convention at this hotel, what a horrible experience,first things when i arrived out of my shuttle i had to struggle with my bags into the lobby to my surprise there were 3 bellman and a lady just standing around. then by the time I got check in, the front desk girl rang for a bellman then i waited for 10 minutes for somebody to come.. when i arrive to my room, it was small, outdated ,and far from the convention center, the bellman informed my that I should call if i needed a ride.i decided not to, considering the horrible first impression the food in the restaurants were overprice, and just so so..I had to pay extra for the internet which didn't even work. and they actually have a fee to use the gym...THIS IS NOT A RESORT. they need to visit a real resort so they can see how one really operates. I will never return to this hotel ..

Reviews.Title: “Older resort; lacks amenities but lovely surroundings”
Reviews.Author: slhMinnesota
Reviews.Content: A convention I attended was held here in September. As a business hotel, it lacked amenities I would expect such as wireless internet that worked well from all rooms! I could only get good reception at the pool (not a bad thing actually, but annoying at 10 pm!) The health club cost $5 per day which I found ridiculous. Good thing the weather was good and I could walk and run around the facility. I stayed in a bungalow which I think is the nicest choice in the resort. It was only one story. The rooms were basic, clean but not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination. The carpet was stained and my bathroom was so small that my husband and I could not be in there at the same time. However, the gardens and surroundings were lovely - roses of every variety growing along gardens in every corner. There were also many pools, none of them crowded. The staff was uniformly pleasant, helpful and welcoming; greeting me everywhere I walked. This is a lovely facility for a wedding or party In fact several weddings were going on that weekend. It also is conveniently located. It is about 5 minutes to the beach, 5 minutes to Old San Diego, 10 minutes to downtown or the airport. We even took a sunset horseback ride on the beach, on the border of San Diego and Tijuana and the drive was about 20 minutes. Just know that your room will be small and many of the other buildings looked older and rundown, so ask for a bungalow room.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go to this place again”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this hotel. We stayed at the hotel as it was the host hotel and we did not know better. I would not stay there again. We got checked in quick, but when we got to the room we had reserved (a room in the towers with elevators), it was on the second floor of a little building with only stairs to get in to it. We stayed there as so hard to change rooms. The room was definately outdated. Looked like something my 80 year old mother in law would like. It did seem clean to me that is why we stayed. The beds were ok and the pillows were acceptable. The TV was very small and you could not really see it well from the beds. Would have been nice to have a refrigerator and microwave. At other hotels of this price you would get this. I did not like the convention set up. It was very spread out and hard to find rooms. It was raining one day so very hard with having to go around the resort and walk. We got soaked! I would not want to go back to a convention there again. Eating at the resort was not the best either. The service seemed to be really slow. We ate at Trellises for breakfast some times and it was slow. The omelettes were great though! Definately not a good resort for people with disabilties. There are lots of steps and length of walking. The pool was pretty but we did not try it. Would be good for kids. The good thing about the resort is about 10 min from aiport ($20 with taxi). It is located right next to the trolley system. This is a great and cheap way to get to many places in San Diego. Also, the Fashion Valley mall is right behind the hotel and has places to eat and shop which we enjoyed. Overall, i would not recommend this place to people to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you can!”
Reviews.Author: ABUPALACESUCKS
Reviews.Content: I was booked here in early October of 2011 as I was attending a conference here. I checked in and while I was doing this, an elderly man walked up to the desk and said he just went to his room and it s unacceptable and he wanted his money back and did not want to stay here. I should have heeded his warning but decided to chck for myself. I go to my room which was in the newer "better" Royal Palms Tower. The room was probably really nice in the 1980s. Still had a crummy boxy picture tube television which did not have a clear picture. Room smelled bad and looked dirty. All this for $159 a night! I tried calling the front desk 3 times from the room phone and the call kept on not going through. Needless to say, I went back to the front desk and asked for the manager and told her about the room and said that I didn't want to stay here and wanted to know if I could cancel my reservation and she agreed to do it and even waived the one night charge for canceling the reservation. She was great and very accomadating. It really didn't seem to bother her too much that I wanted to leave and she was a pleasure to deal with. I'm sure she deals with this a lot. Bottom Line--- don't waste your time or money. There is an excellent Courtyard by Marriott across the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: BLFootInMouth
Reviews.Content: If I wrote everything that this hotel did wrong during my stay it would wipe out tripadvisor's storage farm. To get everything wrong as consistently as the Town and Country does - they have to be trying. No way could this much badness be an accident. Sleep on a park bench before you stay here. A few highlights, I mean lowlights. The rooms are very old, dingy, and dated, all beat up. All rooms are entered from the exterior - there are no interior hallways. The headboard for my bed didn't actually reach to the floor. It was too small so it had been bolted to the wall. The alarm clock was hidden behind the TV with the cord wrapped around it (so off) - I found that it on the last night of my stay. TV was blurry, I don't know how they managed that with cable. It was perfectly alright for a hotel worker to stroll along the hallway at 5am with a noisy cart - who needs sleep? The bathroom door would not close - it was one of those sliding doors that had come off the runners years ago - which is probably an apt metaphor for the entire property. No safes in the rooms, great for a conference venue where everybody brings a laptop. No ramp to get into the tower unless you walk all the way round the back. Conference logistics were anything but logical - meeting rooms downstairs, exhibition halls and break rooms upstairs, not reachable without going outdoors (it was raining of course). The "high-speed" internet timed out on simple Google searches. The food was even worse. Kelly's is the worst restaurant I have eaten at in a very long time. After being seated we waited 30 minutes for someone to say, "I'll be with you in a few minutes." Drink orders were taken, then another 30 minutes later, food orders. When we complained the server was extremely rude. The food was abysmal - $25 filets and such that were not as good as you can get at Denny's. My "demi glaze" was actually a runny soup. My neighbor's ribs were "horrid". Last night there I ordered a hamburger and a beer from room service. It arrived 95 minutes later. 1 hour and 35 minutes for a hamburger! I called twice to ask about the delay and was assured both times that it was on its way. It wasn't of course, which was easy to tell because my receipt had the order time printed on it - after my call. The room service was also rude to me when I asked why a hamburger was taking so long. Everything about this hotel screams cost cutting and being cheap. Calling a place a resort that is (a) in the middle of town, (b) has nothing but a pool, and (c) has consistently below standard service and amenities - is just wrong. This was not an individual bad experience. I was at a conference with about 150 colleagues and it became a running joke how bad the place was. We were calling people who hadn't arrived yet and pleading with them to book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!! Worst resort I have ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HST_Gal
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Town and Country Resort for 5 nights and wished we were somewhere else most of the time we were there. The front desk staff were not very welcoming, and although we arrived early, we were told our rooms would be ready by 3:30pm. We checked back with front desk staff at 4:30, and only one of two rooms were ready. It was 5:45 pm before the second room was ready. The front desk staff did not apologize for the inconvenience at all. The rooms were not what we had registered for nor confirmed. We registered for rooms with king beds and both of us actually ended up with rooms that had two double beds. Both rooms had 1 inch gaps between the bottom of the door and the flooring, which would have allowed insects and small critters to enter the room. As a result, we both stuffed towels and pillows under our doors each night to avoid such scenarios. One room did not have a hair dryer available, and when one was requested, it took nearly 55 minutes before it was delivered. When my friend attempted to use the hairdryer, there were sparks coming from the plug of it. The bathtub in one room was not clean – there were rings of soap remaining from shampoo bottles utilized by previous occupants. The Kleenex box was empty and was not refilled for two day and the décor was extremely dated - like 1980s!! There were no desks in the rooms for working, and as a resort that is accustomed to hosting business conferences, the rooms should all have proper desks and appropriate chairs conducive to business. The small round table and chairs are absolutely not conducive to effective working conditions for business personnel. There were no extra blankets available in the room which is especially critical since neither the heating nor air conditioning units were in working order. The water bottles in both rooms were not replenished after being consumed by occupants 2 and 3 days prior. There was no refrigerator or mini bar/snack bar available in rooms which is absolutely standard at every other "resort" I have stayed at. A proper resort would never offer a combo shampoo/conditioner product, but rather would offer spa quality personal products. As a result, my collegue and I went out and purchased shampoo and condictioner for use during our stay. One of our rooms was located next to a housekeeping room, and staff was extremely loud and disruptive beginning as early as 5:30am. So rude and inconsiderate!!!! Numerous carts were being pushed around at all hours of the day and night by staff, and was extremely disruptive. Many conference attendees had the same complaint. The security was inadequate to assure the safety of hotel guests. While this is a large complex, the resort could and should implement some basic safety precautions, such as having security personnel on duty and walking the premises, installing entrances that require use of card keys to enter hotel areas. Anyone could walk onto this property at any time without being stopped by personnel or card key access points. The food and service quality at each of the hotel restaurants was substandard. The staff no more than handed us our menus, and they proceeded to ask us if we were ready to order. When we requested another minute or two, they walked away and did not check back with us for nearly 10 minutes. Despite our attempts to get their attention, they continued to talk with other restaurant staff, and were oblivious to our attempts to wave them over/get their attention. Once we got our food, we repeatedly waited in excess of 15-20 minutes before our wait staff checked in and gave us our bill. There was a fitness center on the property but we were told that cost extra. That is ridiculous to charge extra for fitness center...especially at a resort! To top this ALL off, when we went down to check out, we weren't even asked how our stay was which I guess is not surprising b/c Im sure they are tired of hearing from guests how bad it is. They also didn't even offer to help us out to a cab with our big bags and is not easy to get out the door of that lobby. Appalling!!!! This entire property is in dire need of updating and a general maintenance overhaul! I would NEVER return to this resort and will not recommend this facility to any friends or colleagues, nor for any future conferences. I hope they take this feedback seriously.

Reviews.Title: “are we still in the 70s?”
Reviews.Author: pcalhoun
Reviews.Content: I was there for a convention. Never again. I'm sure at one point (say the early 60s) it was a great resort, but it's in need of a makeover. First the toilet seat was filthy. I wonder if any cleaning was done in the bathroom. The phone is so dirty that I cringe when I had to use it. The fluffy rug had remains from a previous decade. But they had decent toiletries. Even if I had to I'm not sure I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Was probably a "jewel" in it's day...”
Reviews.Author: vacationbarbie2
Reviews.Content: First, the pros: This "resort" has great meeting space which I think is why it is still in existence. The staff members were friendly. They have porters that will take you and your luggage to your room in a little golf cart. It is convienently located next to the MTS trolley system and Fashion Valley Mall where you can get reasonably priced food. The fitness center has 3 new treadmills and 2 clunkers that still work though. They also have a rack of free weights, ellipticals and exercise equipment for strength training. The cons: The rooms and property need serious updating. Perhaps they should use the money they charge you for internet use ($9.95 a day) or the $5 I paid for ONE EGG at the Terrace Cafe to go towards renovations. I stayed here to attend a conference so it was convienent for me to be on site, however I would not stay here if I was vacationing and spending my own money. I read the trip advisor reviews prior to going so I was not disappointed in what I saw...I knew what to expect. The blue carpet in my room and the hallways needs replacing. They charge you $5 a day to use the fitness center. Bottom line, stay here if you are attending a conference, otherwise don't waste your $150 plus a night.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: pwdigwald
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel Sept. 22-25 and I should have paid attention to the reviews on this website before staying here. When I made the reservation, I explained I have asthma and I couldn't walk far. Since the grounds are spread out with multiple buildings, I was concerned. The reservation clerk assured me she had put me in the Palm Tower where all the rooms have been upgraded and it was the closest building to the Convention Center. When I checked in, I was put in the building furthest from the Convention Center facing the freeway. I was told they were booked solid & that was the only room available. Really??? When I opened the door to the room, the smell almost knocked me over. Not sure if it was sewage? or urine? But, it was nasty. Room was very small with too much furniture. Chair was stained, closet doors were off the track, luggage rack was in the closet, but you couldn't close the closet door with your suitcase in there. Couldn't get to the coffee pot unless the closet door was closed. Everyone at the conference I talked to was complaining about the rooms. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was very helpful”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in June for a homebrewer's conference and finally getting around to writing this review. I would like to thank Katie Wingo and Nancy Nungary of the staff for helping make our stay much more enjoyable! There was an issue with the reservation due to booking with a third party and these ladies fixed everything and went above and beyond the call of duty to make everything right! John T. Madison, AL

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleased. Great location. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sweethearttx
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience at the hotel. The rooms were clean, and the property is located right next to the metro rail which was perfect. You just walk right over there and catch the train or bus. We didn't need a car and we went all over San Diego. Breakfast buffet was adequate. Pillows were a bit hard to me but my boyfriend and our friend didn't mind them, so it's all relative. Yes some of the pictures are a bit weird in the rooms and halls, but they're just pictures! I found it to be a nice stay and would recommend it. Would stay there again while in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE... please don't stay here you will ruin your trip to a gorgeous place!”
Reviews.Author: happytotravel788
Reviews.Content: It is unfortunate that this conference was held at such a below grade place. San Diego is a gorgeouse place once I ventures outside this location. This place Is far from a resort, the grounds and rooms are dates and dirty. They tell you to leave you plates from room service outside on the floor..street level outside (beware of movement thoughout bushe at this motel (resort) The fact that they charge you a 50 dollar fee if you leave early is a sign to leave. If you took the time to read this for your own good do not stay here I wish I would have known better before I arrived..I left early and paid there fee and I would never return or recommend this to even my enemy. Very sad and unprofessional establishment and they should be ashamed of the pictures they are representing on there website! The photos on there website are no way close to representing this place up close in person. It really is sad that this place ruined many guest stay at this large conference

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: T D H
Reviews.Content: Trellises has great food - but the highlight of the place is the server, Angelica Stephens! She gave exceptional service and was extremely kind and sweet. Her name suits her. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “"Garden Rooms not up to par"”
Reviews.Author: Annette O
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference Sept 22-25. Check in was quick. I walked to the far right side of the complex to a 2 story building, where my room was located on the second floor. My room faced the interstate, and traffic noise could be heard at night. The worst part was the room's smell. When I first walked into the room, it was awful. It smelled like someone had peed on the carpet, or there was a lot of mold/mildew in the room. Perhaps this particular room had not been used in months. I don't know but it smelled bad. The hotel was overbooked, so I could not change rooms. I did not have a car, so it was difficult for me to change hotels and still attend the conference. Several other attendees were complaining--some moved to different hotels, some were finally moved to the tower. I was never able to change rooms. The tower rooms from what I was told were better than the garden rooms. My garden room was a little dated, and the bed was not that comfortable, but that I could handle, if the room did not smell. After high use of air conditioning during the day and heat at night, the smell cleared somewhat, but everytime I went outside and came back in the smell was there. The pools were nice--there are 2 larger ones and one smaller one. The grounds are well maintained. Many people went to the mall which is a short walk from the hotel. I had spotty internet access, perhaps due to me being in an older building.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: supermanmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week beginning Sunday, Sept,18. After reading the reviews, we were concerned. Check in was quick and the lobby staff were nice. We parked and found our room. Yes it was outdated with blue carpet and weird prints on the wall but it was roomy and clean. Our room had a nice large balcony over looking the pool. The bathroom was nice and roomy however the lights were a bit dark when first turned on. The bed was firm, but we both slept great all week. The downfall in the room were the pillows: they sucked, but we still slept good. We ate at the Terrace Cafe, Charlies, and Trellises during our stay. Breakfast at the Terrace Cafe: we had the breakfast buffet a few times and thought the price was pretty good at $14.50. The cheese danishes were really good. We also had cafe mochas and hot chocolate and cookies at the little cafe in the evening, and service was always good. We had one lunch at Charlies and shared the burger sliders: nothing wow. We had read reviews about how great Trellises was, so our last morning we had breakfast. Very expensive: we thought our $30 buffet was a little high (for 2) but we spent close to $60 for 2 at Trellises. The selling point: we both had the eggs benedict and wow!!! they were great. Had a sticky bun, cheese danish, and juice/milk with both. Angelica was an awesome server. She was so funny and wonderful to be around. The grounds were amazingly beautiful. They should rename the resort the 'Rose Resort'. The pool was disappointing because we read it was heated: still way too cold for us, but the hot tub was something we enjoyed several evenings while there. Very close to the Fashion Valley Mall: right behind the resort with a quick walk. The trolley stop was also right behind and for two people who have trouble with public transit, we did very good. A bit of a warning: watch your bill carefully. They tried to overcharge us for parking and the internet bundle, but were quick to fix it. Overall a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CVespe
Reviews.Content: Town and Country is my go to hotel when staying in San Diego. As soon as you drive up, you feel like you're family. The rooms are comfortable, cozy, and wonderful to stay in (no matter which tower or bungalow). The restaurants are great, and they are convenient. The location is wonderful too. I will always stay at Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “STILL A BARGAIN-PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: Recently returned to T&C for a one week stay. STILL a wonderful facility with the most pleasant surroundings. Tree's, shrubs, and above all the flowers, especially roses are everywhere on the vast grounds. From the greetings by bell men in the driveway, the warm welcome from the front desk personnel, the pleasant housekeeping crews, and the great choices of restaurants on the property,make this is a finely tuned operation. Special events are conducted by the hotel management for families and others. The pool areas always clean, well maintained and enjoyed by those patrons, especially families. The lunch offerings at Charlie's are very good, a pleasant casual atmosphere with television sets on every wall for sports/news. Service is very good and prices just right. Trellises offers fine dining, service supreme, and the menu choices presented are enough for anyone's taste. Food prepared perfectly, and presentation wonderful. Prices are very reasonable and in line with many other fine dining restaurants and in fact cheaper than many. Kelly's Steak House is a casual, but pleasant dining experience. There is a piano bar and you can sing up a storm, or just relax and listen. However, it will not interfere with your dining or your table conversation. Rooms are well appointed, with perhaps some of them needing an upgrade on the television set, but clean, with all amenities necessary. Balconies offer a great respite to relax, read the paper, have in-room dining or just view the happenings. Yes this is an older property, however it is maintained very professionally, by a very professional staff at all levels. The employee's really care that your stay with them will be an experience to remember and that you will want to return the next time your in San Diego. Location is perfect, right in the middle of hotel circle, about 12 minutes from the airport, five minutes from Old Town, with easy freeway access to almost all the attractions. Do yourself a favor and next time stay at the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises”
Reviews.Author: Raquel L
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for a total of 5 days. The rooms are a little dated but clean. The staff at the check-in desk was very welcoming, helpful and polite. The highlight of the trip was Trellises!!. The breakfast was delicious and the service was outstanding. My co-workers and I had the honor of having Ms. Angelica Stephens as our waitress - she was AWESOME and made breakfast there an absolute delight!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall, but needs to get with the times.....”
Reviews.Author: ctj90210
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. It is old but they try to keep it clean. Very friendly staff. It offers nice ammenities, is in desperate need of a facelift, however, and is overpriced by today's standards, given what you get. For example WiFI is $10/day and the gym is $5 (can be bundled with a small discount...gee, thanks!), but across the street both are included at the Marriott (and for over $50 less per night!). Parking is $3/hour, $16/day max with no "in and out". Food is overpriced. Give me a break. Time will pass this hotel by unless they show a little more appreciation for their guests, stop nickel and diming them to death, and get with the times.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: DomenicaP1031
Reviews.Content: This place is an upgraded Motel 6, in fact I would rather stay at a Motel 6. Its outdated and not welcoming at all. There were 2 miserable people at the front desk at check-in. The food presentation was nice, food was average. Restaurant and housekeeping staff were very friendly. The grounds were beautiful. Room and bathroom was awful. Not dirty, just old, musty, dingy. If you have a choice - stay somewhere else. The pictures are deceiving, and so is the name. This is NO resort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrace cafe”
Reviews.Author: Dsrttraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this resort this weekend and found the grounds to be beautiful, the concierge desk very helpful and the rooms fit our needs. The only down fall was the Terrace Cafe, found their breakfast buffet to be pricey especially for your average food selection as convenient as it was to eat there would not do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff-hotel needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: ke39
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference recently, and the power went out (all over San Diego). The staff was great, handled the situation fantastically-kept everyone fed and informed about the situation. Well done, and I want to recognize that. However, the facility itself needs a MAJOR overhaul. I was at the T&C about 13 years ago and I don't think the decor has changed one bit. The door to our bathroom did not work, and it took three conversations with the front desk to get it fixed (which didn't last). The mattress was old and had no support. Wi-fi is NOT free, in fact, it was almost $10 a day! The gym was a $5 daily fee! This is a RESORT and all amenities should be included! Or, at least take all of that money you're making from wi-fi, the gym and parking and invest it in updating your property. I was disappointed, and if the conference is ever held there again, I'll be staying off site. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Katie Ward Employee of the Year”
Reviews.Author: Julieanna P
Reviews.Content: Had a crappy room our first night there and no one at the front desk cared except Katie Wingo. She told me to return in the morning and she would see that our room was changed.And it was the next morning. I talked to 3 others before Katie and she was the only one who really cared that I was up-set and unhappy. Thanks for all your help Katie. You are what Customer Service is all about. I was there in August at a LUSO/SPRSI Convention and I live in Alpine. But I most certainly would stay again if I ever get the chance. Again Thanks to Katie Wingo

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: nhiceprincess
Reviews.Content: I almost never write reviews, but I feel I need to for this one. My conference was at the property so I spent a week here for convenience. I will not come back. The hotel seriously needs updating. Everything is old, decor, bathroom fixture, furniture, carpet, CRT TV, drapery, linen, towels are almost see-through, no safe; the list is endless. WIFI is non existent. It took 20 minutes to load a page (no graphics) the first night. I was unable to log in subsequent nights. The answer I got at reception was: "Our internet is slow because there are too many people online at the same time." That is an unacceptable answer in the 21st century! Two things I found positive were the beautiful roses and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “They've done a good job”
Reviews.Author: bikingfarmer
Reviews.Content: This location is a combination of two previously separate hotels and some newer buildings. We were in one of the ten floored towers. Inj this building 90% of the rooms face the compound groundsand pools. Beautiful tall poster king bed room with an abundance of space. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff from being greeted at the door to arranging a taxi and suggestions for places to go and routes to take. They gave us good hints on public transportation short-cuts. Location is less than 1/4 mile from a large shopping mall and next to the bus and trolley lines. Did not eat at any of the three restaurants but they appeared very clean and pleasingly decorated. Less than 1/2 hour trip to Gaslight Village and ready access to other attractions via bus/trolley.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was transported back in time”
Reviews.Author: AlishasHubby
Reviews.Content: Ok, my wife had a conference here, so we decided to stay here for convenience. It is just like something out of the 60's. I will say that the staff is super friendly, just as all the people we have met in southern California. The room had a musty smell, and some awful blue carpet. The wifi, which is free, is pretty unreliable, and unavailable many times we tried to use it. The bed was comfortable, though the bedspread was old. The furnishings in the room were like out of grandmas house. There were three pools, but uncomfortable chairs to sit in by them.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Faye G
Reviews.Content: This resort is an amazing place to stay. A city within itself with everything you need to pause and relax. My room was LOVELY! I noticed each room opens up to a garden that invites one to keep the doors open! I was able to keep my patio door open the entire time I was here. The sounds (when any) were muted due to the amount of trees and lush plants and flowers around the property. With the quiet I was able to work and enjoy nature at the same time, and with deadlines, I actually did work. The "calm of the campus" allowed for more relaxed writing. I also enjoy the immenseness of the property, every part covered by lush green plants and the sculptures around the property add to the eliteness of the environment. I was able to go for a walk and not have to walk the "halls." Each breath of fresh air and opportunities to walk in a proverbial garden did a lot to the "rest needed" while I was working productively. This hotel fit our conference nicely, we are a large conference and we never once felt like we were tripping over each other.

Reviews.Title: “10 days at town and country”
Reviews.Author: rhodeygem
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days here, recently, frOM Aug 25- Sept 4th 2011. My first impression was not great, but I came to love it! The most important thing to happiness at town and country, is the room you get. There are several buildings, each with their own pros and cons. I would say that the best are the trellis rooms, or the big tower (don't remember it's name) Other rooms are more motel style, and some are absolute dumps, while others are pleasant enough, with lovely sitting areas in front, and/or private-ish verandas. I should know, because in ten days, I had 4 different rooms assigned to me. This is because I was not happy with the first thing I got, and when I complained, I got better, each time! It boils down to their apparent policy of a "first come, first serve" assignment of rooms. I was coming in to lecture at a conference there, and needed a room that was quiet, had a desk, and a window that opens, for fresh air. I let them know that 2 months in advance, and was told that I could not be guaranteed which room I'd get, but that it would be reserved in either the big tower, or the trellis area. When I arrived, I was sent to the smaller tower, and a room there with no desk and a view of a dumpster! I was then moved to a room in the "3300" building. It had no window that open, no desk, and lots of loud people running up and down the halls... it was deplorable!!!!!!!!!! Next I was put in the 3500 rooms, which are very nice, in a lovely rose garden area, and from there I could easily walk to the big pool, the restaurants and conference center. However, that room had no window that open, and very strong odor from carpet cleaning chemicals. 2 days later, a friend showed me his lovely room in the large tower, and I requested a move, which was graciously accommodated. A bellman quickly came to me room and helped me move, complete with a ride in the golf cart! The big tower was my favorite! nice balcony, overlooking everything, and a beautiful, business-sized desk. The grounds are gorgeous!!!! At that time of year there were thousands of roses blooming, hibiscus, palm trees everywhere. I spent time by each of the three pools, and they were all nice. It's quieter by the trellis restaurant, and there is a bar there too, for refreshments. It took me 5 days to find the breakfast buffet at the "deli" location. (not well advertised!) The hotel staff was genuinely nice to work with. All workers that I encountered there seemed happy to be there, and very positive. The whole place is kind of like an oasis in the middle of a busy city with lots of "standard" hotels. This was different. Trees, flowers, creeping vines... like a beautiful jungle oasis, and happy people within it! It was a little confusing to figure out the maze of conference rooms and spaces, at first, but once I "got it". it became very enjoyable, and much better than the typical "cookie cutter" conference hotels that I am so used to. My only request would be that in the future, room assignments be allowed in advance, then the early bird can get her worm!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel for a small to medium size convention.”
Reviews.Author: travel7continents
Reviews.Content: Overall I grew to appreciate the Town and Country Resort Hotel. When we arrived, we were both exhausted and it was late night. I was irritable and tired and the place did not make a good impression. We had problems finding the entry street to the hotel. Later I talked to others who had the same problem. I think all the hotel needs to do is add some well illuminated signs at the driveways. The complex is large with many buildings, several restaurants, at least 2 pools, and a bridge to the Fashion Valley Mall across the trickle of water called the river. Be sure they give you the map of the resort when you check in. I too was disappointed by the room decor, but became happy with our view of the pool, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the friendly staff. Once you get your bearings, you learn the zoo, beaches, harbor, many attractions are not far. But you really need a car to get around, The trolley is across the bridge by the shopping center and it will get you to the harbor, Old Town and some of the tourist attractions. This is a very good hotel for a conference or small to medium size convention. I wpuld not choose it for a short vacation unless you only wish to "shop till you drop" at the mall. it is a terrific mall with a good selection of shops. Otherwise the hotel property seems too spawling and rooms lackluster. We were there for a convention of about 250 people and found it had all the facilities we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in one great location!”
Reviews.Author: SMVORCA
Reviews.Content: Town & Country Resort Hotel is in a great location that is 10 minutes or less to all the beaches, Airport, Sea World & the Zoo. It has several good restaruants on the property and while the rooms are terribly dated, they are clean & comfortable. There was a multi-state blackout during my stay & the staff did a great job of maintaining a safe atmosphere and did their best to accomodate everyone under the bizzarre situation.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded, Outdated”
Reviews.Author: lionel86
Reviews.Content: Visited here and found the facilities to be outdated and the hotel to be very, very crowded. Granted it was Labor Day weekend, but still, the parking was atrocious. Parking is an additional $11. I highly doubt I will return due to the poorly planned facility. Yes, the 80's are good, just not in the hotel decorum that appears to not have changed since then. For what we paid for, I would have rather gone to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...this place is huge!”
Reviews.Author: CraigBeauval
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute in San Diego on labour day weekend, so we did not save any money. We paid a lot for this hotel. Normally I would be mad at the price, but we were glad to see how nice this hotel / resort was. A couple great features are the MTS Train right behind the hotel. You walk out the back of the hotel and San Diego's transport system is right there. We used this both days we were there, and it goes to all the tourist places you could want to go to. It costs $5 for an all day ride pass. The second great feature, was right on the far side of the MTS. It is a huge mall with lots of great stores. So about a 5 minute walk out of the back of the hotel, you can either go golfing, get on the MTS to anywhere in San Diego, or spend a whole day at the huge mall. We were lucky this trip, that the grandparents took care of the kids, so it was just my wife and me. However this hotel is definetly tailored to families. They had activities everyday for families and kids. Lots of space for the kids to run around, and lots of pools. We would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego, whether you are a family or just a couple. As well the staff was excellent. Any questions we had about San Diego were answered by the very knowledgable staff. Our room was also clean and comfortable. If you like seafood, check out Joe's Crab Shack at the Hazard Center. It is the next stop along from the hotel stop on the MTS. Great food and atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: emjulian
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a little outdated and the property is kind of a hodgpodge, the grounds are lovely and well kept and everything was clean. The best part was the people. We were here during a 12 hour blackout and the staff did a great job keeping everyone comfortable and fed during that time. I wandered into a bar and the bartenders, Rez and Jaime, were great! They even gave me some candles and matches so I'd be able to find my way back to my room. The whole staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “They do the right thing and show dedication to quality”
Reviews.Author: Rhayes
Reviews.Content: The food and service at the hotel's restaurant, The Trellis Grill, was great. Our server, Angelica Stephens, was fantastic. Her attention to detail and her positive, sunny attitude made our dining very pleasant. Another server, Patti Mukzcevicz, was really great too. Always smiling and attentive. The hotel also keeps their beautiful grounds beautiful and impeccably clean. The roses are in bloom everywhere and are so gorgeous. Most importantly, the other day during the Souther California - wide power outage, the hotel did the right thing by firing up their grills to feed the guests - all at no charge to any of us. They really took care of us in this way. What could have been a panic situation for all ended up being a relaxing party - all thanks to the hotel management doing the right thing.

Reviews.Title: “Made me feel comfortable during a crisis”
Reviews.Author: traveleramelia
Reviews.Content: During the 10 hour blackout in San Diego this hotel put together a complimentary cookout (they could have charged for the burgers and made a fortune!) and party by the pool for everyone staying. For something they just threw together at the last minute it was very well organized. The owner and manager kept us updated on everything going on and were very friendly and approachable. Capt. Rez and Jamie at the bar even got us candles and matches to take back to our dark rooms with us. The staff worked overtime and very hard to make everyone feel comfortable and well taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “great location and price, not the best in SD, but nice”
Reviews.Author: angie12345
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the price. We got a 2nd level room, not sure what the official name of it was. The decorations are just "meh", but it was clean. The 19" TV (not joking) is in a cabinet that just one of the beds could view, so we didn't even bother. The place is really spread out, so prepare to walk a ways to anything, be it the pool, restaurant, etc. We walked all the way over to the Trellises Restaurant and it was closed at 9:30 am on Monday. No explanation why, so we had to go to the other breakfast place they offered and it was not nearly as nice as Trellises looked to be, so that was a bummer because I wanted a nice breakfast and instead got a mediocre one. The good: The shower is nice, lots of pressure with a high showerhead for tall people. Towels were soft and large. The air conditioner is nice and quiet. The location is great, and this is the main reason I chose this hotel. It's within walking distance to Fashion Valley Mall and the Trolly (San Diego's awesome public transportation). So you can stay here and take the trolly to a football or baseball game, Gaslamp District, Old Town and SeaPort Village. $5 for all day riding. Plus, we walked over to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner. It's also literally 10 minutes (get in the car, drive and get out of the car) to Sea World, the Zoo, and the beach. The not good: The bed was not soft, at all. The sheets were not soft, at all. Scratchy would be a better word to describe them and the blanket above them. The whole bed just really made me miss my bed at home, and that's not how it should be, especially if I pay upwards of $150 for a night. Oh, and a 19" TV. Really?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: thekidsmom10
