Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to ensure our very large group was well accommodated. The catered food was nothing short of fabulous! The grounds and rooms were beautiful and well kept. WiFi in the rooms, multiple pools just an all around pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: My review is for my stay during a business trip for a national conference. I wanted to especially say thank you to bartender, Rez, who was very friendly and hospitable throughout my stay. The hotel and grounds was ok, but not great. We were in a garden room (not the tower). Disappointed with how difficult it was trying to find coffee in the mornings. Housekeeping didn't leave enough coffee for two people (we had 2 large double beds in the room). No refrigerator - this needs to be standard in all rooms, in all hotels! It's not that difficult. Also, getting around the area was impossible without a car - close to a busy highway. However, having the shopping mall within walking distance was a plus. Best part of my stay was getting a nightcap at Trellises and being taken care of my Rez! Thanks for making my stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tina O
Reviews.Content: I lived in San Diego for 12 years and now live in LA. My family and I came back for a family vacation of Sea World and the Zoo. I choose the Town and Country because of it's location. It's central San Diego and in the middle of everything. We had a great weekend and our stay at the Town and Country was great! The grounds are beautiful. We had a bungalow by the pool and it was fabulous. We arrived very late Friday night and checking in was easy and the staff at the front desk were very accomodating and welcoming. The rooms are a little dated but the beds are comfortable. The shower was very relaxing especially from a long day at Sea World. We will be staying at the Town and Country the next time we vacation in San Diego. We had a great time. Thank you staff at the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Property Great”
Reviews.Author: ijw198300
Reviews.Content: For all of you who would like to visit this wonderful city. I recommend this hotel. We recently stayed there for a convention. The Trellises restaurant is WONDERFUL. You can sit inside or out. Their staff is great. It is one of 4 restaurants on property. We also tried a couple of others but this was our favorite by far. The decor is superb, and plentiful. Keep in mind that they close on Sunday nights so plan on going out on the town for a meal if your stay includes Sunday night. Patti was exceptionally nice and also a waiter, Jacinto. The pools were wonderful however only one is heated. No problem in summer. The grounds were beautiful and the convention staff and area was great. Make sure your get one of the two story or less rooms. The high rise was under construction while we were there and not a great thing. Like I said had I paid for it I would have requested a move. I highly recommend the Downtown trolley tour. It is great. There is also a Mall within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience....”
Reviews.Author: Debra G
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Town and Country was one I don't want to experience... From the time we arrive to check-in we had nothing but rude service... The company that runs the security gates were horrible... The only person that was nice to us was Kirk Tetzlaff... He was amazing....

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely be back, no doubt!”
Reviews.Author: Shirley P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the town and country hotel and have never felt so welcomed anywhere in my entire life. Everyone was so nice. I dealt quite a bit with the Package Room/Department that experience is what my review is based apon... The young man Jessie was so incredibly helpful. He answered all of my questions (even the ones unrelated to my package such as directions, etc..) and really explaiined anything that I wasnt sure about. He made sure to ask me several times if there was anything else that I needed or if there was anything that he could help me with. I could tell that he was quite busy, it seemed lke he was organizing that entire department by himself but I never once felt rushed or like there was anything more important than my husband and my happiness with our stay, he made us feel like valued customers. Now that is the kind of customer service that I like to receive!! And that is exactly what I will remember about our stay at the town and country! s.presley.m@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: sdtaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night for a quick get away. While the location is good, the room was no different than staying in a Quality Inn. I expected more from a "resort hotel", particularly one that charges me for parking and wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference Center - poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: tikkalikka
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel and conference center in mid August during the FinnFest2011. The conference Center was fantastic with good meeting rooms with spacious exhibit halls and ballrooms. The grounds were huge and one could get lost easily, however there were directive signs on strategic corners. The grounds were lush with vegetation and beautiful flowering plants. Restaurants were nice, although quite expensive, especially when you are a captive audience. The Trellises restaurant especially had friendly and cozy atmosphere and the staff very attentive both during breakfast and dinner. I had booked a "garden room", single occupancy way ahead of time. To my dismay my room was in the old section of the grounds at the farthest point from the Conference Center behind Kelly's Steak House in a second floor. A person with disabilities (not me) would have had a very difficult time to haul his/her luggage up/down stairs - no elevator. The room smelled musky and there was no way to open the windows to air it out. The hotel warned about not leaving valuables in the room, but did not provide a safe in the room. One had to reserve a safe at the office if one wanted to be sure of keeping the valuables safe which was most inconvenient. I do not recall if there was a charge for the safe. The bedspread was worn and piling, in other words needed to be thrown out. The pillows were hard. The bedside table was worn and had seen better days (enclosed picture) and the sink had a large crack ( enclosed picture. The TV was one of the old type (no flat screen). This did not fit my image of a garden room that is presented at the hotel's web site. All in all, the room needed some TLC and updating.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever. Run down. Looks like assisted living community.”
Reviews.Author: erin p
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place to anyone. The staff was rude and unprofessional to us from the moment we arrived. For example, we asked the bell staff to call us a cab--but instead, Elisha--the bell captain, gave us a card for her friend's private (and undoubtedly more expensive) car service. This was happening as we watched other cabs pull up to the hotel for other guests. I think she figured we were young and was trying to take advantage of us with the expensive car service, while she had no problem calling cabs for other older customers. The next day we used their complimentary shuttle to drive five minutes away to order take out In N Out Burger to bring back for our group. This was working perfectly until we called the hotel to have the van come get us and were told it would be 25 minutes before they could come. This was after we were told by the driver to simply call the hotel when we were done and they'd come right back and get us. And oh guess, what--surprise, surprise, Rhodes Scholar, Elisha was in charge of dispatching the vans and wouldn't send one to get us. She said the driver was on lunch. Oh really? You knew you had customers out and would need a ride back soon and you approved a lunch break when nobody else would be available to pick us up? Brilliant. They also refused to pay for a cab to bring us back, so we had to simply wait for the van to "become available" as Elisha put it. When the driver finally returned, he asked what took so long and said that he was never on lunch. So the dispatch is lying now. Upon returning to the hotel, I asked for Elisha's manager, though the only person around that was above Elisha was a similarly unprofessional woman named Tina. As Elisha went to tell Tina that we were waiting for her in the lobby, we literally saw Tina roll her eyes in annoyance that we wanted to speak to her about this. Tina was as unwillingly to apologize for this error as I imagined she would be. And she even had the gall to blame the driver more than once. Wow. Sure, blame the lowest guy on the totem pole for a mistake that you could have easily corrected, and couldn't have possibly been his fault as he is not the one dispatching the vans. At one point, she must have been exhausted by my insistence that she apologize and take ownership b/c she turned exasperatedly to her partner in crime (Elisha) and whined, "What is it that she wants me to do for her? I mean, is there anything we can possibly do for her???" Mind you reader, she is asking this with all the sarcasm and disrespect she could muster. So there you go. And for the record, the only nice staff members we encountered there were the van drivers. We had used them several times before this incident and Oscar, Orlando or Octavio--can't remember which, and Kirk or Kurt--can't remember which, were ALL extremely polite, helpful and courteous. The problem there is Elisha. And Tina. And however much further up the chain of command it goes--I don't know. Additionally, the decor was outdated, and the grounds a little run down. Beautiful roses were in bloom, but also untidy. We had to shout "Hello? Is anybody here?" when we first walked into one of the restaurants bc nobody was staffing it. We ate one meal there and it was good, but nothing to write home about. They have three pools on the property and oddly they wouldn't serve food or drink at the pool. There was a complete lack of visible signage which was annoying b/c it is a big property and easy to lose your way. We had two hair dryers plugged into one room and the power went out. We joked about this hotel feeling like an assisted living community b/c there were so many old people in wheelchairs and the decor lives up to that. Additionally, the gal in our group who booked the hotel, was told by a hotel staff member that the hotel was walking distance from the beach. It is not. It is a 15 minute drive. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to come into the 21st century”
Reviews.Author: Brian_RapidCity
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to San Diego. The room was very dated and looked like it was out of the 1960s. In addition, you have to pay for parking and internet, so add an additional $25 per day to your bill. The location is good and the staff was friendly, but the hotel itself is extremely dated and overpriced for the quality of room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the other reviews make you nervous, T&C was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: writemeariver
Reviews.Content: Came here on an impromptu work assignment and as an experiment used the Priceline bidding option. Ended up at the Town & Country and was concerned after I read some of the negative reviews. Once I got to the hotel however I was more than pleasantly surprised. The hotel could use some refacing and updating, but most of the hotels in Hotel Circle in San Diego look like the same. The grounds are beautiful, the staff was friendly, I got a room on the 8th floor of the tower overlooking the pool. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, good water pressure in the shower, attentive maid service. Given that it's theme is town and country there is a dated country-ish sort of mood to it and you see some marks in the wood furniture here and there but there were no stains or anything unacceptable in this room whatsoever. My only complaint is that most of the hotels in this area include free parking and internet - this hotel charges extra for both of those via "packages" that you buy daily - so it adds an extra $12 a day to your bill for these "luxuries" that in this century are no longer luxury items but necessities especially for a business traveller staying at a resort and convention centre. The parking and internet fees in this era are truly passé' and this resort should evolve out of them. Overall the staff made my stay very comfortable, thoroughly enjoyable, and definitely for the room I stayed in (1814) in the towers far superior than the previous reviews I read here. If the internet and parking were included I would definitely recommend this resort for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasBaseball
Reviews.Content: As always it was a great stay. While the decor is in need of a change, I realize this economy is not the time. The staff contiues to be pleasant and efficient. The location is perfect for my needs. Looking forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “SDSU Orientation-Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingaround32655
Reviews.Content: Came into town for an SDSU orientation with my daughter. The Town and Country is only minutes from the campus so easy to make trips back and forth. Mal was adjacent for last minute school shopping, Target down the round. I called SDSU with questions and they gave me Terry in the sales/reservation office who was able to answer my questions. We will be back for spring break and will stay at the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha67
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were very large and comfortable; 2 queen beds and 2 sinks in each. 6 adults and 1 toddler could get together and not feel crowded. The staff was very friendly and the service was exceptional. We had breakfasts at the Terrace Cafe, lunch at Charlie's, dinner at Trellises and bought snacks and drinks from the Sunshine Deli; all were convenient and had excellent food. The resort is very "family friendly". We had a toddler with us and were always made to feel welcome. We used 2 of the 3 pools and enjoyed both. The conceirge was very helpful and we purchased tickets through her to Legoland, Sea World and the SD Zoo. The hotel is conveniently located to those attractions and within walking distance to the SD trolley and Fashion Valley Mall.

Reviews.Title: “SD Resort/Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: SimiDan
Reviews.Content: The Town & Country Resort is the best, particularly is you're going to an event at the Convention Center (on the property). The grounds are beautifully maintained and clean. The resort is huge and takes some time to learn how to navigate from point A to point B, but they have detailed maps of the campus that let you become a "local" after a day or so. Room service compares to Four Seasons. Parking is tough unless you park/stay at one of the towers - there is abundant parking and immediate access to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because the hotel was chosen as a host hotel for an athletic event my daughter was attending. The room was very old, musty, and smelly. Small T.V. with old, outdated decor. 400.00 was added to the orginal price for the weeks stay for parking, internet, gym and what I was told by the front desk as "essentials". Completely ruined the first day of our vacation and I will never go back! We checked out after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: raylaw323
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and this one is a little above average. The hotel is huge and is made up of many areas. We stayed in the large tower. The bad part is that it is a noisy area. There was some sort of convention of young people and they were loud and rude. But the hotel is not to be blamed. The grounds are nice. The internet was free (we got our special rate through travelzoo). The location is ideal close to the mall and other shopping/grocery stores. The service was good. The furniture is dated but rooms are clean and good. The bathroom was clean. We stayed in 1709. Overall a thumbs up if the price is about $120 or less a night.

Reviews.Title: “A bit conflicted--great staff & grounds, bad room”
Reviews.Author: lola19892011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the State Games of America. Check in was quick and efficient, and an extremely kind bellman drove us to our room. However, when you are told at check in that there will be no refunds for leaving early, it should make you wonder what you are facing. We were in the second tower, in a "nice room", that looked like my childhood bedroom from the 1970s. The comforters were very worn and stained, and the room was not sound insulated at all. You can't fault a hotel for its clientele, but many of these people seemed like they belonged on an episode of cops! Screaming and running down halls, dumping buckets of water off the balcony, people trying to come into our room--all made for an extremely uncomfortable experience. I will say that I was impressed with security's response to everything, but how sad that I actually got to know the security guard on sight. We had food appear in our room, then disappear. We had mysterious stains appear on the sheets. We had all the towels taken out by the maid, with only one usable towel left--the other had large black stains on it. We liked this resort just fine, so long as we weren't in the room. The grounds are gorgeous and probably the highlight of the resort, after the staff. We ate at one restaurant for the breakfast buffet and enjoyed it. Within walking distance of public transportation (so easy to use, thanks to the bell staff and concierge) and the Fashion Valley mall. Would I stay here again? Not sure, but I would lean towards "no" simply due to the numerous weird experiences with other guests and the strange happenings in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: txtvldude
Reviews.Content: The property is a bit dated but we were happy with our stay. We were there with the State Games of America group and check in was fairly quick. I did get a bundle on the parking & internet, $11.95 a day for both. We were not offered this up front but after asking about wifi, the front desk told me about the bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Old, Old, no internet, no team sports friendly, won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Smilzomex
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was on the optional list of approved hotels for the San Diego Surf Cup (Soccer). Let me start by explaining the cons of this hotel: 1.- No Free Internet: I know this is not the only hotel with no Free internet but coming to a soccer tournament and needing to check the tournament website, this did not help at all. 2.- Parking Lot: They treat you like a criminal going in and out of the parking lot. To get in you get a ticket and to get out you have to give your room number, last name and good luck if there is an error on the hotel room list. It is a hassle. 3.- The hotel and the rooms are not quite exactly as they look on their website. This hotel is old, specially in the tower that we stayed, I believe Regency tower, 4.- The bed covers are old, old old. They looked and had the design of those covers from the 90's. Pros: 1.- It is well located, but this is not the only hotel on the Hotel Circle area, so look around before you book. 2.- Housekepping staff is nice but not the front desk people

Reviews.Title: “Last Case Scenario”
Reviews.Author: erovic
Reviews.Content: This place is set back in time- late 1970's early 80's. The resort is divided into areas, towers, bungalow type rooms as well as motel type rooms. The decor is dated some pieces were showing so much wear and tear that they need to be removed and fixed. The quilt/bed cover was stained yellow and bed linens felt damp to the touch. The registers and returns in the room were laddened with dust and needed cleaning. Otherwise the floors were clean and the bathroom was straight as a pin. The grounds were pretty during the day and illuminated nicely at night, however walking alone on the grounds at night may pose a problem for some. The concierge and bell service was very helpful, but this was a one time stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could avoid staying overnight”
Reviews.Author: zippo6
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was good - the food, meeting rooms, staff were pretty good, but the room I had was a nightmare. To think it cost $145 a night - heck, I wouldn't even take money to stay in that room. It had a Murphy Bed (folding), with all the hardware exposed at the head of the bed. To top that off, the bed itself was the most uncomfortable I have ever been in - I would rather have slept on the floor, but didn't quite trust that. The furniture was stained, and the room was musty. When I went to the front desk to register a complaint, I was given the "We don't have another room" response. Stayed there 3 days, and in that time probably slept a total of 3 hours. I will say that the A/C was in good working order, which beat some of the other people's complaints I heard. If I had another choice, I would stay somewhere else (might do that next year, even if I have to pay for it myself). For $145, you think you'd get more than a sack of potatoes to sleep on. I can't give this higher than a 2-Star rating - after all, a hotel should provide a comfortable night, but to their credit, the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime”
Reviews.Author: deancoug
Reviews.Content: Rooms dated and old, then they nickel and dime you to death. Fee for gym, fee for internet but a free newspaper! Friendly helpful people at the front desk. Free printing for the boarding pass...but watch the fees!

Reviews.Title: “The scenery was the beautiful! !!!”
Reviews.Author: kayla522
Reviews.Content: I came to town and country for a weekend getaway and I arrived early in the morning and went straight to bed. The room was clean just the right size and set up nicely. I woke up and went outside it was beautiful. Flowers everywhere and tables and chairs to sit on. I loved this place and the feeling it gave off. However, when it came time to check out there was some problems and a huge misunderstanding but in the end everything worked out and next time I go to san diego im staying here again. Ooo and the location was the best. Not to far from sea world and the beaches takes bout ten minutes and shopping is like 3 seconds away :))) -kayla

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Amentities & Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: awesome14
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 4 different eateries, a humongous convention center, and a few great pools, not to mention the many other enhancements. The rooms are kept very nicely with soft carpet! We had nothing go wrong with our stay and I surely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I really do not know what to say. Twilight Zone?”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: This place is interesting. Not sure if I love it or hate it. Front desk. There was a 25 minute wait. Normally this would anger me. But I was strangely interested. The people were different. The furnishings were different. I was no longer in SD, but some alternate universe. Somewhere in the 60's? Strange. We drove to our bungalow. I was not surprised to see blue carpet or a chandelier in my tiny room. I smelled grandma. I smelled at least forty years of wear and tear. I loved it. I hated it. It felt, different. The walls were thin. Beds were so so. But that is of no importance! We were in a new world! A world were I fully expected to see the Brady Bunch strolling through the rose garden. Why? No idea. Just had that feeling. I felt drawn to something. Were there ghosts here? Duh. Of course! And I do not even believe in ghosts! I needed to walk. Walking around this place was like strolling through a time machine. A must at night. The year 2011 totally disappears. The year 2011 totally disappears! We walked around a bit during the day. Fun with toddlers. The place is huge! It felt like a back lot in a movie studio. When we returned to our room, the keys no longer worked. After 3 calls to the front desk and almost 30 minutes, they finally brought our new keys so we could enter the room. Too late, as our little guy already went in his pants. So much for customer care. We told them he had to go! Still, it took 30 minutes. I tried to find the history of this place, online. All I could find was what was outside my door. A strange, eerie world. We did not have a problem with parking. I guess we were lucky. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Should you? Once.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs, despite the cost”
Reviews.Author: himynamesnick
Reviews.Content: I hope that someday the Town and Country Resort's 3-star rating is reduced to at least a 2-star rating, or - at the very least- I hope that they are someday forced to remove the word "Resort" from their title. "Resort" is a word that invokes feelings of class and prestige, which is ironic because class and prestige are words that will never come to mind when I think back upon my stay. Upon arrival, we (my girlfriend and I) checked into the hotel just a stroke before midnight, and were informed that we had already been checked in. We both exchanged a few words of confusion, which I'll just assume the front desk employee didn't pick up on, and were handed keys and shown a map of where we were to park. The hotel is spread out over a sizable area, with a portion of the rooms being in a 10-story or so tower-like building and the rest of them being in what I can only describe as trailers. Not trailers like the on-wheels kind of trailers, I mean trailer park trailers. If a trailer park and an apartment complex had an illegitimate child, it would probably be called the Town and Country Resort. We ended up driving for 20-30 minutes searching for parking, as the parking situation is best described by the words "pure idiocy" and "moronic". The vast majority of the "streets" around the "resort" are practically one lane, leading to plenty of drawn out and awkward scenarios where you'll be maneuvering around another poor soul's car. Each set of trailers has it's own parking lot, only fitting about 20 cars or so, which is far too few. Around the corner is a two-story parking structure (one lane) and with a bafflingly low 6-foot clearance. In our search for a parking spot, we drove around the cramped structure only to reach the abrupt end of it, which is just a wall, so getting out of the structure (one lane, still) involves having to make your car shuffle into the opposite direction to leave, while hoping no one is coming in the opposite direction. We finally found parking in the back lot, which is much larger but has tiny parking spots and, again, narrow lanes to navigate. We got out of the car and spent 5-10 minutes walking back to our trailer style room, slid the key into the door, opened the door, and were greeted with a room with luggage and clothes strewn about, as it was already inhabited. We left and made management aware, who offered us another trailer room, which we dutifully declined, already angry that it was now pushing midnight and we just spent 20 minutes looking for parking just to turn right back around. Skipping all of the issues between, we were eventually moved to a room in the tower style building. Like the rest of the hotel, the room is disastrously dated. Don't let the photos online fool you, I am scrolling through their provided room photos now and none of them match the room we were in, which I'm assuming was a step-up from the trailer style room. The bathroom is small and the floor is made of dirty tiles, and (my favorite part) the shower head is about 5'5", so I spent a great deal of time trying to kneel down beneath it. I just grit my teeth and pushed through this problem though, as I knew that the quicker I got showered and dressed, the quicker we could leave this horrid place. I would not suggest this hotel to anyone, not even my worst enemy. I've stayed at plenty of hotels that looked cheap or dated on the outside, but had those stays redeemed by passable room interior- this was not the case. This is more or less a glorified motel/trailer park.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Turned it Around after bad start”
Reviews.Author: lonepaddler
Reviews.Content: It is hard to overcome the bad feeling you get when you are walked from a hotel, especially when your sole reason for staying there is to attend a reunion. It doesn't help that other group members arriving later were given rooms when we were told that everyone was being walked. However, we perked up when we checked into our replacement hotel, the Westgate (gaslamp quarter) which was a real 4 1/2 star treat. The Town and Country Resort picked up the cost of this first night plus parking. This is not a review of the Westgate, but of the way the T and C management turned things around. When we returned the next day they gave us complimentary parking and breakfast for the rest of our stay,and we had a small gift pack of water, chips, nuts plus a letter of apology in our room. Our room was in the Royal Tower and was perfectly pleasant. Two sinks, comfortable bed, adequate though not top notch toiletries. Every staff person was professional and pleasant. Every single one. We were surprised to only pay $5.00 for a glass of wine at one of their cafes and it was pleasant to sit out on a chilly late evening with a standing heater keeping things comfortable. Our group had a final dinner/dance which was held in an outdoor courtyard. The banqueting staff was incredibly efficient. Our only complaint was that the food was uninspired. For a California restaurant to not have yoghurt or granola or any selection of healthy breakfast options seemed surreal. From reading other reviews it seems that room location is probably key to one's overall perception of the resort; I did not have an opportunity to inspect any of the cottage units but parking in the interior of the property near these rooms would definitely be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, pricey, don't leave anything in your room!”
Reviews.Author: LASTrafzer
Reviews.Content: If there's one thing that stands out about this hotel, in my mind, it's the dated decor (circa 1980), a loud burgundy and blue floral that is repeated throughout the hotel. And in every room there is a large and CREEPY picture of a young girl in 18th c. dress that seems to watch your every move. Who thought THAT was a good idea? Did someone get a discount on prints of ugly child pictures??? The entire resort needs an overhaul, especially given the price for the rooms and services. It's not unusual to be nickel-and-dimed to death in hotels, but this hotel is charging top prices for a hotel that's one advantage is its location: in Mission Valley, close to Interstate 8 and Fashion Valley Shopping Center, and minutes from the ocean, downtown San Diego, and Balboa Park. Aside from location, Town and Country "Resort" Hotel can't compete with other similar properties. It doesn't help that the staff is uncooperative and sometimes out and out rude. We come to this hotel annually for a convention (it's the ONLY reason I would stay here). One year, the hotel staff caused the convention to come to a stand-still by forcing participants to move out of their rooms immediately despite earlier approval of an extended check-out time. They literally threatened to go into the rooms and remove all items, placing them in the hallway or outdoor pathways. Again, this was after approving a late check out time. One year we left, and within minutes realized we had left an item in the room. We called immediately and was told Reception would have to check with Housekeeping. Subsequent calls were treated with shortness and simple "Nothing was found." This was truly one of the rudest Reception desks I've interacted with, at least in half the interactions I had with Reception employees. This hotel always seems busy. Some of the money coming in from higher rates and extra fees really needs to go back into the rooms and grounds. Planting rose bushes everywhere may make the grounds pretty, but it doesn't mask peeling paint, dated decor, and bathrooms that need a replacement of tubs/toilets/tiles etc. You can only pile on grout and sticky sealants so many times before it looks really tacky. If you are staying here by choice, rethink it. There are better values and better rooms in the same vicinity. If you are here for a conference, just be sure you don't leave anything behind and deal very frankly and firmly with the staff. It might keep your experience from disaster.

Reviews.Title: “worst place to stay in san diego”
Reviews.Author: newyorker56789
Reviews.Content: This is the first negative review i ever had to write. I stayed at town and country resort for ILCA conference. The first room they gave me had a strong smell of pee and old carpet and mildew. I had a hard time breathing, and called the front desk asking to move me. The had me on hold for 10 minutes, because they were busy. The room they moved me to was on the second floor and was less stinky, but it still stank of old carpet. The rooms are sooo tiny, i haven't seen such tiny rooms since i stayed in an inexpensive hotel in center of Paris. The furniture is very old. The TV was antique(maybe they tried to match the furniture). The blanket had a hole and a large dirty stain. The decor is very busy, and makes you dizzy, especially because the room is so small. The housekeeping wasn't great, but i brought it to manager's attention.Overall, you feel like you are in a 1 star motel. The grounds are large, and there are many rose bushes and beautiful trees. But i give this property 1 star for horrible rooms, lack of good housekeeping and snobish staff.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: mexicolindo2007
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this hotel for a company convention. The cottage size room was very small and dated. The carpet was so dirty and the room had an overall bad smell. Finding parking next to our room was next to impossible. We had to walk about 10-12 minutes to reach our room. On the plus side, the poolside restaurant was pretty good and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: loimln
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other Trip Advisor reviews, we were a little scared of what we might find at the Town & Country. We were here for a convention but decided to book outside of the regular convention rate and rooms. We actually had a much better room overlooking the pool than some of our friends who got the convention rate rooms. Our room was very close to the actual convention center which was convenient. The room was clean and spacious. The only problem was housekeeping. If you left your room after 10 am, forget about getting your room cleaned. We were told later by front desk staff that housekeeping is there until at least 2 pm so I'm not sure why they kept forgetting about us. Front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. The pool area was beautiful. Our room overlooked one of the pools near the gift shop. The one thing that really stood out were the beautiful plants and flowers throughout the property. They really do a great job with the landscaping. Yes, it does look somewhat like this place is stuck in the 70s. But, it was clean and comfortable. Prices on food in the deli and parking fees could have been a little more reasonable. I never understand why a hotel has to charge it's guests to park.

Reviews.Title: “Loved and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: humphry44
Reviews.Content: My sister, Linda Nimitz and her grand-daughter, Paris were in need of a personal vacation. I met with Ms Robin Davis, the person most responsible for my Rotary Club's weekly meeting at the Town & Country's Trellises Restaurant. She helped greatly in setting up a five day stay in a beautiful room, adjacent to the beautiful pool and wonderful restaurant. The resort is so centrally located that nearly anything in San Diego (downtown, beaches, oldtown, malls, trolly & bus stations, etc.) can be reached in fifteen minutes, or less. My sister and her grand-daughter had a wonderful stay and thanks to the T&C staff, the whole week was something they will always have fond memories. My sister told me she can't wait to get back to san Diego and will certainly stay at the Town & Country Resort. Thank you Robin and staff for a wonderful week and the perfect weather. James H. Kline, brother

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's gem!”
Reviews.Author: seajay11
Reviews.Content: We went here for a family vacation on the way to SeaWorld(which is just down the street. The place was huge, and fantastic! 4 pools one outside our door. They have several onsite resturants. We ate at Kellys and the food was excellent and the waitress was amazing! The rooms were small but quaint. We had a problem with a loud neighbor and security came right away and shut him up! On the night we came (saturday) they had a movie on the lawn for the kids with free popcorn, blankets and lots of snacks at a great price. The grounds were beautiful, 365 rose bushes, the place was great forme and my husband and for our sons who are 9 and 16. IThe rates were the lowest in town and theMGR even gave us a discount for our trouble with the neighbor. I loved it and want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible front desk service, totally un-informed staff, and rude”
Reviews.Author: Wendywooaz
Reviews.Content: Ugh, what a horrible surprise to arrive at your hotel that you booked 4 months in advanced only to find that they messed up your reservation and are unwilling and unable to fix it. The front desk staff was so unhelpful in regards to this huge booking snafu, that we had to turn around and stay at the Marriott Courtyard in Hotel Circle at the last minute. You would think that due to the competition in hotel circle the staff at town and country would try a little harder. But they don't. If you plan on just sleeping here, you might be ok. But if you need any kind of special service, this is NOT the right place. Staff is uniformed and untrained of how to handle unique guest situations and will be sure to disappoint you if you need any help from them. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service, ancient hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWFAN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Comic-con this year. It was part of the official hotel block. While the price and location were good, the customer service and rooms were terrible. We needed to change rooms and encountered issues at every single step of the way. We were given incorrect information and not a single person we spoke to at the front desk kept their word. After being promised a new room, and it was ready, we arrived back at the hotel to find out that there was no room. The desk clerk was quite rude about telling me they only hold rooms until 6. I was assured by the clerk who set it up that it was held indefinitely. We had also rented a fridge that never materialized despite repeated calls to the front desk. Even after my husband told them to remove it from the bill there was no empathy for our troubles. As far as the "resort" and room, they were subpar. Upon check in you are given a map on how to get to your building. The map has marked streets, the actual streets are not marked. Incredibly frustrating. The grounds have lots of roses but it doesn't look pretty -I don't think they are maintained well. The room we ended up in was in the tower on the 2nd floor. It was the bedroom part of the suite - they close up suites to make two rooms?? The room was decorated hideously - turquoise floral prints, with mismatched cherry and wicker furniture. The worst is that there were very few electrical outlets. The bed was soft and worn out - it had big dips in it. They had terrible scratchy sheets. The carpeting was buckling in places and needed cleaned. Everything looked and felt old and worn out. The walls are very thin. Every time the phone rang next door, we heard it. We also heard them use the toilet, shower and blow dry their hair. Like they were in our room. It was very loud. The shower was ok but the head was placed very low on the wall. The bathroom appeared clean and maintained. There was a sink in with the shower and one in the entry way that made it easy for me to get ready while my husband showered. Towels were rough and unforgiving. The one thing this place has going for it is that the Fashion Valley Transit Station is behind the parking lot. It was very easy to get to SDCC every morning. I cannot recommend this hotel based on the problems I encountered with the front desk. I also think if you want a nice resort and nice room, this is not the place. I told my husband it's like they wanted to be Fantasy Island but never updated since the show aired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Conventions”
Reviews.Author: Patti099
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for conventions or vacation. The grounds are beautiful, roses everywhere. There are a variety of rooms to choose from and a huge complex. Convenient location, but make sure you have a GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Management turned it around for us and made it right”
Reviews.Author: Karen48372
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel for several days with my family to attend the conference. When making reservations, I had called and a very pleasant, helpful woman helped me to choose the type of room for our stay. Upon check in, I found that the receptionist was not warm or friendly but rather short and unempathetic about the type of room we requested being unavailable (there are no guarantees). Our initial room was in a two story building above where the staff ate and socialized and was not well kept. Perhaps at some point in time the staff they lived on the grounds in that building. After such a disheartened experience I read on trip advisor the responses to the varying reviews and contacted Susanna Weber directly. We were moved to a Garden Room and the experience was wonderful! Main pool is really warm which is great for kids, other two are a bit cooler for those who don't like it too warm. The grounds are also beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Katie Wingo provided EXCELLENT Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: ThankY0uJeeves
Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying at Town and Ciuntry, and we were extremely impressed with Katie's friendliness, efficiency, and customer focused service!! I'm sure we will be repeat guests now ^_~.

Reviews.Title: “The most uncomfortable beds and serious lack of amenities!”
Reviews.Author: LakeOswegoMama
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 uncomfortable nights at the Town and Country Hotel for a martial arts tournament held there in July. We stayed in one of their "garden" rooms. The beds were terribly lumpy and downright uncomfortable. I have never had such a terrible bed in a hotel room, not even in a motel room! The room had outdated décor (it reminded me of a cheap Vegas hotel from the 70s). The room lacked basic amenities that I have come to expect in hotel rooms like a hair dryer, mini fridge, or a convenient plug to recharge your cell phone. The TV was a tiny 19" cathode ray tube model, no flat screens here. The room windows on one side are louvered windows, and let in a lot of noise from passing traffic. The lights from the spotlights in the garden shone in our window through the closed curtains all night. The only redeeming feature of the room is that the maids do a good job in keeping it clean. As for overall amenities, only one of the resort's pools is heated: the one closest to the Palm Tower. The biggest insult though? They charge you $15 a night for parking, even if you're a hotel guest! We would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A bit quirky but admirably efficient for a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: travelwriterBoston
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit odd on first arrival, a conglomeration of buildings varying from rose garden cottages to 1960s style high rise in concrete. Rooms could use some major updates. However, numerous swimming pools and a convention center onsite make it a great destination for conferences and families. While it doesn't exude the atmosphere of a luxury resort it is difficult to fault anything specific and it certainly serves its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PROPERTY AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jmt3
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a meeting of the board of directors of a small non profit group. I contacted Town and Country who then provided rooms, a meeting facility, and golf reservations. My groups plans changed repeatedly but the staff dealt cheerfully with each change and made the whole weekend a seamless affair. The grounds of the resort are beautiful--mature tropical vegetation and flowers everywhere. The pool area and retaurants arre lovely. The participants really ejoyed tho eir tower rooms. The meetingt rooms are light , airy , and well stocked. I would recommend this resort to business travelers, organizations, and families.

Reviews.Title: “Poorest Customer Service I Have Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: Graham3025
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, as a manager you have one job, take care of customer issues. This place had no concern for the guest. Out of the 8 rooms booked, 5 had issues with the type of room. Non smoking put in really bad smoking rooms. When we confronted the manager, we were greeted with, "that's a request, not a guarantee.". Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management / Decent Service”
Reviews.Author: LEDETCoastie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days and purchased the buffet breakfast with our room. We called the front desk because we couldn't find information about the breakfast. The clerk informed us that we could only get the breakfast through room service. We ordered and our breakfast arrived on time and as ordered. We ate in a rather warm room as the AC stopped working in the middle of the night. It was cool enough that it wasn't too bothersome until morning. Day two the breakfast arrived on time, but they forgot part of the order. At check out, I followed the signs at the lobby and parked where I wouldn't block the drive, but 3 other vehicles were blocking the drive. After waiting in line, the bell hop had me move my car. I mentioned that I parked correctly, that the other 3 cars did not. He replied that some people just don't follow directions and he couldn't do anything about it (but he had me move). Slightly irritated, we went to check out and we mentioned the breakfast to the clerk. She immediately said that the breakfast was ordered through room service and she had "nothing to do with it". They were charging us for the room service and for the buffet. The clerk explained that the buffet was different. We argued that it was their clerk that gave us the bad information. We had to describe the clerk in detail and another clerk at the desk finally said who they thought gave us bad info. The clerk helping us was now thoroughly irritating me and I asked to speak to the manager or a supervisor. She informed me that she was the manager, but didn't even have a name tag on. She tried to explain her position, but lacked the necessary language skills to properly convey her ideas to us. We argued some more and she started taking off charges, had to get information from the other clerk at the desk that I would think she should have known, and then informed us that we were responsible for paying the tax and delivery charge on the room service meal. We argued more and she would not relent. FINALLY, i just paid the bill, but it turns out they MISCHARGED us anyway and we need to argue some more with them. Up to that point, it had been an enjoyable stay....the quietest hotel stay that I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The resort has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: gb333
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Town & Country Resort many times since the 1990’s for our annual Soo Bahk Do national tournament. In the past, my hotel experience was very pleasant and enjoyable. The front desk staff honored my 12 pm arrival and accommodated my request for late check out. It was much appreciated. However, during my last several stays, I've noticed the level of service, food quality and room decor deteriorate. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms are outdated and in need of renovation. I always stay in a Tower room (which was very clean). However, the king size bed and pillows were uncomfortable and the bedding old and worn. The TV, which is not a flat screen, had horrible reception. My first night there I ordered room service (Chicken tacos). The dinner arrived cold and didn't include the rice and guacamole as indicated on the menu. I called room service and was told that they were out of rice and guacamole. Really? How can that be and if so, why didn't they call to let me know so that I could have chosen another meal? I asked for a discount on the dinner and was told that they couldn't accommodate that request. They offered to send me soup or dessert free of charge. I chose a cheese cake, which wasn't very good. I would have preferred the discount. The food of the breakfast buffet for each four mornings that I ate there to be lukewarm. Aren't there food temperature laws in California? The selection wasn't as good as in previous years. Also, there was no toaster available to toast the bagels, etc. How about bringing back the toaster as part of the breakfast buffet? The coffee, supposedly Starbucks, was absolutely watery. The Sunshine Deli, with its friendly staff, had a good selection of cold salads, but the lettuce wasn't as fresh as it could be. For the prices charged, the food quality and coffee served there should be better. The first night (Wednesday) of my stay Charlie's was closed. Why?? We went to Kelly's for a drink and found the bartender and staff friendly and the drinks and appetizers good. However, the restaurant was really like stepping back into the 1960's. With a little bit of upgrading, it could be a great place instead of appearing old and sad. You can't exactly attract a younger crowd of people with that ambience. On Saturday night, our convention group went to Charlie’s to celebrate. They tried to close the place at midnight despite that fact that we have a contract which that stated that they are to stay open until 2 am. We had to produce the actual contract to get them to stay open. Even then, there was some grumbling by the staff about having to stay open for a handful of people. We tried to order food before midnight and was told that they kitchen was closed. A group of us had to order delivery pizza to get food at that hour. Poor business. At least have the staff let its customers know that the kitchen is about to close. The general atmosphere at Charlie’s is not friendly. As in the past, the grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the pools are clean. The Spa is excellent. It wouldn’t take much to have the Town and Country Resort a four star accommodation rather than a three star. It is the little things that make or break a hotel. Some attention to detail is needed to make it the great place that it deserves to be.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: dmello10
Reviews.Content: great time nice rooms fair rates the food was excellent and the kids loved the pool and free saturday night movie highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalDiner
Reviews.Content: Our breakfast at the Trellises restaurant recently was quite pleasant. The atmosphere was serene, the food was very good --- one family member praised the Eggs Benedict --- and the service by Pati Muklvicz was attentive and pleasant. The Trellises is our favorite breakfast spot in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “We shall return, it was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: njf6
Reviews.Content: This was the most relaxing hotel with the most fabulous grounds. In spite of the size of the resort, we felt as if we were in our own little cottage with beautiful flowers surrounding the entrance to the room. Our stay was for 10 days, and we did not want to leave. There were several pools and a spa to enjoy, and a laundromat was available to accommodate family needs. The proximity to the mall and public transportation was so convenient. We were able to park the car most of our stay and enjoy the area without the 'fun' of dealing with the highways. We ate at all of the restaurants and enjoyed the food and service. The staff at each of the restaurant were so friendly, the menu selections were excellent, and the food was exceptional. We have another trip planned for San Diego in September, and we will book again with the Town and Country Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion made awesome”
Reviews.Author: ylomello
Reviews.Content: We planned a surprise family reunion for my mother this past 4th of July weekend. Our group had 42 people attend, though not all stayed. We did have 14 rooms booked, including a suite as our gathering spot. From the moment we checked in, until we checked out, the service at this facility was flawless. The hotel even showed a movie for all guests out on the lawn, including popcorn. They have the BEST orange juice at the restaurant by the pool. I have never had OJ this good. The hotel is so conveniently located with a large mall behind it and the trolly to take you all over San Diego. We had the best time! Thank you town and country. I'll be sure to stay here again when I visit from Indiana.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel.................................”
Reviews.Author: ja_jacquez
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great service, the rose gardens are beautiful, the restaurants are very good and customer service is very good too. We'll definitely stay here again and I highly recommed the hotel

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Aohot
Reviews.Content: I'm currently at the hotel. The venue I am attending is here and supposedly we have discount rates. Found cheaper rates on the hotel web site. But no matter. I arrived about 3p today and was 2nd in line. Only one desk person and she was fairly grumpy. Within 15 minutes the line was 10 deep. No one else came to help nor did she call anyone. Sherida was oblivious to the folks irritation. Beware they charge $10/per device for each 24hrs!! Found several white little bugs on my bed after removing a soil comforter . Glasses needed washing. Room way too small for 2adults and one teen. Next time we're staying at the Best Western. Less money, friendly staff, affordable meals and well appointed rooms

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Rose Gardens and Grounds”
Reviews.Author: kimlp
Reviews.Content: The outdoor grounds area is absolutely gorgeous. Great landscape Need to desperately upgrade rooms decor. Linens, Bed spreads very outdated TV- Since when do TV's have big giant backs on them?? Get a flat screen Need to add a rubber gasket around room door so that lighting and noise isn't a constant. Food service was great and good food. Like the Starbucks Coffee available near the pool. Prices were good on food.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY but...not worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: kyene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Palm. It's a nice place, the people are nice too but the money spent is not worth it. The facilities are old, you have to pay for internet and parking. On the lighter side, you can just walk to the mall across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: marcandjess
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a very nice experience from beginning to end. The staff was courteous, warm, and inviting. We enjoyed our time here and can't wait to come back! One of the best places on the property is Charlie's Resturaunt. We enjoyed their food and the company of the staff. We want to give a special thanks to Gonzo, our bartender, for making us feel welcome and right at home even though we were thousands of miles away! The property was beautiful and full of fresh flowers. The pool was nice, too. Thanks to everyone for making our stay a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary a No-Go”
Reviews.Author: Ir0nb0y
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not honor their reservations, period. The receptionist first tried overcharging me for a room that didn't exist by about $40 and then said that the only room available had a sofa sleeper (no bed) and then I would have to wait 1 hour just to see if that "deal" materialized. Needless to say my anniversary was ruined, thankfully I didn't fly in, so I drove the 2 hours home to where my mother-in-law lives (yes, anniversary was totally ruined). If you are traveling long distance, please make sure you check in as early as possible before they hand your room over to someone just coming off the street. I definitely will not use this hotel again for any long-range plans.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Danny38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the stayed at the Town and Country Resort and Convention Center in San Diego for about 10 days in April, 2010 in order to play in a Bridge Tournament sponsored by the American Contract Bridge League. This is an old but attractive facility. We stayed on the sixth floor of the tower, where the rooms are accessible via an outside corridor. The resort has extensive outdoor space that is attractively landscaped, which concrete areas where large groups of people can mingle, and many places to sit – both in and out of the shade. A Bridge acquaintance said she experienced noisy neighbors next to her tower room, and her room was without question moved by the management to one of the low-rise buildings, which provided complete quiet. My wife stayed here alone a couple of years ago and contracted food poisoning from an off-site restaurant. The hotel staff was greatly helpful and solicitous, and she really appreciated the concern they demonstrated in this 24 hour-period of feeling quite awful. The swimming pool is attractive and swimmers, particularly children, were obviously enjoying themselves there. Each room in the tower has a private balcony, which suffered somewhat from traffic noise from the expressway about a half a mile away, in addition to the temperature being generally on the cool side to sit out in the shade while we were there. An attractive feature was that our room had two bathroom sinks, which allowed us to dress in the morning and get ready for bed at night without getting in each other’s way – a feature we do not often encounter in hotels. We sampled the moderately-priced restaurants on site, but not their high-end restaurant. These were certainly adequate although not outstanding. A most wonderful feature of the Resort is being only about a half mile from Fashion Valley, an upscale outdoor mall. About half way to the mall there is a stop for the San Diego light rail system and a major bus stop. I am sure one can go to lots of places from there using public transport, although we did not explore this. Fashion Valley is a pleasant and attractive place – even for me who hates to shop. It also offers a number of good dining choices. Our favorites included the restaurant in Nordstrom, the California Pizza Kitchen, and the Haagen Dazs ice cream store which is easily spotted from the entrance to California Pizza. We used Super Shuttle to get to and from the airport. This is efficient and reasonably priced. The drivers were most pleasant. We booked in advance on-line. Our shuttle was waiting for us when we arrived in San Diego. My wife went back before I did because I had a convention in San Diego a couple of days later. Her shuttle was at the Resort when we arrived five minutes before the scheduled pick-up time, and my shuttle also arrived a few minutes early. During my stay the snack bar closed down for renovations, and workmen were also renovating a couple of rooms nextdoor. I was impressed that the owners are putting in significant resources to keep this old facility in repair and attractive. Thus, the rooms next to ours were not just getting new carpets, but also new closets and I believe new bathrooms. I am confident that we could return in ten years to find this facility still an attractive place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but you might get lost”
Reviews.Author: labdaddy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and was fairly pleased. The property is enormous, so I kept getting lost, which I don't normally do. The staff was pleasant except for one incident at a bar/restaurant where the waitress kept forgetting us and then gave us a bill with extra things that we didn't eat. The grounds are stunningly beautiful, everything was green and in bloom when I was there, you can tell they work hard at it. The rooms are comfortable but nothing extraordinary; they are showing a bit of age (I was in several). Three of the rooms (different buildings) did not have refrigerators, the suite did. Internet access was wireless, but lagged at times. It was difficult to get a cell phone signal in my room, it was courtyard-facing and blocked by buildings all around. An added bonus, the Fashion Valley Mall is an easy walk over a dedicated footbridge and they had several good places to eat if hotel food is not your thing. Swimming pools (at least three) looked great, but I didn't get a chance to try them out. If I came to San Diego again, I would definitely consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Mikicr
Reviews.Content: Loved almost everything about this place. The only criticism that I have is breakfast at the cafe was too expensive and not very good. But Charlie's (pub/food) was great. Nate (the waitress) was phenomenal! This was my first time in San Diego and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's good comfortable to get a rest”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Je
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cozy and comfortable to get a rest. In July, the weather is good and i could get the swimming in a pool. And near the hotel, there are Fashion Valley and MTS station. Then you can get a variety of food in the Fashion valley if you don't satisfy the meal at the hotel. Additionally, public transportation gave me easy to access downtown and Balboa park. When I was visited there i could refresh my mind. Even I went to there as a business trip, I wanna go there again with my family. I hope you also make a good memory over there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay elsewhere except booked for convention”
Reviews.Author: jcoyote_11
Reviews.Content: At check in our room was not ready had to wait 3hrs after flying in from, when we got our room, was furthest distance to convetion center. Finally got room thatwas OK everything cost extra no fridge internet or safe for security, Rooms are very expensive for what you get. Food services were \OK but very expensive for what you get. If you don't have a car you are trapped and have to pay the price. Gardens are Nice Looked like I could book a rm thru online and got a cheaper rate then they charge for convention goers.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay great service”
Reviews.Author: WhateverCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the TC for three days and the service was great. The room was quiet had a great view of the well kept hotel grounds. What really made the stay was the staff. I went to Charlie’s, the property sports bar, and had a great time. The bartenders, Keith and Gonzo were great, as were the waitresses Chris and Heather. I had a good dinner there and the calamari wrap was excellent. Breakfast at Trellises’ was also excellent, pricey, but the service from Angelica was second to none. Dinner there was not that great. I purchased a necklace for my wife at the gift shop, Hazelwood’s, and once again the service was exceptional. Rosie did a great job of packaging and gift wrapping it for me. Over all the service was great, and that made my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: HoppyGirl
Reviews.Content: Booked a "garden room with patio or balcony" a couple months in advance. Given a 1970's motel room with a view of a wall. The wall did have some ivy growing on it. Nickel and dimed every time you turned around.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but, one very rude front desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: CSmitthRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel because my company made arrangements for an excellent conference. I enjoyed my stay very much. I stayed in the Royal Palm Tower. It was a spacious room with a very comfortable king size poster bed. The bathroom was ample but had an extra sink and vanity area to dress after bathing. Tile/wood/carpet flooring No stains. No odors. Very clean. Housekeeping very polite and clean the room perfectly. I had a beautiful view of the pool and jacuzzi area. Lighting on the buildings and the beautiful roses, flowers, palms,and landscaping made my balcony view breathtaking. Meals at Trellises were wonderful. I ate there almost everyday for under $13.00. Excellent service. Angelica and Patricia were especially nice waitresses at the restaurant. I hope Town and Country is aware how these two ladies bring enjoyment to the dining experience. I can not say enough kind words about these two people. "Bless both of you" The shops on the hotel site are nice. A bit pricey. Personel staffing shop were terrific too. Conference room was good. Good lighting. Audio and slides were effective and conducive to learning. Snacks and beverages were delicious. Staff was very quiet setting up the tables. No distractions from staff while listening to speakers or lectures etc.. Only disappointment was arriving the night before conference on Sunday, June 5th, 2011 was the young man at the front desk. There was a mix up with billing and he basically told us we had to do what he said or find elsewhere to stay. He also stated we were taking too much time and needed to hurry up. We were an inconvenience to him. VERY RUDE FRONT DESK CLERK!! The Manager stood at far end of desk and did not assist us and allowed this young man to speak to us in a very inappropriate way.Needless to say, our company sorted all the discrepancies and I never had to interact with that young man again. Check out was fine Staff polite and professional. I would stay again and perhaps might do so this summer for leisure. Hotel close to local transportation, high end mall, and nice eateries outside hotel resort .

Reviews.Title: “Weird place, but OK”
Reviews.Author: acl1495
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel for a business conference, as I guess do 90% of other visitors. As the other reviews show it is firmly stuck in 1981. The grounds are very pleasant, and it not a bad place to spend an afternoon in the sun. Bars and food on site are pretty average, and that being generous. The room was pretty substandard. Had a ground floor room in one of the blocks of rooms, and there was a pretty nasty smell the whole time. Water backed up in the bath, and the WC flushed only occasionally. Asked for maintenance, who did visit, but didn't make the situation much better, Since I was only here for three days, couldn't be bothered to repack and move rooms. Not that I'm a shopper, but the place is very conveniently located for a big mall opposite, that you can safely walk to (footpath via the back of the hotel). Overall, I can't imagine anyone coming here of their own free will!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: bfi_h_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention and it was very comfortable. Located in Hotel Circle, there are two types of accommodations: those rooms whose door face the hallway and one that face the street (like a standard motel). I stayed at the latter type of room. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were kept clean. There are rooms that are suites, but when I stayed there, our business used these suites as meeting rooms. There are several places to eat on the property. I tried the steak house and it was very good. Overall, this was a good hotel to stay at. The staff was very friendly and it's good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KPE317
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a weekend trip to the T&C, and like usual everything was great. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly front desk agent. We were quickly checked in and while we were checking in I had some questions about the San Diego marathon, they were more than willing to assist us with every question we had. The grounds were awesome, we would spend our mornings and nights lounging in the pool or in the courtyard relaxing to the sounds and smells you experience here. We ate at the steakhouse, the service and food was good. I spent a couple of nights in the sports bar, cold beer and the bartendar and chicken wings were great. The location was perfect, we utilized the trolley, as well as the easy access via highway to beaches and downtown. Everynight was a great nights sleep, the rooms were nice. Anytime I am in SD I stay at the T&C.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledgirlus
Reviews.Content: Rude people in every department from sales (promised things he didnt deiver) to Trellises manager. Ghetto. Disgusting filthy rooms (roaches), tasteless food, outdated decor, uncomfortable beds with scratchy bedspreads, ugly flowered patterns everywhere you turn, musty smell, loud noise outside and paper thin walls. Should I go on? Overpriced rooms, charges for net, gym, fridge, food should be free for the horrible quality. Seriously would rather sleep on the street than stay here again. This place will not survive much longer without a few million to tear it down and rebuild. Oh and, dont let them fool you into thinking you will get a flat screen tv in your room. They are very deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “After reading The reviews here...”
Reviews.Author: guyinca
Reviews.Content: ...I was quite worried about staying at the hotel I "won" on Priceline. Many of the good points were very good, including the lovely landscaped grounds and flowers. Parking was not an issue for me, but I did see folks driving around asking if anyone was leaving a space. Check-in was efficient, but coldly so. The lady checking me in just would not recognize that a person was standing before her. Yet the check-in person next to us was warm and friendly, even offering a discount on parking to a couple checking in. My person made no such offer. The room was clean, although dated. The shower was fine with plenty of hot water. However, it was exceptionally noisy, being near the parking lot and the freeway. Loud parties were heard as late as 2 am. The room had louvered windows, which made no sense with the noise issues so prominent. Parking attendants were universally friendly, and I enjoyed the short walk to the mall. I did take the number for Susana Weber (see responses to reviews) with me, but I doubt that I could reach her late on a Saturday night to see about a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Partly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: STLCardinalFan
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are spectacular. When you first arrive, you honestly feel as though you're arriving at an upscale, 4 star resort. However, the workers at the front desk quickly dispel those thoughts. They are rude and very unhelpful They behaved as though they were doing me a favor to let me spend my $125 per night there. Then, they informed me that the room I booked was not available, and that it was a "first come, first served" basis on the rooms. Believe me, that was not stated up front. Anyhow, the room I checked in to was dated with 1970's Queen Anne style furnishings, complete with a little 25" square TV. The carpet is royal blue, and there were enough stains on it to make me believe it had once served as an oil change shop. I will say, though, that the rooms were clean. I promptly asked to be moved to a balcony room, which became available the second day of our stay (2 of 5 nights). My teenage son loved the heated pool, and the meeting rooms were very nice. So, overall...the grounds and the meeting space was great. The rooms are terribly outdated, and the customer service sucked. The location of the hotel is very good, and very convenient to the mall, restaurants, and the Trolley.

Reviews.Title: “More beautiful on the outside than inside”
Reviews.Author: wanderinggreek
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Town and Country Resort. We were placed in a garden room facing the parking lot. The room itself was small, the bathroom miniscule. There was hardly enough room to put your toothbrush on the bathroom counter. The corner of the countertop dug into my back everytime I used the commode and I am a petite woman! The room did have a small table outside the bathroom to use for your toiletries. That was the first issue we had with the room. The second issue was lighting. The room was very dark, it had one lamp on the nightstand, a small overhead light over the table and a candelabra style fixture mounted on the wall near the bathroom. The sheers could not be opened, making the room even darker. I could not do any work in the room due to the low level of lighting. I would have to sit on the doorstep, with the door open to be able to see my work. The third issue was the in room internet which we paid extra for its use. The connection was painfully slow and many pages would not load. The decor of the rooms is very dated. The carpeting was a dark blue and the bedspreads a loud floral. The hotel did have its pluses. The grounds are stunningly beautiful with thousands of flowering rose bushes and plants. It was a pleasure to take walks every morning on the property. The pool areas were attractive and well maintained, We enjoyed being able to sleep with our windows open and loved the cool weather San Diego was experiencing during our visit. Within a five minute walk is a very large mall with a food court and sit down restaurants. San Diego's light rail system is also located at the mall and is easy to use. We took the trolley to Old Town for $5 round trip. The hotel could really use a major overhaul of its decor, keeping in mind that they are a conference center and should address the issues that may prevent guests from performing work tasks in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and outdated...be prepared to step back in time”
Reviews.Author: Kzootravel
Reviews.Content: I don't use the term "dump" lightly. This place has many different buildings...good luck if you get stuck in one of the older ones. If you are under 55 and travel at all, you will be disappointed. Some of the words I'd use are old, tired, outdated, unkept and in major need of an overhaul. Who charges extra these days for things like wifi and the gym??? Only places that are in danger of going belly up is the answer.

Reviews.Title: “VERY poor hotel...would not stay in again.”
Reviews.Content: I should have known we were going to have problems when we could not get the wheelchair into the room as there were 2 small but steep steps at the entrance. The friendly lady who checked us in and smilingly handed my fellow traveler who sat in her wheelchair her room key should have mentioned that this may be a problem. We did not request a handicapped room as usually hotels do not have steps into the room entrances. The front desk told us that they could not help us as there were so many requests for handicapped rooms at the last minute that they were out. We had trouble finding a place to eat at the hotel as it is a complex array of paths that are unmarked. On the map, the paths all seem to have names. Asked a cleaning lady for directions only to be told, "I don't speak English." We found the Garden Trellises Restaurant. We looked forward to eating yummy food and tried to overlook the high prices on the menu. But eating stale chips with a $12 chip and dip appetizer did nothing to boost our image of this hotel. They did finally give us more chips...after we were finished with our lunch. All the grit in the clam chowder made us feel like we were at the beach. The waitress told us that she's had no other complaints about the chips or the clam chowder the whole day. She said maybe she should try the chips first next time(hopefully not from the plates she is going to serve!). We got to the conference room to set up a booth and were told that the hotel double-booked the room so it would not be ready until the time we were supposed to be done setting up. That all worked itself out. When we got back to our room and were getting changed, a man came bursting in with a key and then asked if we were leaving as this was the room they assigned to he and his wife. Yes, that made us nervous about the hotel's security. We were very grateful that we were in the room at the time as we had all our stuff there. Got to the conference okay and finally figured out the maze of paths a bit so feeling more comfortable with getting around. But came running back to the room only to find out that the key didn't work. Ran back to the conference to get the other key only to find that the other key didn't work either. Went to the front lobby (about 10 mins. walk) and was told by the lady that the keys no longer worked because they disabled them so the other couple could no longer get in. Well, thank you but what about our keys? She gave me new keys and I was able to get in. Ordered room service later that night. The menu plainly said that the entree I ordered included (at no extra charge) a soup or salad. When I mentioned this as I was ordering, the man said it was an extra $2.95. I spoke with 3 different people in trying to explain to them that this was wrong only to be transferred back to this same man who said that HIS menu was the new one and what he had to charge me. So, I was charged an extra $2.95 for my iceberg lettuce with a few tomatoes scattered on the side. We got used to the constant hum of machinery right outside the door and it probably helped that the ice machine was broken so we didn't hear people getting ice all night. The skylight in the bathroom had enough lightbulbs so the burnt out one didn't seem to affect the lighting. Wifi is extra but so are many other places. I didn't need the alarm clock plugged in so that was the outlet I used as I could not find any other sockets but the ones that were used by the lamp and the clock by the bedside. The other choice was the one other socket on the other side of the room but that is not where I wanted to sit. Once I unplugged the clock and got the cobwebs off the plug, it worked fine. And I didn't see any of the spiders that made such a fine network of webs. The next day, again ran back to the room from the conference only to find that once again, my key didn't work. I knew better than to get the other key. I explained my situation to a staff lady there and she directed me to a phone to call. They said somebody would meet me. I waited outside the room for about 10 mins. and then got impatient. I asked somebody else who worked at the hotel and she said to go get another key from the front lobby. I told her I was not going to walk another 10 mins. to the front lobby as this happened yesterday also. I think my voice was getting louder as another staff said he would open the door for me (didn't check any i.d.). About 10 mins. later, a man knocked on my door and said "Oh, somebody must have opened the door for you."
