I told him the key didn't work yesterday but it was because another couple came into our room. He thought this was funny and burst out laughing. He then checked the lock and said it was broken. He said it would take him about 10 mins. to change it but needed to be in the room to do it. I declined as there does not seem to be an abundance of privacy in this hotel and I am missing it! Sadly, I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Can you blame me?

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: YorktownBob
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again even for a conference. The food on property is very low quality and expensive. We asked about local restaurants and nobody seemed to know where any were located. Our last night in the area we found a shopping area with numerous restaurants about 1.5 miles away. I really can't believe no one at the hotel knew about that area. As far as the rooms, they are reminescent of a failed motel--old furniture, woren fabric, and uncomfortable beds. The service was average to below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Peedee12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a meeting in May and enjoyed it immensely. The hotel staff was outstanding especially our breakfast waitress, Angelica Stephens, at the Trellis restaurant located on site. She was one of the best servers I've ever had. Cheerful and attentive, she was a joy to see every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Virgil00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at T&C over the weekend and fully enjoyed our stay here. The grounds were beautiful and clean. Yeah, the rooms might have been dated but we really enjoyed them. It would have been nice if the rooms had refrigerators in them and also more room in the bathrooms. They also made us pay for Wi-Fi, parking and the Gym. I am thinking that some of this should have come with the Room, seeing that we paid a lot of money for it. What would have been great is if they included Continental Breakfast also. Just some of the things that would have been the icing on the cake. We were in the one story rooms/Bungelows. We loved the atmosphere. The flowers and chairs/benches/tables all over the place. The plants were green, lush and beautiful. The pools were awesome, they had three of them. The convention center was big and nice and modern. Perfect for company conventions. The gym was actually well equipped and very nice. The only bummer is that we had to pay for it. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. Would have been really nice if it had some of the suggestions mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gardens and a very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Lenore_11
Reviews.Content: Town and County is not a new or modern hotel. It is a charming hotel that has the most amazing rose gardens. There are numerouse restaurants to meet any needs. The rooms are dated but very clean and comfortable. The location is amazing for any traveler. Once your arrive you have a huge shopping center behind the hotel with major stores and restaurants. The people that work there are very dedicated and helpful. A young man, Gonzo, helped us with a request that was unusual and made it easy.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: clutterstop
Reviews.Content: The Trellises Restaurant would be just another restaurant were it not for Angelica Stephens. She made you feel like you had come into her home and she was preparing a special meal for you. Whatever you wanted, needed, or desired was her pleasure to get for you. One of my colleagues just wanted coffee because she was in a hurry, and Angelica brought her coffee in a "go" cup, complete with sugar and cream to put in, if desired. My colleague had not asked for the go cup and was delighted that she could drink it on the fly. Whatever you do at Town and Country, stop in at Trellises and find Angelica. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay here again if coming to a conference at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: f8wins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2nd time (because of a conference) and it's convenient because my conference is here and it's right across from the mall, but I would not stay here otherwise. It's not terrible but it's not worth the price. I stayed in the tower (closest building to the convention hall and the mall). THE PROS: -Very nice balcony overlooking the pool. -Beautifully landscaped grounds with roses, lush green lawns, and climbing vines - At least 2 pools with comfortable looking lounges and a large jacuzzi. -Several (average quality) restaurants on the grounds. -Good water pressure in shower -next to the mall -freeway close & central location (between beaches and downtown) -Have a "green" program so change towels if on ground & sheets if leave card on bed THE CONS: -The room is very dated, with no fridge/mini bar or microwave -Furniture is worn/chipped/scratched/stained -Pillows are uncomfortable - flat and hard. -Thin walls and construction going on in a room 4 floors below me in the afternoon sounded as if it were coming from right next door. Also they did not mention that this would be going on during my stay and completely ruined any chance of afternoon naps, reading, or any quiet activity in the room. -They nickel and dime you to death (internet $10, gym $5, parking $14, check out earlier than initial check out date after you check in and you have to pay for a FULL night - even if it's with 6 days notice, .50 per local call) - apparently you can get a "bundle discount" for internet, parking, and gym but they don't mention it when you check in. -Room smelled like smoke -Shower head only good for short people (luckily I'm short but for anyone over 5'3" it could be a definite negative) -Phone was old and had bad reception (even for local calls) The hotel is fine if you have a conference on the grounds here - if not DEFINITELY stay somewhere else where you will get more quality and some of your basic amenities included!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you got money to burn”
Reviews.Author: groves_six
Reviews.Content: Good: hot water, nice flowers, most of staff is friendly and helpful. Bad: dated room decor, Wifi, parking, gym extra. No refer in room. Constant noise hammering and sawing all day. Trying to get out of parking lot is a joke. Complained to manager but no help. If I had read online reviews, I would not have come.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler212
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Town and Country too many times to count becasue it is the hotel of choice for my company. The property is beautiful but the rooms are just average. If I had the choice, I would probably seek out other San Diego Properties. The location is good. Its about 10 minutes from the airport. The Trolley is behind the property so getting to old town, downtown, and other San Diego attractions is very convienient. While the grounds are clean, the rooms don't get throughly cleaned on a daily basis. If you're looking for a freshly, nicely made up bed everyday, you won't get it here. I could tell that they don't change the sheets and just throw the covers back on the bed. I spilled some pizza sauce on my bed one night and the next morning, came back to a halfway made up bed with Pizza Sauce still on it. The back of the bed was also very dusty which lets me know that they don't vaccum often either. Service from the front desk to the bellboys was excellent. Not the best value. Restaurants are good but expensive, depending on where your room is, it can be ok in size but the TV, is 13inches and fuzzy and sometimes the bed lumpy. It can be hit or miss here so use your discretion. The picture is of the creepy girl who is hung up in just about every room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...bad beds!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrikaka
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pretty good time. With the exceptions of a few things. The first night we were woken up by people next door that were partying then soon turned to fighting between the hours of 2 am-4 am. The hotel staff were very accommodating and we moved rooms the next stay. The beds were not that comfortable and need to be replaced. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Wonderful service, ammenities, & convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: SicilianaDLG
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. We like the rooms and the location in Mission Valley is perfect for accessing things all over San Diego. We come here often and have a great experience each time!

Reviews.Title: “Service needs to match the product”
Reviews.Author: KKAAWW
Reviews.Content: The T&C is a beautiful place, with endless detailed attention to botanicals all over the charming property. It would be helpful if the in-room amenities would match that level of commitment. Yes, shower cap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner are appreciated and expected. More than 1/2 teaspoon of fake cream (real would be nice) to go with that in-room coffee; 24 hour access to the laundry room, more horizontal surfaces in the bathroom. Hard to get dressed when everything winds up on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “tired and expensive”
Reviews.Author: LLPCanada
Reviews.Content: A colleague who also stayed here commented that she had stayed here in 1995, and the place hadn't changed a bit - I could believe it! There were lots of little things wrong - doorknobs missing, handles on bureaus broken or missing. My husband was told when he called that they couldn't find a reservation in my name or that of my roomate - but they sure managed to bill us both, and take our credit card info. The supposedly secure internet did not require a password, (but it was included in our conference rate). Best deal was breakfast room service - got a deluxe continental with fruit, muffin, and yogurt that could have fed two with leftovers. Staff was generally pleasant, except at the front desk - they were only adequate. Staff in the deli/restaurant was great. Conference facilities were okay - tired. The rose gardens are lovely, and the pools looked inviting. Also, there was absolutely no security, and with an easy pathway to the Fashion Valley Mall this was a concern - anyone could get right up to room levels in all the buildings. All in all though, overpriced. Stay somewhere else nicer for the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “It is 2011 not 1981... it's time to update.”
Reviews.Author: AConferenceAttendee
Reviews.Content: The Good: It was right beside an amazing mall that had 4 anchor stores and every store you would want. Also had The Container Store. Since those are few and far between, that was a big pull. Josie at the Front Desk and EVERY BELL MEN = amazing staff. That was all. I know others had a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE with their check-in and front desk. The conference rooms were big and roomy. The Bad: The room was a bad 1980's dream (I was there I lived through that era). Royal blue carpets, not clean under beds (I always check that) and skimpy on amenities (coffee was hideous). The Ugly: thought most things were dated and for the price we could have stayed at the Mariott and had a modern room. Having only one bartender to serve 100s of conference attendees was RIDICULOUS (that says they were either unprepared or understaffed or both). The price of conference/room only included lunch and a few finger foods at two cocktails, no dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Hotel a great value!”
Reviews.Author: catherine30196
Reviews.Content: Terrific place for a convention. Lots of restaurants on the beautifully manicured property. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. There was no need to leave the resort unless you wanted to see San Diego. My only complaint was the $10 daily charge for wi-fi. A great place to eat is Trellises. Pat Mukzevicz is a fantastic server and knows how to take care of her guests. I highly recommend Town and Country Resort and Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or your money”
Reviews.Author: easilva
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to start. The ONLY redeeming feature of this hotel is the staff. They were attentive and prompt. Otherwise, I would describe this hotel as dated, over-priced (in every respect) and terribly located. To start with, the entire complex seems to have been designed and built some time in the 80s, and from the stains on the carpets and drapes I assume there has been no renovation since (never mind the creepy print of the little girl hanging in the room). This place will also nickel-and-dime you to death. They charge for use of the fitness room, parking (specially DISCOUNTED rate of $8 per day -- usually $16 for guests), and $10 per day for very patchy and painfully slow internet. What is it about the inverse relationship between the rate you pay for a hotel and the likelihood that internet will be included?!?! They have plenty of on-site restaurants that provide service with a smile (again, the only redeeming quality) but you'll end up paying way too much for really mediocre food. The location doesn't help -- it's in a wasteland surrounded by highways. The five nights I spent here were among the most unrestful I've ever had... and I'm into backpacking. To starte, the beds were terribly uncomfortable. Every night some time between 1 and 2am we were disturbed by loud conversations from people returning to their rooms; it seems to me that a complex like this should really have a designated quiet hour. Bottom line: the management of this place is incredibly negligent. Save your money and go to a Days Inn -- it'll be just as clean (and maybe cleaner), the food will be better and you'll probably have parking and internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and professional service, unexpected warmth and friendlinesss”
Reviews.Author: gettingitdone
Reviews.Content: Sonya, Tina and Sherida were very assertive and professional in handling a difficult situation regarding the return of an item I left in a cab. They clearly communicated to myself and to the driver that he had not followed the policies and procedures in place and he had inappropriately handled the situation. Although cabs aren't actually 'staff members' the Town and Country is explicit about in the type of service they expect out of the cab drivers who solicit business from them. And quite clear about what is unacceptable. Thank you Sonya, for doing what's hard because it's the right thing to do. And Thank you Town and Country. I can't wait to return with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “As always, had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasBaseball
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying at Town & Country. Has all the amenities and within proximity to all the areas we visit. Would like to be able to bring my small dog.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Needs Updated”
Reviews.Author: pamd30
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in March for a conference on the resort – the grounds were beautiful and kept very clean. The pool (heated!) and hot tub areas were large and well equipped with towels and sitting areas, which were also kept tidy and clean. The room itself was OK, but should really be updated. There were odd paintings of ducks in the room, an old navy blue carpet, and very odd bathroom doors that slid open like a closet door. The beds were not very comfortable and the air conditioner would not cool below 70 degrees in the room. The hotel is located next a large outdoor shopping mall, which is very convenient if you need a shopping fix. The train to downtown is right by the resort as well, so you are not far from mass transportation. I would suggest staying here to anyone in the area – although the rooms are outdated and a little chic, the location and amenities are worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust004
Reviews.Content: Room was in a bungalow posh Butlins style. Well layed out in very large open grounds with palm trees everywhere. Very comfortable with well appointed room and all the facilities which business travellers need. Did not like the room as very dark with dark wood furniture and deep blue soft furnishings. Breakfast very enjoyable in the restaurant and staff very accomodating. Would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: summitsvs
Reviews.Content: Traveled here for business, would definitely stay for pleasure. The grounds are beautiful, the facility is clean, clean, clean. Even with the resort full it seems like you are in your own private resort. The golf course nearby looks beautiful and challenging and there is a upscale mall right across the street. Plenty to do close by and the trolley stops right in back of the property for quick, easy access to wherever you would like to go. They do have a fitness center and spa. The charge is $5.00 per day with unlimited fitness center access.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Time - Great City!”
Reviews.Author: mike2659
Reviews.Content: My trip was planned to spend "quality" time with family and friends in the San Diego Area for a perid of 10 days. From the moment I arrived on site at the Town and Country Resort in Hotel Circle, my experience and contact with the various employees at check-in, parking lot attendees, coffee shop and other areas visited/solicited was nothing less than outstanding. Respectful. Courteous. Smiles. These infectious attributes, coupled with the quality room care and appearance, helped make my stay much more enjoyable. The ground maintenance and overall cleanliness add the glamour to this remarkable hotel. The hotel is conveniently located (walking distance) to two major malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: rkumarael
Reviews.Content: Great place for a conference located in the Hotel Circle area in san Diego located in a several acre sized lot. Several large meeting areas and rooms Good restaurants and a short walk to the Mall in Fashion Valley

Reviews.Title: “The sta ff and facility exceeded all my expectations and the conference we attended seemed perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Janradford2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have maintained leadership roles in many large conferences the past twenty years. I serve in the hospitality industry (for seniors), as does our son. I was particularly awed by the peace of the servers as they waited on us ( over 1,000 attendees) twice daily. Both professionals and volunteers (80% women) who participated in this conference commented on the "cared for feeling" they experienced, the eye contact each waiter made, and the use of the names of those who were served. Mark Yonker "wowed" us daily providing for some unique gifts such as special wines, appetizers and dietary requests. Katherine Westcott-McCarthy assisted with all the details exhibitors and registration managers requested. My husband said he had never relaxed so much at a conference as he did at this one last week. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel chain--quaint, beautiful, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ontiv50
Reviews.Content: This resort is outstanding for any conference needs. The grounds are beautifully maintained, the food is excellent and everything is spread out so you never feel cramped. Rooms are nicely furnished, no saggy beds. Numerous outdoor pools. Trellises restaurant is wonderful with a fabulous staff but ask for Pati for the best service! Not a place to bring young children since not much for them to do on site except pool. Resort has shuttles and nearby trolley that takes you to local attractions and into other parts of San Diego. Hotel is connected via walkway to a large outdoor mall with lots of large chain stores, restaurants and movie theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellence”
Reviews.Author: frommontana
Reviews.Content: I met Terry Sobkowiak (?) and see told me about some great places to visit that were close since I did not have a vehicle. Even told me about a scrap booking store close by! Service was excellence....needed some extra towels and they were brought right up! Little chilly for pool but I enjoyed it! The grounds are beautiful and very clean! Thanks to Barbara too! Called to say what a great time I had and she was very polite! Next time I come, guest told me to stay at the Kona Kai (?). I guess it is a sister hotel? I enjoyed this so much......it is worth the try there too!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference!!”
Reviews.Author: BryonGarner
Reviews.Content: On behalf of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc., Western Region, I would like to commend the staff of Town and Country for their excellent service during our 2011 Leadership Conference from March 10th - 13th. In particular, I would to especially commend Katherine Richardson who tirelessly attended to every detail - solving our challenges and problems - at all times. Without fail, I knew that I could always rely upon her. I would also like to commend the following for their outstanding service: Jonathan Myrha Sara Ramirez Lauren Petersen

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away”
Reviews.Author: LTA_11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went away for a "girls" weekend. We had specific plans and places to visit. Town and Country was the PERFECT location for all our plans. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful right from the start. The room was a great size and very clean and neat. I think there was a convention of some sort going on, so it was a bit loud with people laughing and playing in the pools at night, but we were on vacation and it lent to the fun atmosphere of our trip. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Rez the bartender is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Dianabplz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town & Country in San Diego Feb 11 - 19 - partly for business, partly for mini vacation. The hotel itself reminds me of the Kellerman's place on "Dirty Dancing" however, Rez, the bartender is AWESOME. Definitely have his chocolate martini - it's his specialty.

Reviews.Title: “Katherine Richards”
Reviews.Author: Var13
Reviews.Content: ConDor Convention was held at the Town and Country February 25-27, 2011. During the course of the event, there was heavy rain causing some flooding in our Merchans Room. Katherine Richards and her team did a great job in cleaning up before the room was due to open to our membership. Katherine went above and beyond to the point where she carried a mat across the hotel complex to cover a power cord that couldn't be taped town due to the damp carpet. I would work with her any time!

Reviews.Title: “The location was nice and service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: billseto
Reviews.Content: Our conference was 3200 people strong and the hotel accommodated our group without a hitch! The food was fair but the service was excellent, especially to the people with special diets. The staff was cordial and nice at every turn. I would recommend this hotel. I defintely

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest service ever (spoiled us); very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Anna41601
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in San Diego, we were convenient to everything. But, especially, after doing all the tourist sites and being gone all day, we loved the fact that we could just come back and relax at our own hotel for supper: once at Kelly's and at Trellis another night. Both places gave us the best service on a 9 day trip from Az. to San Diego to Palm Springs to Vegas. Wait Staff I must mention are: Pati Muklevicz, Angelica Stephens (who even called her husband on her cell phone to give us directions to Palm Springs, and Miguel Velazques. All of the above went above and beyond. The only negative was the bathroom was very small. You can tell it was an older hotel due to the bathroom, but the hotel was very well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: jng1000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Town & Country last week and we had a really pleasant time. the service was good, the pool and jacuzzi were close to our room, the room was very clean and organized and the value fit exactly what we were looking for, and to top it all off, our sales person, Margaret Kennedy, helped us a great deal in planning our stay at the town & country. we'll definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: koekeloerusrups
Reviews.Content: We had excellent support from the whole staff. Reception, parking watch, concierge etc etc. The Spa was excellent. The park felt like a tropical island. Only the morning travel to the convention centre took a little long. Not enough restaurant choices near the Hotel. Still plenty reasons to return. Our breakfast girls Pati Muklevic and Angelica Stephens were very warm and helpfull. Yesss good value for money and absolute candidate for a revisit.

Reviews.Title: “a Bit run down”
Reviews.Author: hcii
Reviews.Content: the resort has probably been a nice place. 25 years ago. now however it is pretty run down. could need a lot of polish. we got stuck in the elevator when we arrived. rooms are clean and convenient, shopping mall is very close and good stuff. drawback is the location far away from the city center. you can't just walk out I. the evening (ok, a rather european thought ;-) taxis to hillcrest under 15$ to city center about 25$

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost....”
Reviews.Author: Judyi333
Reviews.Content: For the price...okay for any price, this place was just bad. We asked for extra towels and hangers and it took them over two hours to get them to our room. Rooms were very 1983 in decor. Door between bathroom and room was a pocket door that constantly rattled. TV had the worst reception I have seen in a hotel in over 20 years. You must pay to park and for internet. Driving around the facility nothing is clearly marketed and their staff could not direct us where to unload for the trade show. Even though you prepaid for the internet, the connection was poor and extremely slow. Resturants were also poor. We ate at Kelly's and it smelled like a nursing home and the food was terrible. Went to Charlies for drinks and was impossible to get service. Decor was also terrible. Save the money and stay at another hotel nearby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Resort”
Reviews.Author: raaguilar23
Reviews.Content: I want to take this opportunity to say how much I enjoyed my stay at The Town and Country Resort in San Diego, CA. The tropical landscape and pools were well maintained and provided a comfortable and relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Best Valentine's trip ever”
Reviews.Author: AJFdpm
Reviews.Content: Left Chicago for sunny San Diego with my girlfriend for a valentine's to remember and could not have been more happy with our stay at the Town and Country. Check in took two minutes, check out took one. Our room had a gorgeous panoramic view of the pool and palm trees that line the resort, as well as the hills beyond. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the amenities couldn't be beat. Lunch outside Charlie's was great and dinner at Trellises was fantastic. All in all one of the best trips i've ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: dna940
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town and Country when we went to San Diego to attend a business meeting and also to visit our daughter. We found it to be not only a great value but very nice and comfortable and up to date. Our room was great with a good view of the area. Each morning we had the buffet breakfast that was included and there was a good selection of all types of breakfast foods and we saved a lot by not having to go to a restaurant to eat. The pool area was also nice and we enjoyed the hot tub as well. For us the location was good because it was easy access to the city and not far from the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: misskitty6
Reviews.Content: Loved the Town & Country Resort. Held a special event there.Staff is superb, amenities great. I highly recommend convention planners to strongly consider the Town & Country Resort & Conventin Center! No complaints, just compliments. Thank you Town & Country!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay - Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Noelcito
Reviews.Content: I live in Temecula area and I had to attend a conference in San Diego and was looking for hotels to stay at when I came across the Town and Country Resort. I spoke to Margaret Kennedy from the Sales Department and she was so pleasant and wonderful to talk to that I trusted everything that she said and was very convinced that this is the hotel to stay at. Well, she was right. The feeling as you walk in the hotel is like walking to your living room. The Front Desk and Bell Staff greeted you with a smile. Everyone was just so nice. I have stayed at hotels in San Diego and this just tops them all. I knew I was far from home but still got that feeling of HOME. It was a perfect stay for me. Unfortunately, it was a short one but I am convinced that I will let my collegues and friends know on how great I was treated at this hotel. Kudos to Margaret for such a warm first impression. She was the reason that I stayed at this property and I was very happy about my choice. Thanks, Margaret...you are truly a gem at your resort. I will definitely be back...SOON.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice service at the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Mick089
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to San Diego on business and stayed at the Town and Country hotel. We were pleased with the service at breakfast at the Trellis restaurant. Pati Mukzevics was our server, and she made us feel right at home. The eggs benedict were excellent, too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect a Hot Shower!”
Reviews.Author: Rockshire
Reviews.Content: During our three night stay, we got lukewarm to downright cold showers. Maintenance attempted to address the issue but did not solve the problem. We were given the option of changing rooms but everyone in our party of ten were having the same experience in various sections of the property so changing rooms would not have helped. We were staying in what the resort coined as the country bungalows. Another way of saying the rooms were musty and dated. The grounds were beautifully landscaped with trellises, patios and greenery. Several restaurant options were available on site. The lounge/bar was taken over by children that were there for a gymnastics meet so it was not to be enjoyed. Noise was an issue. You could hear guests in neighboring rooms and people moving along the walkway outside the room. You need to be prepared to do some walking to get anywhere. Golf cart bell service is provided to get you to your room with your luggage. If you are willing to wait I guess they may pick you up at other times also. Internet is not provided free of charge not even in the convention meeting rooms. This was by far the worst accommodations I have ever had to endure.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Kaihonu74
Reviews.Content: Nice grounds. Thats it. Choice of room decor is not good. I asked for a King and only had smoking even though the rez was made months ago. Away from any decent dining. If I knew, Iʻd stay at the Courtyard across the street and walk to the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PSE_11
Reviews.Content: I was at the Town & Country for a conference and found the staff to be excellent, the food wonderful, and the landscaping beautiful. I even had the time to golf and found the course to be above average compared to many golf courses that are next door to a resort, and not part of the resort property. I would highly recommend this hotel for a group meeting. We did book it for our convention of 500 people.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthann52
Reviews.Content: I won a silent auction on two nights and all the food at the Town and Country Hotel. Time was running out to use and I called the Management office to see if I could get two rooms for one night so we could take the kids. They made the adjustment easily. Since we live in SD, we weren't all that excited about going somewhere near home, but thought we'd make the best of it. Well, it was WONDERFUL! We were upgraded to a suite that looked like a millionaires home, treated like royalty even though everyone knew we were staying there essentially free. We ate dinner at the Trellis restaurant where our waiter Miguel was one of the best waiters ever! He made wonderful suggestions and didn't hurry us or worry about teenagers in their nice restaurant. They even accommodated my gluten allergy, making special meals for me and my daughter who also has the allergy. The food was wonderful. The staff was great and the manager Michael Orantes was the best. I would never have stayed there or eaten there without the charity event, but it will tops on my recommendations to friends coming to stay in SD or for a great dinning place here inSD.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: socal2ma
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches were literally coming out of the woodwork in the bathroom, and there was mold on the bathroom walls & ceiling. The manager at the front desk was not very helpful or polite. I wouldn't choose to stay at this place if it had not been the location of a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: teacherkse
Reviews.Content: On their website they claim they will not disapoint. They have their work cut out for them if that is the case. This was one of the worst rooms I have ever stayed in. The room I stayed in had a shutter-style window, so the window doesn't actually close. This gave me the opportunity to hear everyone as they walked by my room and the freeway. What a horrible design idea. The room has three "porno" style mirrors on the wall in front of the bed. Apparently, I was not the only one who thought that, which was evident by what I can only imagine were bodily fluids on the mirror. Whoever picked out the artwork for the room needs to find a new line of work. There was a picture of this creepy looking vintage-style girl on one wall. If you ever stayed there you know what I'm talking about. If you ever stay there you will know what I mean. Bring something to cover the picture. On another wall was a latin-inspired print and colonial style flowers on another. I have no idea how they thought that matched. The bathroom had close to no room to put anything on the sliver of a counter they offered. Of course you wouldn't want a big counter since it would make the child-sized toilet look even smaller. The ironing board had years worth of crud on it that I feared would get on my clothing so I opted not to use it. I wont even bore you with my comments on the bedding, but enjoy. It's 2001, upgrade your 19 inch, broken, tube television. I ate one of their sandwiches they had for sale in the deli. If you get one of those, be sure to order two drinks so you can use one to soften the bread. I went to Charlies which is their pub style restaurant. Their food was actually okay. Their employees were appalling. I was the only customer when a group of ten people showed up and decided to eat outside. The entire staff made inapropriate comments about those customers. I know everyone jokes, which is fine, just don't do it in front of other customers. The resort will continue to fill their rooms since employers will continue to send employees there for conferences, which was why I was there. If your employer hasn't paid for your room and you don't require the convenience of being on the grounds for a conference, stay at the Double Tree. I always stay at the Double Tree when I am in that area and will continue to do so. Hey Town and Country, reinvest some of the money into the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with some flaws.”
Reviews.Author: ColdinCA
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, but the first day we realized we were freezing and could not get any heat. Maintenance called and we were told a/c on until 7 PM when heat would turn on. Only thing is it took over an hour for heat to work through lines so a shower was out of the question before dinner as the room was too darn cold. Outside temps in low 40's at night. Next day discovered that one of the louvered windows was totally missing. Rooms very clean and well decorated but planning showers around heat schedule a big pain. Also my sister's family was also staying there and their room was on the otherside of the complex. We had to drive to get there and in the process we had to pas through 2 ticket booths and stop and give out name and room number everytime even though we had the daily parking ticket on our car as hotel guests. Then the same thing on the way back to our room. Very annoying. Make sure if you are staying in multiple rooms that you book them near each other! I think we paid premium prices for major inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms desparately need updating; exterior beautifully landscaped.”
Reviews.Author: ponygirl87
Reviews.Content: I have actually never left a review before but I felt that this place warrented one. I traveled here for a conference, and while the hotel was beautifully landscaped there was nothing else to compliment- especially at $130-150/night. I tried to check-in and the front desk said that the reservations I had made in October had been deleted 2 days before my check-in (This also happened to one of the colleagues I was travelling with). I had the paperwork from my original reservations in hand so they finally relented and gave me a room. My colleague was denied a room and ended up at the Marriot across the highway (much nicer and newer anyways). The hotel is very spread out, and I dragged my luggage to a two-story building in the center of the "resort" - there were no elevators so I had to carry everything upstairs myself. I found an extremely dated room that looked older than I am. The room was a decent size but the walls were thin and I could hear my neighbors. Cracked tiles in the bathroom, hair on the bathroom floor, the tub handle came off everytime I tried to turn on the shower and the toilet rocked. My closet doors didn't shut all the way, and there was only one available power outlet in the room, unless I wanted to unplug the lamp in the room. The bed was hard and the comforter was so old that it was covered in fuzzies/pilled spots on the fabric. The tv was old and only got a few channels and I got to use the internet for 5 min one day out of the 6 I was there by walking to someone else's room. The hotel has wireless but it is EXTREMELY spotty and will cut off in a few minutes. The maid staff seemed nice, but were never consistent in what they left me- one day they took the bar of soap I left by the sink and never replaced it, somedays I had plenty of towels, somedays there wasn't a single washcloth in sight. I tried the Sunshine Deli, The Cottage Cafe, Trelisses and Charlies. The staff and food at the Deli were great- they had amazing chocolate chip cookies. The Cottage Cafe was okay, Charlies was completely unaccomadating to food allergies and food allergies were hit or miss at Trelisses. We had lunch at Trelisses and had a rude waiter named Jesus who did not even try to accomadate my food allergies (no acidic foods- ie no tomatoes/citus/bell peppers- I just wanted a plain salad) he completely ignored our table and I actually had to find another waiter to get our check (I used to wait tables in college so I am usually very understanding if servers are busy or such). We went back to Trelisses another night and had a server named Jamie and she was great. I wasn't the only one who had problems- one of my other colleagues went 3 days without hot water before they would move her into another room and she missed several parts of the convention trying to wait for the maitence staff. If you want to use the gym it is $5/day and the sauna and hot tub are $25/day. We went to the concierge several times with questions, and everytime were given answers- ie. whether we could print boarding passes, get a ride somewhere, etc. I think that the only reason this hotel still gets business is that there is a conference center located on the property so it is convient for that. But you are MUCH better off simply renting a car or taking a taxi the ~1mile across the highway from the Marriott everyday to the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Like a 1980s retirement community”
Reviews.Author: eruditetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention and left early. If you've read other reviews then you know that this Hotel is very old and needs updating. The best way I can think of describing it is to say: "Think of staying at a 1980s retirement community." The grounds are nice and there are people driving around in golf carts (because the place is so spread out) but the furniture is old and looks like grandma has been using the same bedspread that your mom grew up with. You check in at the lobby then walk or get a golf cart escort to your room. I had reserved a King room but was given a double (not a big deal). The rooms have very old decoration, old TVs (cathode ray tube), fuzzy reception on several channels but are otherwise very clean. The mattress on the bed felt old and stiff. I could feel individual springs through the sheets. Internet is provided by ATT-wifi (daily fee) and is spotty at best (can check an email or two before signal is lost). I called to ask where the best place in the complex was for a good signal and was told "outside." While this may be accurate I don't feel that it's an acceptable answer. The conference facilities have been fine so far and I think that's why this place still operates. I ran into several other conference attendees who were also a little surprised by the hotel rooms as well. I'm not really a hotel snob but if I'm paying upwards of $150 per night for a hotel I expect something better than what Motel 6 offers. If you're old this place will probably remind bring back memories. If you're under age 65 I would recommend looking elsewhere. I was able to check out early. They were nice enough to waive the $50 per night fee it would have been to check out prior to my scheduled stay. I haven't seen this policy at other hotels so it leads me to believe that the situation has come up more than once at this place. I had some pretty bad experiences with the parking lot attendant and security guard which are likely isolated incidents related to personalities and led to me leaving the hotel early so that's why they waived the fee. Pros: Clean Landscaping with lots of flowers and trees Several restaurants on site Good for old people Friendly front desk staff Cons: OLD OLD OLD beds and decoration Very hard old mattress Old cathode ray tube TV with fuzzy channels on 1/2 of my stations Spread out - everything is a walk from your room. Wi-Fi internet - poor signals throughout, unreliable, not for business traveler Beware of angry security guy and parking lot attendant. Let's say you book for a week but need to leave early, you are charged $50 per day for the remaining days on the reservations that you didn't stay. Not good for young travelers. If you have to attend a conference at this hotel I would recommend booking at the Courtyard Marriott (where I fled to) across the Interstate (about 1 min drive) or one of the others next to it.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: The Town & Country is set in beautiful garden atmosphere. Roses/flowers/palm trees/shrubs are throughout the entire property, with swimming pools in several locations. A very quite place to stay, great place to rest and relax. The restaurants are great, food very good and service always prompt. Kelly's Steak House has a wide selection menu with most reasonable prices on everything especially their steaks. Excellent place for a family to dine. From check-in, to bell service, to house keeping and beyond, a most professional staff. Their training shows in the performance of all the employee's. The Staff on the front desk could not be nicer and more efficient. Even with the lobby full of customers waiting to check in, they all maintain an alertness while handling your details and make every effort to make your wait as short as possible. I have been a customer for some 25 years at this fine hotel, and it just gets better with each year. The upkeep of the property is ongoing, and it seems every effort is being made to upgrade the rooms and in these economic rough times that's a gigantic undertaking. The grounds are impeccable and certainly gives you that home away from home feeling. Large upscale shopping center within walking distance. Public transportation readily available right at the rear of their parking lot. Close to many family attractions and in fact you can view the fireworks show at Sea World every night right from the property. Room rates are very competative with the surrounding properties and many times are lower. Hugh Convention Center facilities available for groups wanting meeting space and not having to leave the property during their stay to tend to business. Absolutely a great property to stay, with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms but dangerously poor service for those with food allergies”
Reviews.Author: crowen
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was fine... not great, not terrible. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are big, clean, and comfortable. The big problem I had with the Town & Country was the borderline negligence of the wait staff at the Trellises Garden Grille. I have an allergy to wheat. As such, I come prepared to notify the waitress or waiter whenever I eat out. I ate at Trellises for lunch and breakfast almost every day I was there and each time, I was sure to let the wait staff know about my allergy. Without fail, every time I was served something, there was wheat in it - croutons in the salads, pastry puffs in the soups, and on one occasion, I was served fish that had been dipped in flour and then cooked. With the fish, I took one bite, and immediately tasted wheat so stopped eating, but that little bit was enough to cause a pretty bad reaction and send me back to my hotel room early that day, making me miss several presentations at the conference I was attending. When I asked the waitress to verify if the fish was breaded or had wheat on it, she said "Oh no, it only has flour". I explained to her that four was made from wheat and she apologized and had the cook make me another dish. But when I got that one, it still appeared to have flour on it (probably from the grill). I told her I didn't feel comfortable with it, and she proceeded to argue with me about how seriously they take food allergies and how the fish was fine. Needless to say, I didn't eat it, and then got more grief about it when she came to clear the plates. Maybe I'm being a bit uptight, but I consider it pretty dangerous to not know what goes into your dishes and then reassure someone with a food allergy that their dish is fine, when it clearly is not. The lack of competence in making dishes without an allergen which is specifically flagged is dangerous... my allergy isn't as bad as others, but I would be worried for someone with a severe allergy because the restaurant staff clearly doesn't give a lick. Just to contrast, the next hotel I stayed at in San Diego, did a fabulous job with the wait staff double checking with the kitchen for each dish I ordered, and not making me feel bad about it either. I walked away from that stay feeling fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, good service, great location but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Franco77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town & Country Resort & Convention Center for 4 nights while in San Diego for a conference. This hotel complex is very beautiful and it is maintained very well. I stayed in one of the rooms in the single story section of this complex. The room was nice but the TV and reception were not as nice as I would have expected. I guess you don’t go to San Diego to watch TV though. I would have liked to have seen one of the rooms in the Royal Palm Tower on-site though. I imagine they would have been a little nicer, albeit a little pricier also. On-site I ate at Trellises Garden Grille, Kelly’s Steakhouse, and the Terrace Café & Deli. I also stopped in one evening at Charlie’s (a sports bar on-site) to relax and have a few drinks. The gentleman who managed Charlies (I’m sorry his name escapes me right now) was an extremely nice guy. I had a very pleasant time while there. Pati M. was one of the waiters/waitresses that was at the Trellises Garden Grille and she provided very nice service. They had excellent (also a little pricey though) breakfasts. Everyone was very courteous and pleasant there. The hotel complex is almost like a botanical garden. To top it off, the Fashion Valley Shopping Mall is right across the walk bridge from the hotel complex. It was a great place to shop. I would recommend that you seriously consider staying at this hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Palms Tower rooms & hospitality suite are top of the line!”
Reviews.Author: mmbhh
Reviews.Content: In February 2010, we arranged a great price of $99 per room for a minimum of 10 rooms, including a hospitality suite, through Kristen Warnken for the LEAGUE OF EXCEPTIONAL GENTLEMEN (LEG) group to celebrate New Year's Eve. She also arrange free parking for our group which we appreciated. She then arranged for me to work with Sarah Ramirez to maintain an accurate count of everyone who booked a room(s). Both Kristen and Sarah were easy to work with, and very accommodating; it was a pleasure to work with them. In addition, Katherine Richardson also accommodated us by ensuring the hospitality suite was adequate. The hospitality suite was marvelous; it was beautifully furnished and had everything we needed to host a pre-New Year's Eve party for our group of 25. Everyone loved it. Everyone also loved their room which were also beautifully and tastefully decorated and, again, had everything you needed. They were quiet and very comfortable too. We all had a fantastic New Year's celebration there.

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with lots of pools in sunny San Diego”
Reviews.Author: buddyroopdx
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not take my breath away, but it also didn't disappoint. I stayed her with several friends in a few different friends for a conference. I would not stay here outside of some special event. The room was average in the far tower. It was nice to have a balcony and convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Northerner50
Reviews.Content: This property represents a peaceful oasis, in a sea of busy San Diego-n's. The property is beautifu with gardens well tended. Very very clean and well cared for even though the property is a bit older. I'll take this over any new high end place. Once here, I relaxed and could breathe. Truly a lovely place to land on a busy "island". Will be back again soon, for the third time. Rooms in the bungalows were homey and welcoming. Beds could be updated, but overall a sweet respite from the hustle and bustle. Also, great location to shop--walk over to Fashion Valley Mall with all it's high end stores.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: trigeekgirl236
Reviews.Content: I had heard unfortunate things about this hotel from a colleague and from other Trip Advisor reviews, so my expectations were pretty low. I was very pleasantly surprised by my stay as a result. The grounds are beautiful and I enjoyed eating breakfast and lunch outside. My room was older, but it was very spacious (probably because I got an accessible room for some reason). The architecture was unique, rather than being a hotel that could have been plunked down in any city. The staff were helpful and funny. The chintz-explosion decor was not to my tastes, the Internet was so slow I didn't even pay to use it for most of my trip, and the rooms could use more power outlets in better places, but overall, the hotel was comfortable and quiet, the staff was excellent, and I had a wonderful few days in San Diego as a result. Tip: Walk over to the mall via the footbridge. From there you can catch public transport, watch a movie, have a meal, or just walk around and windowshop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: PVL-trav
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! It's centrally located. The grounds are clean and beautiful. The rooms are well-appointed. The bed was just heaven. The staff went out of their way to please us. Breakfast the next morning in the restaurant hit the spot. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... Even more amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: mserrano619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Town and Country for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Our room was absolutely breath taking and it was so peaceful. We were able to relax and enjoy each others company. The manager Tisha Williams went out of her way to ensure we had the best experience possible. Her extra efforts and great customer service made for an even more memoriable anniversary weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Happy33058
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Town and Country for an event that was held there on Saturday evening. What an amazing time we had, the property is beautiful, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone we came in contact with was professional and caring, we were always greeted with a smile. Tisha Williams in reservations helped my family and I book our rooms, she was great, she made sure we were all next to eachother. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego or anyone looking for a stay vacation..

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: 32655Barry
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times when visiting family and the Hotel Circle location is very conven ient to everywhere. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms, whether in the high-rise or in the rose garden cottages, are very comfortable. And the beds and the staff are the BEST. Barry Parker

Reviews.Title: “STAR Quality Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Denny1958
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed only one night, it was a delightful experience. Check in and check out was by Donna...very pleasant and efficient. She greeted me by name upon departure and was very thorough. Ordered room service and "Alvaro" (I think) delivered the food. It was delivered quickly and the quality of the food was terrific. Alvaro was very professional and personable. The room was spacious and clean and the room was quiet. The National Sales director, Margaret Kennedy, assisted me with the reservation and she is the consummate professional and quite charming. She answered all the pertinent questions I posed. I would recommend the hotel to anyone that is visiting America's Finest City.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - 90 year old mother had a great birthday.”
Reviews.Author: moncinna
Reviews.Content: Returned to Las Vegas after great stay at Hotel. took 90 yr old mother for her birthday. She really enjoyed sitting on balcony in morning and evening. Very conveinient to get around town as entrance to I-8 close by. Shopping mall next door was enjoyed by mother and wife. Walking distance. Eat at steak house very good. Everyone smiling and cordial at the Hotel. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!”
Reviews.Author: CrisSanLuis
Reviews.Content: Antique room, toilet rocks, hard pillows, no refrigerator, mini tv, The room was clean and the grounds were very pretty. We arrived at the hotel intending to go to sleep early as we had an early day and a long drive tomorrow. At 7p.m. the wedding reception began. Loud band and smoking area right outside our door. When I called the front desk to find out how long the reception was going to last they said 12a.m. I couldn't believe they would put people staying at the hotel right outside the banquet room. The staff just said the hotel is also a banquet and conference center. I guess the people thinking a hotel was for sleeping had no rights. Don't come here unless you want to party 24/7. Nice big pools. When my husband went to the lobby (2 football fields away) to see if there was another room available, the rude manager told him it was 8 on a Sat. night and they were booked. This must be the same night manager others complained about. She looked again and found a room in a tower 1/4 mile away with no assistance for moving. Needless to say, we will not be recommending this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “First class dump”
Reviews.Author: 67vert
Reviews.Content: While the grounds are nice, that does not make up for all the faults of this so called resort. Think large scale motel 6 with flowers and restaruants. Lights in the room were not only dusty they had cobwebs on them. The bathroom floor towel/mat was so old it was thread bear had holes in it. I have seen plates in the hall of other hotels when people put them out after getting room service however they do not sit in the hallway for 5 days, Service in the restaraunts is terrible, ask for a refill on my drink 3 times no refill. After you get the food you are ignored. The food is subpar and expensive including the hotel catering. Internet bandwith is so bad it makes the internet useless and it will only cost you 10 bucks a day for that. The hotel must beleive in hiring people who will do the jobs americans won't do. So language could be an issue, if you ask an employee for directions or help. If you like sleeping on the concrete then you will love the hard beds I would recommend you stay at another hotel and walk or take the trolley if you have a confernce here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, lovely grounds, but hard bed, lacks security”
Reviews.Author: Sometimestravler
Reviews.Content: Positives: Clean room, beautiful grounds, friendly staff, no "building noice" such as plumbing sounds, pretty good location. Negatives: The bed was hard as concrete which is the reason for the low sleep quality rating. The decor was 1980s. You pay extra for the well-maintained grounds. The biggest issue is the lack of security. The complex has two large hotel buildings plus multiple smaller units. I stayed in the largest of the hotels. It had an open-air entrance so anyone could walk in. The registration desk is in another building on the opposite side of the complex. In the large hotel building, you get off the elevator onto an open air walkway. The doors to the rooms are accessed from this walkway. It did not seem at all safe, Anyone could walk onto the grounds, walk into the hotel, and be hiding in the dimly lit open-air walkway. I did not see any security cameras or security guards.

Reviews.Title: “Veeeery old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller_EUR
Reviews.Content: Stayed @Town & Country for the second time for a convention. The venue has a nice flair and its outdoor attractions are likable. The walking distance to the attractive shopping mall across the street is a value add. The real drawback is the rooms' quality. Some very few are acceptable but most are begging for getting a complete overhaul. They are clean though but the corridors frequently smell badly and so do the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: OldOkie
Reviews.Content: This hotels has beautiful grounds but is more of a 2 star hotel on its accomodations. It was not worth the price and would definitely stay elsewhere if I return to San Diego. Good location next to the Fashion Valley Mall and rail system.

Reviews.Title: “3rd world Setting”
Reviews.Author: Pyropenative
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you miss the Tijuana setting... My room was in the tower on the 4th floor and working hammers were banging away below me @ 8A.M. My view was that of the S.D. Newpaper plant shop & below me was the junk yard... oh excuse me; the maintance yard. Carpets are even old... even the soap & shampoo was very 70s. The 300 s.f. room had a 25 inch TUBE televison. Whats up with that... ???? and the local reception was snowy... At the OCT 2010 price of $168.00 per night... the Marriott across the street is THE BETTER DEAL!!! No comp breakfast, no comp van pick-up to OR from airport. Had to rent a car because nothing around to do on the grounds... even the "lobby" for drinks SUCK!!!!! $15.00 for a sucky breakfest... STAY AWAY.... you have been warned

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: poncho525
Reviews.Content: I don't remember the room number, but the thrid floor room I was in had bed bugs - that I didn't discover until the next morning when I awoke with bites all over. The hotel was old. There was a stain on the floor that looked like a former crime scene. The TV was fuzzy and had poor low-def reception. There was hair on and around the toilet, in the tub and on the bed sides. This is more of a 50-year old motel, with a nice pool, than a "resort." The staff was nice the the food was acceptable. If you stay here check for bed bugs first. The matterss is ancient.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Egg Benedict at Trellises Restaurant served by Pati Mukzevict”
Reviews.Author: SherriJohnstone
Reviews.Content: Large air conditioned rooms and fabulous cookies. The plants give the place a peaceful feel. It is a large resort and I never managed to go to Trellises the same way twice.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel with very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gtbyrd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times over the past twenty years but this stay I was in the smallest hotel room I have seen in years. I called to be changed to another and they said they would try and get back with me but I never heard another word. I also left my glasses on the counter. I called and talked to lost and found and they said they couldn't help me. It is a beautiful location (San Diego) but the hotel leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Grounds and Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: taconista
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the grounds are like something out of a movie set. The gardens are quaint and delightful, full of flowers and hummingbirds. The place is a bit of a maze to navigate, but if you have time, that kind of wandering is relaxing and gives the feeling of being lost in your own world. The staff are amazing. I was there for a week-long business meeting. Staff were always right on the ball when we needed something, even if it was a crazy last-minute request, like a surprise lunch for 40+ people. They were really friendly, too. Every last staff person that I bumped into had a smile and a hello. That made such a difference during a stressful meeting. I would love to go back and spend some actual time relaxing there!

Reviews.Title: “I should have taken my girlfriend!!”
Reviews.Author: juerro
Reviews.Content: Having to drive a truckload of my daughter's stuff to San Diego wasn't fun, not to mention my baby moving away to college, and I needed a place to stay and park the truck (and it's contents) overnight. I was referred to this hotel by someone in my company familiar with the area, and he definitely steered me the right direction! By the time I got there, I had lost my marbles, and everyone put up with me quite well; exhibiting a great deal of patience through my lack of brain function; they were all very nice, and polite to the finest detail. The grounds were nothing short of a garden; palms, roses, etc., and meticulously maintained. From my balcony, I looked down onto a clean, clear pool and yard. The elevator was fast and smooth. The door lock functioned just fine, and I walked into a room with a four-post king size bed. The slider opened out onto a balcony that looked out across the Hotel grounds, across to the nearby hills, and yet still seemed private. The tv was neatly hidden in an armoire, and there was a gaming control tucked in there as well, although I didn't get into that. The room was clean, bathroom and shower as well, right down to the vacuum patterns on the carpet. I actually took photos with my phone and sent them to my girlfriend, just to make her regret not coming along! Even the evening guard/ lot attendant was great! I apologize as I do not remember the gentleman's name, but what a great guy; knew the area, was very personable, and was happy to offer suggestions and directions. My daughter and I dined at Trellises, and we both just sat and relished in what we had requested of the chefs. The service was both fun and attentive, all the while professional. I will never again be able to have that moment with my daughter, that last dinner out together as she grows from being Daddy's lil girl into an independent young woman, and Trellises created nothing short of a perfect setting. Thank you, to the staff and crew of Trellises restaurant and Town & Country Resort Hotel, for what you do everyday is now a memory and moment in time that I, and my daughter, will always have. When I come back to visit my lil girl, I will be sure to bring my girlfriend, and hopefully we will stay a little longer to enjoy your hospitality! A weary traveler and Dad

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a resort”
Reviews.Author: BigBear2000
Reviews.Content: We booked into the town and country for a conference in April. One of the more interesting facts is that when you check in you sign an electronic register that announces that there is a $50. per day / per room fee for checking out early. No mention of the charge when you book with their online system or with thirdparty web providers. The place was such a dump that we did check out after the first night and moved to the Marriott property just across the highway which was $50. per night less expensive and was far nicer, no ridiculous daily parking fee. If you are expecting a "resort" and the 1960's were a fun time for you, Town and Country is the place for you. I'm amused to read all of the rave reviews for one of the little overpriced restaurants. If you took those restaurant reviews out of the hotel list, you'd probably end up with two stars. I'd give Town and Country one star, just because there were no bedbugs in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Hasn't been touched since 1962”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a dated, worn, retro-type vibe, then this is your spot! This place is in need of some serious renovations, although I bet it was considered super swanky during its prime. Three of my seven light bulbs were burnt out upon arrival. It is clean though. The food at the resort is also stuck in the 60s or 70s, with little to no access to decent salads (iceberg lettuce anyone?) or vegetarian choices and NO mention of local or organic anything. You can, however, get coconut fried shrimp or hot wings and a wide variety of other previously frozen then deep fried items. Lodged between some shopping malls and right across the street from a golf course, you will need a car to see the sights (like the beaches) of San Diego. Very attentive and nice young staff which is why this place gets 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: netzie1948
Reviews.Content: The service we received while having a business breakfast in Trellises Garden Grill was excellent. Our waitress, Ms. Pati Muklevicz was delightful and took care of us in a timely and professional manner. The food was great and the overall experience keeps us coming back. Employees like Ms. Muklevicz are rare and a tremendous asset to any business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CorkyL
Reviews.Content: A friend, whom I had not seen in 25 years, and I had lunch in the Trellises Restaurant in the Town & Country Hotel, San Diego, CA. We lingered a long time over lunch. A most delightful lunch was enhanced by the superlative service from Ms Pati Muklevicz. She was patient with us, yet quite attentive. Her polite manner and frequent attention to our needs as we discussed old times were much appreciated. Thanks to Ms Muklevicz for making our lunch even more memorable. Glen Lenox, San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff. Great day...”
Reviews.Author: satomiy15
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. Great day spa and salon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Eat at Trellises Garden Grille and ask for Angelica Stephens!”
Reviews.Author: TeresaR60
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice resort. Even though it has been there a while the accomodations were very nice, quaint, clean and spectular service from resort employees. The hi-light of my stay was being served by Angelica Stephens at Trellises Garden Grille. Angelica is outstanding! You immediately feel like you are the only person on earth that she serves yet you watch her treat all her customers with the same sincerity. What an asset to the establishment!!

Reviews.Title: “Forrestal Reunion”
Reviews.Author: SunnySanDiegoMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week long trip to the Town and Country Resort. Everything and everyone went out of their way to be helpful, accommodating and make sure our stay was the best it could be. The rooms were very comfortable, slept like a baby! The grounds are amazing and many of our group thought they were in Hawaii, but without the humidity. We can't give the hotel enough kudos for the facility, banquet, and just the friendliness they gave our group. They even offered a shuttle vehicle for those wanting to go around the facility or even to places nearby. T&C certainly knows how to treat company...we were treated like royalty. Thanks everyone at T&C.

Reviews.Title: “No customer Service except Bell service”
Reviews.Author: SingleWomantraveler
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping and front desk was uncaring and inadequate. The room(3557) has stained seats on the chairs. The carpet in front of the sink was discolored and stained. Housekeeping had just stuffed the partially used cream and sugar packages from the previous tenant, for me to have the first morning, for my coffee. The front desk did not think this was important enough to correct. The second day of my stay, the room was not cleaned at all except, clean towels. The used bath mat was thrown on the side of the tub and used glasses were where they had been left. When I checked out, the front desk did not want to hear about it. The women’s expression did not change. There was no concern. I would not stay again at any price

Reviews.Title: “Just checked out today. IMO, this is a 3d...”
Reviews.Author: uclabruinn
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today. IMO, this is a 3d world resort in San Diego. I've stayed at many hotels for conventions and would not consider myself a picky person. To begin with, the customer service is horrible. I called for the location of the gym and was not told that there is actually an extra daily charge to use it. I found out when I arrived. The gym was not worth the extra cost. I asked for a small fridge for my room and was told it would entail an extra charge as well. Also, I was charged an early check out fee even though I explained to the manager it was a mistake, but they still refused to waive it. The parking attendants ate slow and inefficient. The rooms are dated, small and dingy. The walls and windows allow tons of sound In and out. In short, even if there for a convention, stay at a neighboring hotel at all costs. I for one will never be back. If I could give this hotel a zero, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, but not all rooms are created equal!”
Reviews.Author: aurorio
Reviews.Content: All in all, I liked the Town & Country. The grounds are beautiful, with several pools, lots of palm trees and a nice, relaxed vibe. I actually fell asleep next to the pool my first day. However, there are some pretty significant differences between rooms in the various buildings. A friend got a room in one of the towers, which was a nice, average hotel room with a good view. I was put in a smaller building in a room which was so cramped I got claustrophobic. It was like they took all the furnishings of a bigger room and tried to cram them in. The internet was expensive, as were the on-site restaurants. If you stay here, that is outside of downtown San Diego, you really need a car. I don't mind walking places at all, but I couldn't find anything decent, just a McDonald's at the mall across the street. I actually ended up cutting my trip short because I couldn't stand the idea of spending a few extra days in that cramped room, eating $25 hamburgers. So yeah, I would recommend this one, but only if you have both a rental car and guarantee you get a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Well Managed & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rrooyal
Reviews.Content: Town & Country on Hotel Circle is well managed and most convenient for its guests. This large property has different style rooms from those in smaller buildings to a ten floor tower. It has a bridge at the rear of the property to the great public service trolley and mall. Within the property are pools, restaurants, and gift shops. There are 350 rose bushes in bloom as well as other flowers and palm trees.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, serene, beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this resort for years and it is a gem. Very quiet, beautiful, well maintain grounds with one of the most professional Staffs anywhere. From the Executive personnel, front desk, bell service, to the restaurant wait servers, and housekeeping, they all provide the very finest customer service possible. Above and beyond, making you feel right at home. The person responsible for training certainly performs a first rate job, teaching what customer service is and should be when staying at a resort like the Town & Country. There are tower rooms and cottage's available. The cottages are located within an area almost botanical garden like, yet only a short walk to the pools, restaurants and gift shops. Very quiet areas for those seeking such. The tower rooms are well appointed and contain balconies which look out over the garden like grounds, pools and with wonderful views. Parking areas are close and adjacent to the location you are generally housed. Public transportation is a short parking lot walk from your door. An upscale shopping mall also a short one block walk. A golf course is directly across from the hotel, thus adding to the quietness of the area. The restaurants range from casual to a fine steak house, with prices most reasonable and the breakfast buffet is a bargain, being located right near a pool. Those with families will enjoy this resort and they even have movies on the week ends, shown on the lawn with popcorn, drinks, and all that goes with family enjoyment. There is a large Convention Center right on the property. Certainly one of the best resorts in San Diego and the rates are very reasonable with a Staff that puts Customer Service first and makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and beautiful gardens”
Reviews.Author: Jacquez2
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego to visit our daughter and grandchildren. Our grandkids came to stay with us at the hotel. The room was very clean and big enough for all of us. The grand kids loved the pools and jacuzzi. My wife and I loved walking around the beautiful gardens, very peaceful. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. We ate at the sports bar and the cafe and both were very good. Overall a very good experience- we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Well located--great for families”
Reviews.Author: BigSkyTravels
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego for a niece's wedding and stayed at the Town and Country with some of our family. We were allowed to check in early--very nice as we had just arrived from a very early flight. Our check in staff (Donna?) was very, very friendly. However we did find the concierge not helpful and not friendly. We stayed at the Royal Palm tower and had nice views of the pool and gorgeous landscaping. We were only a walk across a little bridge to the trolley station and Fashion Mall. The rooms were a little outdated, but super clean which is very important to me. We loved going to Starbucks right on the premises for coffee and their delicious rolls in the morning. A couple of things that can be improved--the charge for parking and charge for the internet should be eliminated--otherwise we had a wonderful stay and were glad to have chosen the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “family oriented”
Reviews.Author: mommykleib
Reviews.Content: enjoyed stay. kids loved the pool .I enjoyed the senery. close to mall and shops. would return in a heart beat. rooms very clean felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Zero star dump!”
Reviews.Author: eddie7224
Reviews.Content: I recently had the displeasure of staying at the “resort” when my association decided to skip all the other wonderful places in San Diego to stay, and choose this Victorian Shangri-La! Where to begin? First off the sleeping rooms are cramped, old and reek of mold. The sink leaked about a gallon of water a night and the carpeting looked as if it just came off Lollapalooza, gross! Although the roach I shared the room with the first night seemed like a nice enough character. I complained about the condition of my room to my association and I was told, to “get in line” as many of the other attendees were complaining also. Also, $10 a day for in-room internet which performed subpar was a rip-off. The grounds are nice, but very dated and boring. There is nothing to do on the hotel property (sorry “resort”). It is walking distance to a mall, but you can only window shop so much. I asked the front desk for fun things to do in the area and they kept insisting I stay on property and hang out at one of the restaurants. After 2 days of hearing this I finally gave in. Mistake! The food is bland, over priced and unless you like hanging out in a lifeless, barfly setting, not the place to be. English is also obviously a problem here, because unless you are inside the hotel building (sorry “resort”) finding someone on property to speak the language is equal to Indiana Jones finding the Lost Ark. The meeting rooms themselves are very old, offer NO modern amenities, have very poor lighting and in 2 of the rooms a house sound system that kept breaking up. The common areas of the place look as though they were decorated by a grandmother. Gaudy, out of date décor, like what you’d find at a garage sale and never buy or buy as a joke to give to friends. I travel a great deal and this was one of the worst experiences ever. If you have a say, stay away! However, if you are unlucky enough to have to come here, across the street there is a new Marriott, which I ended up staying at on my own afterwards, way better! FYI, the golf resort you see in the brochure is across the street and has nothing to do with the hotel (sorry “resort”).

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel atmosphere.manager Sherida...”
Reviews.Author: tmac02
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel atmosphere.manager Sherida Green was very helpful, courteous, and went above and beyond to help us with all of our needs

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cakegirl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town and Country Resort because of a convention I was attending. The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to accommodate. The first room we were given was a long walking distance from the convention center. We asked to be moved and were given a room closer to the convention center. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable and didn't hear alot of outside noise. The food was good and the wait staff very friendly. The resorts grounds were beautiful! Rose gardens everywhere and the grounds are so well kept. We would stay here again.
