Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel grounds are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: pjdoll
Reviews.Content: Employees are well trained. Check in was so quick considering how busy they were. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. They have a great piano bar. The only downfall of our stay was parking. If you're going in and out late at night the parking can be scarce. The hotel location is close to everything. Has easy access to freeways and beaches. Can walk to shopping mall or catch the trolley. The rooms were a little small and would have been nice to have queen beds and a sofa. The price I got online was great. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to get Home!”
Reviews.Author: Simply_Ses
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Diego, hope next one is better. Hotel was dirty, smelly, old and just way overpriced. Rooms look nothing like advertised on website. Front desk personnel were rude, however bellboy and restaurant (Trellises) staff very nice. 50+ dollars for room service which amounted to "NOT" fresh squeezed orange juice, chicken mcnuggets, fried chicken and cold fries. Front desk in dire need of Hotel manager or supervisor, as a whole lot of employees standing around doing a whole lot of nothing. Outdoor area well manicured and cleaner than the rooms maybe the landscapers should take over housekeeping. Small business center amounts to a pay to print console and 3 computers with internet access at 12+ dollars per 1/2 hour. Fitness center offered at the Bella Tosca Day spa and salon for a fee. High speed internet available in the room for a fee etc... I read another review and it's true this place will nickel and dime you to death!! Use of the Pool was free! Daughter and I had to make the trip for spine surgery and hotel staff was aware that we were checking in post op for some recovery time. We were checked in to an end unit facing the freeway underpass and hotel parking, it was almost comical how much noise and traffic was just outside our window. The up side is that we know where not to stay for our next post op visit.

Reviews.Title: “Injoyable”
Reviews.Author: David6505
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest places I have stayed. Front Desk Ms. Sherida Green could not do enough for us. The Bellman Kirk went above the call of duty. The Concierge Ms. Jill Moniz had a basket of fruit sent to our room it was our 44th wedding anniversary. From the gardner to the maintenance, housekeeping anything we ask for we got with a smile. Food was a little pricey

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort! - Old, Dirty and smelly”
Reviews.Author: loric1969
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for family trip to Comic Con - prices are high so tried for something reasonable. We were VERY disappointed! This hotel is not a resort, the rooms are very old (80's style bedding) and very small. A "patio" is advertised which turns out to be a bench in front of your room on the sidewalk between room and parking lot. They do have lots of beautiful roses and plants but the layout is ugly, most rooms look out on parking. Pool small and inconvienent from room. $14 a day to park too much. They hold events but don't allocate parking to hotel guests first. Twice had to park far from room - which is very annoying when cars are parked right in front of the room! Definately will not stay here again. Maid service was poor, beds uncomfortable. TV super small! In large tv cabinet which makes no sense. Used business center for printing $10 for 3 pages!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hyprrn
Reviews.Content: What a nightmare. I have a large family, there were 9 of us, and I booked 2 rooms 4 months ago for our family vacation in July. We arrived only to find out that "the hotel was oversold" and for the 9 of us the hotel gave us one room with one queen bed,,,and the other room with one fold out Murphy Bed no bigger than a queen! I had booked two rooms with 2 queen beds each room! When I complained I was told that they would provide "fold outs," Are you kidding me? It would have been spatially impossible to fit enough fold outs in those little rooms to sleep 9 people, not to mention a fire hazard. We were farmed out to two separate hotels for the duration of our stay. Yes. packing , unpacking 9 people over and over again is loads of fun. The Town and Country Resort was, of course, supposed to pay for these hotels. Right...No, I just had all the money from the last hotel we stayed at taken out of my bank account. Apparently Town and Country Resort never bothered to send over the appropriate "walk over" paperwork. After, yet again, tons of hassle, I am waiting for a refund and the management of Town and Country Resort is soooooooooooooo sorry. GRRRRRR. I will NEVER stay there again and do NOT recommend this place in the off or not so off chance they "over book again. \] /

Reviews.Title: “Jordan Gandara, bellman extraordinaire, was helpful, friendly, and went out of his way to assist me/all guests.”
Reviews.Author: CortneyAM
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Town & Country Resort Hotel, I needed medical attention and was concerned about getting to and from the hotel to an urgent care facility. Jordan Gandara was kind enough to help me locate the closest facility as well as drive me/pick me up so I didn't have to worry. He was kind, helpful, and compassionate to a traveler who was new to his city/hotel. I am very grateful for his kindness and help.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive, old rooms, nice staff, good parking, funny smell”
Reviews.Author: goober5555
Reviews.Content: Been placed in this motel twice as a result of convention booking. Looks nice, pretty grounds, convenient parking (but $15.00 per day for guests) -- But, old rooms, funny smell. Old bathrooms, no hair dryer in bathroom. Rooms basic and kind of small. Old, small tvs, certainly not flat screens or larger sizes, but most people are not spending a lot of time in rooms. Check in staff was friendly enough, but not great. However, expensive and over priced for what is provided. If it was much cheaper, would be okay, but really not acceptable for $200 a night. (plus $15 a day for parking ,plus $10 a day for internet, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: bharkin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Town & Country Resort in San Diego, CA on business and found the hotel and it's staf were great. The resort itself felt like you were back in time when leisure and fun were top on the agenda. I enjoyed all the lovely flowers, the pool and dining options while staying on property. I especially wanted to make a note that while dining in Trellises Restaurant both my server Pati Mukzivicz and the Assistant Banquet Chef Steven Lee were wonderful! Pati was very sweet and professional and Steven made it a point to come out and introduce himself and make sure we were enjoying our meal. It made my dining experience very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Roaches at Kelly's Steak House!”
Reviews.Author: JDinCdA
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the positive reviews but they must have been from short-term conventioneers because this is NOT a resort! It is old and dirty, overpriced on food and a front desk manager who could care less. The HSIA does not work and I was presented with a roach at Kelly's stead house which is advertised as fine dining. It is NOT. Oh and it's an additional $14 per night to park your car there! Hotel Circle is dead - go someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Meeting Planning”
Reviews.Author: myrevue
Reviews.Content: Having planned many conferences and dinners over the past 30 years, I recommend the Town and Country to any planner who needs assurance that the hotel staff is willing to work with the planner to do what is best for the organization the planner is representing. The director of catering, Felipe Ortiz, is the most responsive hotel representative I've ever worked with. He is thoughtful to the client, asks good questions to help lay out the details, and then actually remembers the details! Mr. Ortiz's attentiveness is shared by others in the convention planning department. Conference planners: Check out the Town and Country as a site for your next conference.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel/ Poor Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: bmoe6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very large, kind of hard to navigate around. But they did have maps in parking lots. The front desk was very friendly. We ate Dinner one noght in the Sports Bar and Grill and I have never been treated so rudely by a waitress. Very unfriendly, did not smile once, never came by and asked how our food was or asked for drink refills. We asked her a question about the menu and we received a very sarcastic attitude back. then the room we stayed in was nice it had a door with access outside to the pool. But the A/C and heater unit had no knob to choose air or heat, so u just turn it on and all night it gets really cold then really hot. Every morning me and my daughter woke up with stuffy noses and sore throats. It was very uncomfortable. Addressed my concerns to the Front Desk at check out but they just seemed to brush it off. So for the price per night which was $129, was very overpriced. Definitely would not stay there again. Very disappointed, especially saying that we stayed there 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but horribly outdated”
Reviews.Author: LisaArlington
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, taking advantage of that awesome San Diego growing season. However, the rooms are very small, filled with over-sized furnishings. The bathrooms remind you of your grandmother's bathroom -- only one person can fit in there, and hubby had to leave his toiletries on the dresser because there was no shelf space. But even worst were the paper-thin walls. The parking spaces are very close to the rooms (with single-pane glass in the large windows), so you constantly hear car doors slamming and moms yelling at kids to hurry up and get in the car. Once in the room, you'll hear your neighbor's TV set, and mom yelling at the kids to hurry up and get ready for bed. We were there for a business conference, but we definitely felt like we were on a hellish family vacation from the 1970s. The restaurants were expensive, slow, and had so-so food that also tasted like it was made by Betty Crocker. Finally, we had high hopes for using the bus and trolley station nearby, but they run so infrequently, we ended up taking (expensive) cabs everywhere. The hotel is very far from downtown geographically, and decades away from the things that most people do these days for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, outdated facility”
Reviews.Author: Legalease88
Reviews.Content: Came here on business attending an industry conference and as I pulled up from my shuttle, I thought it didn't look too bad. I entered to see a frantic and understaffed front desk that wanted to make me wait for 3 hours because my reserved room wasn't ready. I asked to be switched and they put me in a part of the hotel that was so outdated, I literally expected the guy from Fantasy Island to come out and greet me. All jokes aside, when I got into my room, it was filled with a musty and unpleasant scent, and had this creepy painting that just seemed... well a strange choice. The redeeming qualities could be found in the friendliness of the staff, from the Trellises and the responsiveness of the event AV guys during my lecture. All in all, however, if my conference is booked here again, I will be phoning in my portion.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: mehudson1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location, but expensive compared to the nicer nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: RafaelBenatar
Reviews.Content: A special mention to waitress Angelica Stephens. Her kind attention, care, and desire to please made me come back again and again for breakfast. She's an asset and deserves an award, if there is one.

Reviews.Title: “older conference hotel - nice location”
Reviews.Author: fully jim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days in this older conference hotel while I attended a function. It is located adjacent to the Fashion Valley Mall (nice) and a rapid transit train stop (very convenient). The rooms are comfortable and well decorated, comfortable beds. Like many conference hotels there were extra charges for things like parking and internet. Breakfast was rather pricey unless you purchased a package that included it (AAA rate). Their tiny coffee shop clearly wasn't designed to handle large groups on breaks. Fortunately it was only a 10 minute walk to the adjacent mall which has a nice food court and a few good restaurants. Overall rating... not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: wernermaus
Reviews.Content: Town & Country Hotel in San Diego is an outstanding Experience. Excellent rooms, 4 pool and ! ! ! one of the best service teams we evver had. The Trellisi restaurant is the choice for really fine dining. The whole site is perfectly gardened. Roses nd roses everywhere! Wow! What a hotel Special thanks to Robin Davis, Pati Muklecicz as well as Angelica, Jose, Jesus, Jacinto & Lucis from the Trellisis Site

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facilities, great location, beautiful outdoor areas for dining and recreation”
Reviews.Author: djs3612
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities were wonderful with plenty of choices for all meals of the day. The food was delicious and a nice variety. We could always find a quiet place to sit outdoors or around one of the pools, even though there was a large YMCA group there at the same time. Our room had a catherdral ceiling, which made the room feel spacious. The beds were so comfortable, we had a good night's sleep every night. One day, we needed to call maintenance and asked one of the cleaning ladies for help. She graciously called maintenance for us and then she checked back later to make sure they had come. Maintenance also responded very quickly, even though it wasn't something that needed immediate attention. Also, the concierge was very helpful when we had trouble printing our boarding passes for our return flight. Jill went above and beyond what was expected to help us. The location of the hotel was convenient for our other activites that were planned and also close to the mall, which was an added bonus. We loved taking walks around the gardens, enjoying the beautiful landscaping, even though there were a lot of guests in the hotel, it did not feel crowded. The only item we can think of that we liked least is that we would have preferred better lighting around the mirror outside of the bathroom to use as a makeup area.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises Good or Bad”
Reviews.Author: Butchboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town & Country for 6 days to attend a YMCA Gymnastics Tournament. Because the tournament was held on the T&C grounds, it was very convenient. The Room The room was just fine. As many have mentioned before, the room and grounds were very clean and tidy, and yes, a bit outdated. We had a standard room (2 queen beds) and it was roomy with a private balcony overlooking the pool area. Other families had a smaller room, so it may be just a matter of luck. And yes, we did have the weird picture of a young girl staring at us while we were in bed. My kids were freaked out, but it didn't bother me at all. The only complaints I have is that the showerhead is about 4 feet off the ground, so I had to bend over to get my head wet. Also the bathroom door is a sliding door and has no lock. My kids thinks it's fun to walk in on daddy during his "private" time. The Facilities The restaurants are great, but are way overpriced -- actually expensive. The deli sells Starbucks coffee at about double the normal price. The kids spent a lot of time in the pool, especially at night because it was heated. Bathrooms on the grounds and in the different buildings were hard to find and when found, they were very small (1 or 2 stalls) -- causing lines. A nice mall is located just behind the hotel with a walkway connecting the two. It was a great place to eat (decent food court) or to kill a few hours here and there. The Amenities Town & Country does charge you for everything. The rooms have no mini-fridge ($10 extra per day if you want one) which for an extended stay, causes a huge inconvenience. Internet access is another $10 per day. Fortunately, Town & Country uses AT&T for its internet service. So since I have an AT&T DSL account, I was able to access the internet for free. Internet service however was spotty and slow and there were times when I could not even connect. Parking was another $8 per day for hotel guests, but since I was with the YMCA group, I got a discount to $3 per day. Still, I'd rather pay zero. The convention area (where the gymnastics events were held) was nice. It was very spacious and clean. My only complaint about this area is that we were not allowed to bring food or drink into the area. The events were about 4-5 hours long and being able to snack on something would have been nice. Much to my surprise, there are no guest laundry facilities on site (just a dry cleaning service). The desk told us to go to the Best Western down the street to use their laundry. Instead, we googled for a local laundromat and went there since that would allow us to use multiple machines at once. Overall, my experience was good. With the YMCA group discount we paid about the same as we would have paid at the Holiday Inn. So all-in-all not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: Steve30196
Reviews.Content: Pati Muklevicz in the Trelises Restaurant took excellent care of us at Lunch the day before our conference ended and the food was excellent. We also enjoyed a great meal at Kelly's Restaurant - excellent value. The landscaping, especially the flowers were beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and the service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tophcluxc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the perfect location. You can jump on the trolley right at the hotel which allows you to explore San Diego without the headache of parking. Their employees were friendly and always willing to go above and beyond, especially one employee, Lauren Peterson who assisted in making our reservations and making sure everything we needed was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous staff and wonderful gardens”
Reviews.Author: rfewel
Reviews.Content: We were here to attend a conference for four days. My colleague has trouble walking and the staff bent over backward to accomodate her (AJ and other bell men). They were always on hand within 5 minutes or less to pick her up at the door of our room and take her around the resort, to the nearby shopping center, or even down into Old Town San Diego. They were courteous to the max and made us feel very spoiled. I also had my hair cut in the salon and got a new style from Patti, which I like very much. There was another Pati who served us lunch at the Trellis restaurant who was very gracious. I really like the gardens with the variety of roses, foxgloves, etc....beautiful flowers and plants throughout the site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: biotch
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Town Country for a conference, I was amazed on the service I received from the front desk staff, especially Jill the concierge, she not only help with getting around town but she personally walk me to a meeting that i would have been late for.the grounds are amazing, I love the trolley system, I am looking forward to my next conference there

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: desertrat161
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from the Town & Country, in San Diego. Our week at the hotel was first class all the way. From the moment we were greeted at the check in desk to the check out our experience was worthy of a "10". The room was well appointed, on the fifth floor, overlooking the pool area. When we walked around the grounds we say roses galore. It felt like a tropical paradise. We had dinner at the "Trellises" Restaurant, which was serving a lobster tail dinner, which was specially priced. The pool was well heated, which is important in the cooler temperatures in San Diego. We felt very relaxed and at home during our seven day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: tomcataiken
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed staying in San Diego for years but would never again stay at this place. It is a money-hungry, low quality resort. We have to walk miles to get anywhere. When we do come to our building, we have to walk down a passage through all the maintenance area and I don't even feel safe. There is no bell-hop service to be found. We bought a package that the front desk was inclusive of internet, fitness AND SPA and parking. Turns out the Spa was closed two out of the four days we paid for and the package didn't include the spa (at least according to the spa). Also when my husband and I went to the fitness center together, they told us that the package was for one person only. In short, this is one of the most disappointing hotel experiences I have ever had and we plan to check out early. I would rather just stay at a Red Roof Inn, where the expectations are low!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful lunch at Trellises Garden Grille at the Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: nancyzac
Reviews.Content: We just had a delightful lunch at Trellises Garden Grille at the Town and Country Hotel in San Diego. Wonderful food and great outdoor atmosphere in a garden setting. Flowers and plants everywhere. Our waitress was Pati Muklevicz, who tried to UNDERcharge us, but we caught the error and everyone ended up happy. Try the Chocolate Macademia Nut Ice Cream Cake.

Reviews.Title: “Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: ericjdonovan
Reviews.Content: I first heard of the Town and Country via a friend whom I asked for an affordable hotel recommendation. Our friend recommended contacting Barbara Whitlock at T&C. Barbara was fantastic in booking our hotel room and was able to accommodate several room/date changes on our end. My girlfriend and I were in town for the San Diego Rock and Roll Marathon (She ran, I cheered). We had a great time in San Diego and a great experience at the Town and Country. Check-in was incredibly quick and easy (no line or wait). The rooms were simple yet very clean. For us, the best part of the hotel was the convenience (less than 5 minute walk) to the Trolley which provided us with easy access to Old Town, the Convention Center/Race Expo, and the Rock and Roll Finish Line. I would definitely stay at the T&C again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever...................”
Reviews.Author: gutierrezmmc
Reviews.Content: Where should I start dirty room I had a bug on my pillow. The maid service left my room door open not just cracked open but wide open. The room smelled like smoke I had a headache all night. I was in nonsmoking room. Terrible experience terrible hotel. Some people state great hotel but could be that they have never stayed in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dispensing
Reviews.Content: I was here last year with my church group but I didn't get the same service that I got this time. When I check in at the desk I told Lisa I didn't get the room that I wanted last year, so she apologized to me and she went to get the manager Nancy to find me a nice room. It took Nancy almost 15mins to get the room that I want, I really appreciated. While I was waiting for my room, I found that the front desk people are very friendly and pleasant, they all try to ask me if I am waiting for help. Leah, Jamie and Donna, they all look so professional with their smile on their face. I had been to other hotel that charge me more but I never had this welcome feeling like in Town and country. Even my hotel room is quite far away but I don't mind to walk because every single corner I walk by, I see pretty flowers and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: No1HoneymoonPlanner
Reviews.Content: While attending a conference at the hotel, I thought I had lost my anniversary ring in the narrow space between the vanity and the wall. After searching everywhere, I finally asked for help from the maintenance staff. Even though I was not absolutely positive the ring had fallen into this space, the crew (thank you, Katie, Marcus, Greg and Jose!!) cheerfully spent hours searching and eventually removing and replacing the whole fixture. They knew I was devastated, and Katie kept my spirits up and vowed not to give up looking. Unfortunately, the ring was not found. But Marcus even checked with me the next day to find out if it had turned up. The attention and concern of this crew was above and beyond expectation and I was touched by their kindness. Oh, and the ring? I had left it at home! The Town & Country is very pleasant resort with beautiful grounds, and our conference facilities were excellent. But it is the staff that will bring me back to visit and to recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hard as a rock beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: losdukes
Reviews.Content: I got to say, I was getting away from the LA buzz for a weekend with my family. I booked this hotel, thinking that it was going to be a good relaxing experience. We checking in on Saturday. I had booked two queen-size beds. When we opened the door, it was a one king size bed. I called the front desk and was told they would provice a roll-out...'free of charge'...hahahha. I would have appreciated them telling me that they had given me a different room and they were going to adjust the price. But I had to find out for myself and they didn't even offer to reimburse the difference. They though I wouldn't have noticed it!!?? I wanted to watch the Lakers game, but my TV would not turn on!. Called them again and someone came by within 10 minutes changed the batteries on the remote and it worked. The picture was fuzzy. Had to go to the sports bar to watch it. After paying over $50 for a kids pizza, salad and wings, which by the way were horrible tasting, I went back to the front desk. Luckily, the people in front of us in line had the same problem. They booked a room with a king and got two queens. So we talked and agreeed to exchange. Room: Bed was hard as a rock! woke up with a stiff neck. Roaches on the bathroom. I could hear the pipes from other rooms fluching their toilets... TV:Not have good reception. Internet was $9.95 for 24 hrs, where other hotels is free. Parking: Well, we had to park somewhere and the only place was inside their property which they charge $14 per night. It's not like I had a choice to park outside or on the street to avoid the charge. The people were friendly. Food: overpriced. The only good thing about it was the mall within walking distance and the heated pool and the friendly workers (maids, maintenance, etc). I would only recommend this hotel to someone I was trying to get back at. I couldn't even take any towels cause they were stained!...darn

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: doubler321
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Town and Country Hotel, I was there along with several business partners from around the U.S. all of us from different companies, I would have to say all the traveling I have done for business and pleasure this by far was most horrible experience I have had. Our room was in the Regency Tower and 5th floor to be exact, we got there and they were doing construction on our floor including painting and the paint smell was awful, have traveling for some time we wanted to go to our room to nap and we attempted but the attempt wasnt successful due to the drilling and pounding on the opposite wall. Another business partner ended up checking out a day early because she requested a non smoking room due to health issues the rooms around her were all smoking room and she said it came through the vents and she got really sick. Another business partner found bugs in her room. All in all this was a horrible experience and I would never go back or reccomend it. When we left we informed the front desk and they said sorry but the place was booked so they had no choice to place us where they did and couldnt do much more, horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Signless and Clueless”
Reviews.Author: horseracingabroad
Reviews.Content: This is a very large property spread out over quite a few acres. About 1/2 of the property is one and two story older motel style rooms and the remainder is in two connected high rises. The grounds are very well maintained with palms, roses, other plantings and walkways. There is a problem with signage and room numbers. Each day in the afternoon there are scores of people walking about pulling bags looking for thier room. They give you a map at checkin but don't put up street signs or room number signs anywhere. I got lost, and so did three others of my group of six. It wasn't just me, I met up with at least 20 others who had had the same problem. The solution is simple - Put Up some Signs with street names and building numbers. The room in the motel style part of the property are very typical of their date, the 1970's. They are large, mostly two double beds and a large but somewhat dated bath. The TV's are very out of date, 19" and really only viewable from one of the two beds. Very clean but certainly showing a great deal of aging - two sitting chairs with dirty and threadbear arms, stained and thinning carpet, fixtures showing considerable wear and tear, a bath with very little water pressure and no fan (there was a window that is left openned that is 1 foot from the opposite wall,) My stay was on a Friday and Saturday night. On the first night it was very quiet but on the second night, the Saturday, the hotel, which appears to host a great deal of group and convention business, was having an incentive event on a central plaza, next to the pool. The event looked to be set up for a large outside group and included a DJ complete with six foot high speakers. He started to play 100dba music about 8:00pm and it could be heard in all rooms in the hotel. Although my room was not that close to the pool I was totally unable to hear my TV with the door and windows closed, nor could I have attempted to sleep. A call to the front desk let it be know that the group had booked until 12:00 but that the group would turn down the music at 10:00. At 9:45 I walked to the pool to view where the noise was coming from. To my surprise the DJ and his equipment was playing for a group of two people. The other six people at the party were inside a building WITH THE DOORS CLOSED. The property could have done much to mitigate this serious annoyance. Move it inside - move the location - not agree to 100dba music after 9:00 - This hotel did nothing, He, the DJ thought that soft music wass Micheal Jackson - "Beat It" was his quiet song at 11pm. The hotel has five restaurants - gives away two free drinks per person per day as well as a free buffet breakfast. I tried four of the five - the buffet breakfast was just plain awful, poor quality food, cold hot food and terrible service, although it was listed at $14.50 per person it would not have sold any if not given away free. The Trellis restaurant was better for the next breakfast with so so food but good service. I had a pizza in the sports bar which was a heated frozen one and my other dinner was in their steak house, not worth much at all except with both dinners I had my free drinks. The level of service at both was good - the quality about as bad as it could have been. The hotel charges $8.00/ car /day for motel style parking away from your building - a serious rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: LizC_2010
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego from overseas for a conference. I received great hospitality at the hotel. I especially received great hospitality from Steve and Jordan from the bell desk, who gave me tons of information on where to go and what to see locally. Steve, in particular, was great about giving an out-of-towner great local information and making me feel at home. And every morning, my colleagues and I ate at the hotel restaurant, Trellises. I highly recommend the fluffy eggs and California eggs. Also, at the restaurant we had great service from Pati every morning. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and colleagues. The service and hospitality was great and great resources within the hotel compound!

Reviews.Title: “Room to relax, yet close to it all.”
Reviews.Author: daniio
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the Town and Country Resort and Convention Center to be more than I had anticipated. Besides excellent rooms and a wonderful restaurant (one of several to choose from on the property) the flowers on the grounds were outstanding. I like staying at a roomy older property that gives me some breathing room from the city and traffic. It suited me just fine, the rooms was comfortable and in some down town I walked across the parking lot to a shopping mall to people watch. I willbe staying there again on any return trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: labeach247
Reviews.Content: We came to the Town and Country with a large group for a 3 1/2 day convention. The hotel is was so cute, very clean and the service was great. They have flower gardens all over the grounds and 3 pools to choose from. Pati in the restaurant was such a great server. She was helpful if we had questions, friendly and made you feel right at home. The only thing I would say is that the rooms are very small. While they are very clean it is a tight squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Elks”
Reviews.Author: jaytay12
Reviews.Content: Every other year we come to this hotel for the Elks convention and I have never been disappointed. The rooms are always clean and the property is just stunning. From start to finish I was very well taken care of, especially when booking my room. The reservation woman that I spoke to, Pesey or Piesy, made the whole booking experience nice and simple. Before getting off the phone she made sure that every detail was correct. I will definitely look forward into coming back in 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Marks for Service!”
Reviews.Author: runner1948
Reviews.Content: i have been coming to Towne and Country especially Trellis Restaurant where consisentcy is the key word. Warm, friendly wonderful sevice in a quiet and comfortable environment. one of the main reasons i go is the high level of personal attention of one of the sweetest servers Patti. SHe greets you with a smile and a hug and always has that "first nights performance". I recommend T and C and especially Trellis regulary vs the other noisy and over priced places to entertail my clients. Bravo to Patti, her staff and Town and Country. WIn Englebert Security Business Bank San Diego, California

Reviews.Title: “Town & Country's Lovely getaway!”
Reviews.Author: bettymalaska36
Reviews.Content: Well I wanted to share a bit about my stay at the Town and country resort hotel. In San Diego CA, One good thing first of all would be the location its Great. Also with my stay the greeting for front desk could not have been better, employees at the beggining of my stay seemed happy and ready to work. Walking thru the hotel property was like walking thru the Secret Gardens I think that was my favorite part. I have been thru the Secret Gardens in Vancouver BC and it reminded me so much of that secret place. Pools were great, kept up,clean, and very relaxing. We had a wonderful breakfast at the Terrace cafe seemed like to us it was a cafe from somewhere in the north part of France it was such a cute setting and the employees were outstanding full of energy. Over all would highly recommend to stay at this resort. We plan to go back as soon as we can. Hope you enjoyed this review cause you will enjoy your stay and feel just as we feel sending this message to you all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “delightful weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tbwooten
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at the town and country. From my morning walks thru the endless gardens of roses to my late night soak in the hot tub.The pools were clean and inviting with the palm trees swaying in the light breezes of the day. You couldn't ask for a better place to dive into the water or a good book . Did I mention the mall is close to the resort ? My daughter and I could shop in walking distance. My husband enjoyed the fact that several resturant were also in walking distance as well as the golf ... Didn't worry about calories this trip lol.The rooms were so elegant with all the details I expect. I loved my balcony view. The staff was attentive to our needs.We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: dmclabaugh
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Town and Country while attending a conference. The staff were very attentive and helpful. We especially enjoyed the Trellises Restaurant which we frequented daily and Kelly's Steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: lonnie14189
Reviews.Content: Went for breakfast at the Trellis restaurant and was served by Pati. She was amazing. Not only did she put me onto an art exhibit that was only in town for the weekend; but she found me tickets; and helped me find excursions to take in the area. Pati - you are amazing. Thanks for making my trip!

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SDSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: As a local industry professional, we utilize our hotel and lodging partners for meeting space quite often. For this particular appointment, the meeting was scheduled at Trellises, a restaurant on-property at the Town & Country Resort. Not only was I pleasantly surprised by the rich decor, but also by the phenomenal service provided by our waitress. Pat Muklevicz ( I intentionally asked for her name before leaving), attended to our table as though we were her only customers, and of course we were not. There was never a glass below half-full on the table and not once did we need to look around or wait for service as she regularly and very politely checked on our table. I would recommend Trellises to any out-of-town guest or local professional looking for classy dining, great service and modest rates.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: conferencemember
Reviews.Content: I staied there in one of the appartments not in the towers. I was there for a conference, my girl friend attended me and enjoyed the hotel, spa and city. The service was very friendly and helpfull at all times. Especially the desk clerks who helped us also in issues NOT concerning the hotel (finding the way and public transportation lines to several places, etc.). The room was nice, clean. The appartment had 3 rooms. The style was typical american :-) A bit kitschy for our age (~30years) but nice. On the way through the convention center you cross a very nice garden like place. Ways to the convention center are nice and short. The convention center is very nice, big rooms, fine acoustics. Gardens are well prepared. The whole place is very well done and clean. Big palms and nice smaller trees and bushes really give a nice impression. You don't feel as if being in a city. Trolley and bus stations are within walking range, so that you don't even need a car to get to San Diego city. Also a big and nice shopping mall is within walking distance (you'll see squirrels on your way to the mall ;-). Pools are nice and clean, just a bit too small for real swimming but great for relaxing. Compared to european standards, the rooms are not very well isolated. Both regarding temperature (but with air condition in the room) and noise (you sometimes heard people outside if they were talking loud). The price never the less is not very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: danasignsup
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, poorly decorated, and have very thin walls. We could hear the person next door snooring and they had their tv on at 6 am. The only positive thing is that it is right next to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: penmintex
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many different styles of rooms. We were in the main, largest tower of rooms. The pools were beautiful, and the hotel is very close to a mall and many restaurants. If you have a vehicle, you are close to many places to see - La Jolla, Pacific Beach, Coronado, etc. It was our first time in the area, and the stay was very nice. The only negative is one that is becoming widespread - paying a daily fee for internet!

Reviews.Title: “great service during a shaking time - ie..........earthquake”
Reviews.Author: igottaburna
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the town and country in San Diego for a meeting. Upon arriving there I was greeted by the wonderful staff and check in was flawless. The meetings went great and I enjoyed my room and the service! When I was checking out on Easter Sunday I experienced my first big earthquake! I was staying in the Royal Palm Tower on the 10th floor and it felt like the whole tower was swinging back and forth for almost a minute, my TV even fell off the stand! It was a very shocking experience to say the least. So after it was over I was all ready to go back to my hometown where there are NO earthquakes! But there was a problem! All the elevators were out and there was no way I was going to walk down 10 flights of stairs with all my luggage and items I had acquired over the few days I was there. So I called the front desk and they sent over a bellman. Steve was the bellman that came to my rescue! I can’t say enough good things about the way he went about helping me and informing me about the quake and what had happened at the hotel. I felt bad not being able to carry more than a tiny bag and watching him carry all my heavy bags and what not. But he was very nice and very helpful in getting all my stuff out to my car and getting me on my way. Its people like him and the rest of the wonderful staff at the town and country that will keep me coming back whenever I am in the San Diego area. So if you were thinking about a place to stay when you’re in San Diego, please give town and country a try. You won’t be disappointed! One Happy Guest! -Sean

Reviews.Title: “Superb Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: totpraat
Reviews.Content: Thinking about a destination wedding? Consider the beautiful city of San Diego in sunny California. As an internationally renowned tourist destination with year round warm temperatures the appeal is obvious. Once you have made that decision consider the Town and Country Resort and Convention Center as the perfect spot to host your wedding. Believe me we checked out a multitude of the areas wedding venues and Town and Country Resort outshines them all! The 32 acre resort is well situated in the Mission Valley area. The grounds are lush with rose gardens---the pride of the owners. The perfect setting for an outdoor ceremony and your photographer's dream pallet. The accommodations vary from old California bungalows and garden rooms to tastefully modern high rise towers. There are so many amenities to enjoy that I suggest you visit their website www.towncountry.com. No, I am not an owner or employee plugging the resort, but rather an enthusiastic and very satisfied customer. The resort can do weddings on a grand scale in their magnificent ballrooms or delight you with a small affair in one of their on premise restaurants. We opted for the Trellises Garden Grille Restaurant for our wedding reception of fifty guests. The decor is elegant with various dining rooms, a bar, a marble dance floor and grand piano. Guests can step down to outdoor patio dining surrounded by gardens and a view of the pool. Excellent ambiance for your wedding guests. For entertainment Trellises Garden Grille provides music by The Pier Group Band. They will be glad to do private events and we recommend them highly to get that party going! Numerous times this restaurant has been voted number one in the San Diego area. The chef and service staff will work with your budget and make it an especially classy event to remember. They even feature an on-site bakery for that all important wedding cake. Your guests will be wined and dined for your reception and will enjoy a pampered stay at the resort. When you add up all these attributes you will not be disappointed as they truly have come up with the best formula for the perfect wedding. Kudos to all the friends we have made at this fine establishment who with their " can-do " attitude have given us such a memorable stay. We will be back! For reservations contact Jonathan Myhra sales manager.

Reviews.Title: “Service and beauty are blended here.”
Reviews.Author: marykathleen50
Reviews.Content: Town and Country Resort is on a busy, noisy freeway on hotel row, but its grounds are quiet and elegant, almost with a 1950s feel. I expected to see Janet Leigh in something white sitting poolside. The outstanding service was highlighted by Angelica Stephens, my waitperson at breakfast every morning in The Trellis Restaurant. The morning I presented she slipped me peppermints and an extra muffin "to go", plus promises of prayers. My room, though small, was cozy and quiet with several nice touches. Our conference facilities were excellent and the lunches we were served were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Restaurant is an excellent place for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: kpacurar
Reviews.Content: I frequently use Trellises Restaurant at the Town and Country for business meetings. The atmosphere is both quiet and private and the service is outstanding. In particular, Pati Muklevicz, who hands down is one of the best waitresses in San Diego. She always remembers her guests and makes you and your company feel like the most important people sitting in the restaurant.! Great service, quality and price. Kathleen Pacurar

Reviews.Title: “Amazed by the customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: saldude68
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and i have to say I've never enjoyed a hotel as much as this one! From the various dining options to the lush garden views, it was like paradise on the mainland. I have to say the one thing i look for the most is quality customer service. The airport had lost my bags so I was already in a bad mood before I got the hotel. But once I stepped foot into the lobby I was greeted by the wonderful Terry NG at the front desk, who definitely made me day. She immediately welcomed me & took her time explaining all the various accommodations the hotel had to offer. The room itself was clean & made me feel right at home. I actually had forgot my toothbrush so I called the front desk, the lovely Terry NG answered the call and it only took a couple minutes & somebody was already knocking at my door. Now THAT is amazing service I will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lovelycalifornia
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, the front office make you feel at home they are proffesional and friendly. The room was clean, quiet and relaxing. The hotel has many pools one righ next to our room. The mall is literally across the street we walked to the mall. And at night we took a walk around the hotel because its a big hotel with enought lights that makes you feel that your in a park. And housekeeping was the best they accommodated us with extra towels blankets.. what ever we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nick and Dime you all the way”
Reviews.Author: nnjrunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the town and country for a conference in March 2010. First let me say this hotel is way over priced. They charge 149/night with a discount. The hotel is located fairly close to the airport and does have easy access to the trolly so getting around is easy. I would say that is the only good thing about this place. The hotel has extra charges for everything. The use of their little gym (not many pieces of equipment and gets very hot) was 10/day, parking was $14/day, and internet access costs $9.95/day, and finally a tiny bottle of water in room was $1. The should each be free with price tag on the room and all the hotels in the hotel circle area provide these things. I would have changed to one of these hotels but I was on company time and orders so I had to go where they provided me a room. The room I had got very warm at night and had no window to open and no air conditioning. My final day I had to be at the airport early and took a shower with no hot water. This place was horrible and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Very old and outdated!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: busystateworker
Reviews.Content: Once again, we were not disappointed with our stay at the Town and Country Hotel. Everywhere we went, the staff and other guests were smiling and in a great mood! When you're traveling through the hustle and bustle of airports, car rentals, and crowds, the hotel staff is welcome change! You are never left to feel like you're waiting and waiting to be served. The breakfast meals are hot and the staff frequently stops at your table to refill coffee and ask if they can serve you. The gardens this time of year are absolutely beautiful!!! Walkways are clear accessible to everyone and there are pathways for pleasant strolls in every direction. Restaurants and a fabulous mall are within easy walking distance from a pathway from the hotel and we've heard the golfing is always exceptional. No matter where we went, guests and staff were cheerful and checking in and out was efficient. To companies looking for places to hold staff meetings or conferences, we highly recommend this location!!! We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK--paper thin windows...don't expect sleep”
Reviews.Author: shaundog23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just okay. The absolutey flowers are breathtaking. My room faced the pool which meant heavy traffic--at al hours. If someone was whispering outside I could hear it. The staff was not the most cordial that I have ever encountered. When I checked in the women gave me my key--no map nor did she explain how to get to my room at this very large complex. Internet is 10 bucks a day...ouch! On a more positive note I found the main restaurant to be quite nice and there are lots of things to choose from as far as cafes and such on property. My company paid for the room but I woud not come back if I was paying on my own.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay at the Town and Country - there are better hotels around!”
Reviews.Author: traveler21fl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country for seven days during a conference that was being held there. Before I left for my trip several colleagues mentioned that it may be best to look elsewhere for accommodations, but I decided for the convenience aspect, I'd keep my reservation. Big mistake. My (first) room was in the Regency Tower. Stepping off the elevator at my floor I noticed the smell of urine (!!) and walked past fresh gum on the carpet which also looked as if it hadn't been vacuumed in a week. The decor was awful - who's idea is it to add blue carpet, a scary picture of a little girl on the wall (this picture was also in my second room in the Royal Palm tower) and curtains that date back to the 70's? After one night in this room I requested a move to the Royal Palm Tower, similar decor but a step up nonetheless. I thought about switching to one of the other hotels in the circle (there are MANY other options), but was told that it I would be charged $50-75 PER NIGHT of my unused stay if I wished to cancel. This made no sense especially since the hotel was at capacity and was even turning folks away due to lack of roms. I've never been at a hotel that enacted such a policy. Ridiculous. Be aware that this is 'nickel and dime' CENTRAL! Everything is extra so be prepared to pay for the gym ($8-10/day - only open until 8pm and the air was stagnant, no A/C or fans) and to use the internet ($9.95-12.95 per day). Several of the front desk staff were incredibly rude (When asked about internet my companion was told - 'Please wait until I'm finished and I'll answer your question'). I frequented the Terrace Cafe for breakfast and lunch and several times sat for 10 or more minutes before anyone came by to take my order or refill my drink. To avoid this, I would stop next door at the Deli to grab a Starbucks-type coffee and each morning the line was so long that it would take 15-30 minutes of standing in line to get a drink. (I blame the management for this one since they only had 1 staff behind the counter between 7am and 11am). If I were ever in the area again, I would stay at the Courtyard Marriott where the rooms were cheaper, the gym was free, there was hot complimentary breakfast, and you received $20 in coupons per day good for any food/drink at the hotel - and it's only a 5 minute walk to the Town and Country. A colleague of mine stayed there and was very pleased with his accommodations. Overall, this hotel would get a 2 out of 10 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: Nittany&Fargo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country for 3 nights for a convention that was held at the hotel. While the grounds and landscaping are absolutely lovely and well maintained, the resort is sprawling and does, indeed, have a 1950s feel to it. On the plus side, the convention center had nice facilities for the exhibition, including lots of restrooms (not always a given). The hall was well lit and ventilated. The main pool was heated and the jacuzzi was very large and worked well. I do wish parents would not dump their young kids off at the jacuzzi. Town and Country sits on Hotel Circle, and is very convenient to San Diego, the trolley line, a large mall, and Old Town San Diego. I don't mind paying $170/night for a room. I DO, however, mind being nickel and dimed for every extra cost, including: $14/day for parking; $10/day for internet access; $8/day to use the fitness center (and I'm pretty sure that was a discounted rate because I was there with a convention); and 95 cents to use my calling card from the room. There are so many other hotels on Hotel Circle where I could have gotten all of these amenitities for free and at a lower rate per evening. And I could have gotten a free breakfast. The room itself was very clean. The bathroom was tiny, and not particularly well lit. As a female traveler, I absolutely hate outdoor access to rooms (as best as I could tell, none of the rooms had controlled access through a security door or indoor corridors). The balcony was OK, and fairly private (I could not see either of my neighbors, which was nice). However, I did see some rooms at the ends of the corridors where their balcony stared straight out to a brick wall. Just a weird configuration. No flat screen TV, either. How is that possible in California? I ate two dinners at Charlie's, the sports bar. The food was OK, but way overpriced ($11 for a hamburger?). The service here was somewhat surly. The landscaping and cleaning staff all seemed to go out of their way to make me feel welcome. One of the cleaning crew even hustled over to open a door for me when I was lugging a carton into the convention center. Otherwise, the service was unimpressive. I would not recommend this place for the business traveler, especially if you are only staying one night, since the grounds are so massive, it takes forever to get a feel for the lay of the land. I saw one guy wandering aimlessly at 6:00 a.m. looking for the registration desk to check out while I was on my way to the gym. I finally was able to catch up to him and help him with directions. There are too many other business hotels (Courtyard, Residence Inn) on Hotel Circle to pick this place. Even for a resort destination, you can do better. I had some free time Monday morning and was hoping to use the spa. No dice. The spa is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. And how in the 21st century, can the fitness center not have any ellipticals? Fortunately, the bike and stair master that I used worked well. The weight equipment was also in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad elements -- depends upon what you want”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Buff_BL
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good features, but beware depending upon your expectations. The good features are: fantastic location near mall, train line, freeways to get to all parts of the city. Also good are the incredible landscaping and outdoor settings with pools, patios, trees, foliage, and beautiful scenery on the property. The beds are fantastic -- some of the best sleep of my travels. The bad is that it looks like its best days were in the Frank Sinatra era. Also, the showerheads in the bathroom are at chin level for short people (I was contorted to wash my hair and I'm not tall), and the walls are so thin you can hear every activity of your neighbors. Worse are that the TVs and cable reception are from the 50s too. Finally, we found the service atrocious. They seem to have lots of people about in front desk, bellhop, restaurants, but they don't seem to be intent upon service. I would only recommend this hotel if you are wanting a gorgeous location but don't care about quick service or idiosyncrasies of an older property. I'm recommending this as "no" overall, but it might be good for families or those who have different expectations.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice and clean. The kids loved the pool and the closness to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Pattymansell
Reviews.Content: If you have AAA you can get a great discount. They also offer 2 adult passes to any attraction in San Diego. This is a great benefit. The package also includes a buffet breakfast for the entire family. The service was not so great at the buffet but what do you expect for free.

Reviews.Title: “town and country is nice and good resturant.”
Reviews.Author: peca68
Reviews.Content: Kelly´s steak house and Trellises restaurant are delicious. The service from front desk is excellent, "mainly miss Terry NG" is helpful. The room is very comfortable and clean and cozy. The staff are friendly. The weather is nice in San Diego. We will come back to stay here in the future for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terry Ng was awsome”
Reviews.Author: BenPlonski
Reviews.Content: Terry Ng the really nice girl behind front desk really went out of her way to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay There Only if You Have To”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be convenient to a conference. The place is huge. Plan a 5 minute walk to get to where you need to go at the conference center. Also there are minimal signs, so you get lost a lot. Just try to find your way back to your room at nite. Good luck. We asked for a late check-out and they quickly told us it's $35.00. They don't even check to see if someone is coming into the room. They charge for internet, parking and air (only kidding). Had to waiting 50 minutes to get a bell hop to get our luggage and was late for a conference session. The reason they were so late? They make everyone check out at the same time because no one wants to pay the extra fee. Breakfast is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “town and country is perfect”
Reviews.Author: changocarinos
Reviews.Content: I will recommened this hotel, terry ng , josie rogers, nancy nungaryay,lisa pena,jamie sanders all from front desk very friendly and helpful, they greet us with smile. The room is clean, smell good, the flower is pretty. I will come back to town and country to see your nice and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people - terrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: One-Bad-Dog
Reviews.Content: The restaurant staff, particularly Pati Muklevicz in the Trellises Restaurant, were great. So too was the concierge and the desk staff on check-in and check-out. Room service was also very fast. Meals were a bit pricy, though. As was the room rate. The support staff at the conference center were also on-the-ball when it came to helping out. Expect to stay in rooms with early 1980s carpets, tubs that do not drain particularly well, and halls with wall-paper that still smells of cigarette smoke over a decade after California banned indoor smoking. Don't take a first floor room. The sandbags hidden around the corners are there for a reason. When it rains, the first floor rooms tend to get a bit wet from leaks around the doors and windows. Parking costs: even for hotel guests. Internet is about $10 a day. Highway noise from I-8 is terrible unless you are on the ground or 2nd floors where the luxurious trees and plants provide a sound barrier. However, highway access to I-8, and 163 are excellent. One other thing - be very very careful when you plug in appliances in the room. The outlets in our room were improperly attached to the walls and the face-plates were broken. We reserved a king bed with balcony, non-smoking, allergen free. Unfortunately, the room provided was not what was reserved. They had given out all of the room types we wanted to people who had checked in one day earlier than us. And we had reserved our room 5 months in advance, paid a non-refundable first night's fee, and verified by e-mail, and twice by phone that we would get the room we requested. When we checked in we were told we would get the room we requested - they just didn't have any cleaned right then. Interestingly, 2 1/5 hours later when we finally got room keys, we didn't get anything that we had asked for. We complained to the front desk, but they could do nothing for us the first two nights, so we made the best of a bad deal and spent all 4 nights in substandard accommodations at a very high rate. If you are staying at the Town and Country, San Diego, for a conference - stay at the Super 8, Day's Inn, or Best Western on Hotel Circle South. They are as close a walk to the convention center as are the on-site rooms at the far end of the hotel compound. Their rooms are newer, beds are better, and they provide free wi-fi. You could also stay anywhere else and drive the the convention center, or park at Fashion Valley Mall for free and walk about a block to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: adamquinnette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Town and Country for a conference for 3 nights. Paid $159 a night and had Tiny room of Motel 6 quality Furniture and decor out of the 1970s 19 inch tv broken remote shower did not work $1 fee for local calls $10 for internet $35 for 30 minute late check out Surly staff (can't blame them as they must recieve hundreds of complaints a day. $16 breakfast buffet that had moldy fruit $15 to use on site gym I spooke with dozens of others staying here and all (100%) had similar complaints, including: broken window no heat or air musty odor The most frustrating part was the are Best Western, Days Inn, Marriott, and others acrss the highway for $70 a night. Friends staying at those places bragged about free internet and breakfast, flat screen tvs, etc. Save money, avoid a horrible experience. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Trellises Grill fantastic for client events”
Reviews.Author: deanridg
Reviews.Content: We had a client breakfast event on 20 February that was fantastic at the Trellises Restaurant. Pati Muklevicz, Emilio and Jesus provided fantastic service and made sure we had everything we needed for a great event. We will do more events at Trellises Restaurant as a result of the courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “town and country is excellent, terry ng from front desk is amazing”
Reviews.Author: batmanSanDiegosd
Reviews.Content: room is wonderful! Service is world class especially from the front desk

Reviews.Title: “OK resort, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: follower2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice for an annual conference - the complex is huge and quite hard to navigate, but the staff are super friendly. I actually remembered one of the waitresses from a previous stay, Pati Muklevicz, because she was so kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nbrecek
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in one of the cottages. The view and atmosphere was beautiful. There was a patio area and water fountain directly outside of my room. The room cost $155, plus $10 for parking, plus $10 for wifi. The room felt small and the decor was outdated. The bathroom was exceptionally small. It rained oned night which was loud on the roof and it was hard to sleep. The staff was very polite and were available to answer questions. The conference center was well organized with several maps & signs. The conference rooms were older and we were tightly packed into many of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this place was wonderful and the staff, to a person, so helpful and gracious!”
Reviews.Author: Ambrose50
Reviews.Content: My professional organization held our convention there and we had our board meeting at the facility one month in advance in preparation. Every person on site was gracious and helpful. The facility is clean, unique, and homey-feeling. Definitely worth your time and money - you will thoroughly enjoy yourself. One other big bonus is the walking distance direct access to great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hewei
Reviews.Content: breakfeast is good, and the view of our room is excellent! you can enjoy the sunshine just a few steps from your room. very friendly stuff. parking is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I will not look at any other places in san diego, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kmdkds
Reviews.Content: was going to a convention at the downtown convention center and since it was a big show all the hotels were getting outrageous dollars for the four night stay, and so i checked out the Town & Country. Initial worry was twofold, how long for me to get to the convention center and what type of place am i getting for this decent rate. Walked into room and had a four post bed, nice table with work area and small love seat - awesome room. Drove to the convention center, total of 5 miles, took me at most 12 minutes during rush hour. Pool and hot tub were great, nice breakfast buffet and menu, and a couple of fun bars and restaurant on site. I won't stay any place else when going to San Diego, Kevin, Philadelphia

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great People”
Reviews.Author: BigMikee
Reviews.Content: Just like to say that your Hotel is great. Nice location close to all. Very pleasant personel working. Terry Sobkowial was extremly helpful it locating various places to eat and locations also. Kelly's Steakhouse was great and the waitress Melody was excellent. Will stay at this hotel in the future. Thank all your people as they were great.

Reviews.Title: “You'd better hope that there are no noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: FlightDelayed
Reviews.Content: I've been here nearly a week, for a business meeting. Until today, I would have given them a good review. The place is pleasant and the staff is fantastic, though the buildings and rooms are best described as a bit shabby. They are, however, clean. The prices for food and amenities are ridiculous - they charge for WiFi and they also charge $6.95 for six minutes to use the computers in the business center to print boarding passes (plus another 98 cents to print). Chintzy. However, it is now almost 2 a.m. and there is nonstop noise from a group of people who arrived today - they are according to security, all over 18 but they are acting as though they are 13. They are sitting on the balconies and hanging out in the hallways, conducting very loud conversations. They are roaming up and down the hallways and callling out to one another as they roam the property. Security - all 3 of them - are apparently running from buildling to building answering noise complaints. They obviously can't keep it under control. They refuse to ask these people to leave the property. That is unacceptable. Hotel management should not allow disruptive guests to stay. Apparently, they are so concerned with the almighty buck that they don't care about the other guests. Many of us are leaving tomorrow so apparently it doesn't matter if we are kept awake all night. But I feel sorry for others who will arrive while these uncivilized children are here. They will be up all night calling security.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Pajaro_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a conference package and expected a high quality room with good service. We were placed in a small building off to the side of the compound. As it turned out, it was nothing more than a cheap motel, gussied up with wallpaper and gaudy carpet. No fridge. No microwave. Tiny television with bad reception. Worse, the beds were horribly uncomfortable and when I complained, it took hours for someone to turn up with a pair of blankets which I could then fold up and put under the sheets so that I wouldn't have to sleep on what felt to be a slab of concrete. The pillows were so awful that my husband and I went to a local mall and bought a pair of pillows that we could take back to our room so that we wouldn't torque our necks on the ones provided by the hotel. This is only part of my experience but hopefully sufficient to keep YOU away! BTW, this is the first bad review I've EVER written. It feels like a civic duty to put my experience out there. Stay somewhere else. There are many hotels in Hotel Circle. I'm betting that any or all of them provide better accommodation than Town & Country.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good hotel, with an opportunity to improve.”
Reviews.Author: LSSBB
Reviews.Content: Ms. Terry Ng and Ms. Lisa Pena at the Front Desk went out of their way to make sure my stay was comfortable and took care of my extended stay at Town and Country inspite of flight cancellations and airport closures. They're great. The hotel is generally well-appointed and pleasant. However, there is an opportunity for an otherwise good hotel to become better: The guest rooms only have wireless broadband access. My Navy-issued laptop does not permit wireless WI-FI due to security concerns, so I could not connect to my office all week. My advice to the hotel is to provide CAT 5 wired broadband access in at least 10-20% of guest rooms to accommodate ALL travelers. For this reason alone, I cannot recommend this hotel to my Navy colleagues because they all have the same limitations. Sorry, and thanks for listening.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service. Thanks Terry!”
Reviews.Author: mckaybailey
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with excellent service. Terry Ng answered all of my questions and provided outstanding service. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a large campus-like property conducive to conferences of all sizes.”
Reviews.Author: NancyClaire
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel that appears ideal for conferences of all sizes. The property is beautifully landscaped. My colleagues and I had lunch at the Trellises Restaurant and enjoyed the excellent food and outstanding service. Our waitress, Pati, was extremely helpful and knowledgeable with the hotel information she provided. The Town and Country is located in central San Diego with easy freeway access, has a trolley stop, and is adjacent to Fashion Valley Mall. It is worth checking out for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Terry & Josie!! Ideal location with excellent customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Mansan30
Reviews.Content: Great location near malls, beaches and downtown Old Town/Gas Lamp District. Terry NG and Josie Rogers provided phenomenal service with my two visits to the front desk. They answered all my questions and were very courteous. Highly recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “High quality rooms & great location”
Reviews.Author: Hiker97
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 6th floor of the main hotel tower. The rooms were of high quality - everything was very clean and the decor was well done. The king bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious, including two sinks which would be very helpful for a family. It was wonderful to have views in two directions, from the front walkway and from the rear balcony, to see all around the beautiful Mission Valley area. For those who enjoy shopping, there is a convenient walking path over a bridge across a small creek to the Fashion Valley mall. Freeway access to I-8 and SR-163 is a piece of cake.

Reviews.Title: “You call this a "resort" hotel?”
Reviews.Author: travelinLeese
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a friend who was attending business in San Diego, CA. We checked into this "resort" hotel that the meeting was being held. We knew is was not looking good when you realize the hotel is planted between two interstates and the sign is the original from when the hotel opened some 20 years+ ago! We literally drove past the hotel twice not wanting to believe the hotel was the one! We checked into the hotel and after some 15 minutes found the room - in a building that appeared to have flooded and was under "repair". The first floor looked like something out of a disaster movie! We headed to the room and when we opened the door was greeted by very old, dirty blue carpet everywhere in the room, including the bathroom. The double beds were harder than boards, and the furniture appeared to be out of something from a "Golden Girls" episode! The bathroom was so tiny, you could not use the toilet without the door literally in your face or the shower curtain hanging off your head! The fixtures were outdated, the TV had little or no signal (of course, 10 years old!), and there were so many stains on the lamp shades that I thought it was a "patterned" shade at first! What hotel still has a "gold chain swag lamp" as it's main lighting? Come on - if you are going to use the word "resort" in your name, at least keep the rooms clean and updated - especially if you charge $147 plus tax per night (govt rate!)! We also went to the "casual" bar for some beers (we had to have them after seeing that room) and ended up spending $100+ for a few beers and an appetizer each! Again, the "bar" looked like we were in a Golden Girls show! Yikes. We would never had checked in, but we were so tired and exhausted from flying across the country. We woke up the next morning and checked out. We stayed the rest of the week at an awesome Marriott Courtyard across the highway for $116 per night! Run from this hotel and if your company or agency puts you up there (or trys to) be a rebel and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: FLcatgirl
Reviews.Content: I have to thank Barbara Whitlock for recommending this hotel to me. The staff went above and beyond to help us when our incoming flight from LA was cancelled and the shuttle abandoned us at San Diego International at 2:00 a.m. The night manager Karen made arrangements for us to be picked up and greeted us with a big smile when we finally arrived. Our driver was friendly and helpful as well. The wait staff at the cafe were extremely friendly and courteous. I was impressed by the size of our room and all of the amenities included. The grounds were beautifully maintained. I found travel around the city to be quite easy from the hotel as I-8 and 163 had easy access on and off right nearby. I would definitely stay at the Town and Country on my next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceMary
Reviews.Content: The decor is our rather large room was exquisite. We appreciated the two sinks - one was outside the bath area. We had many soft white towel and a spotless accomadation. The service, from the check-in until they came to our room to take us to the main lobby in a golf cart, was superb. These two people went out of their way in a happy way to help us in anyway they could. We did not see the maid - we had every thing we needed. However, we were in sunny California and had heavy rain for the three days that we were there!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Terry for your help -”
Reviews.Author: Joanvn
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Wednes pm 20th Jan - in the pelting rain and flooded airport. Terry was welcoming and cheerful - and very helpful - thank you Terry.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MillieBarr
Reviews.Content: Patti and Jose at the Trellis were GREAT. Happy to share local information for "down time" from the conference. Excellent service and the food was FAB!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a step back in time”
Reviews.Author: kingsley5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the T&C a few times, for a genetics conference that is held there each year. The property is quite expansive (>40 acres), beautifully landscaped, and if traveling for personal vacation there are a variety of different room options which would be attractive, including cabana-style options near one of the pools. The staff is very friendly; we had a wonderful waitress at one of the breakfast places, named Pati Muklevicz. Overall, a nice place though I should warn that the room decor for the rooms I have stayed in (usually one of the towers) is right out of the 70's, which may or may not be appealing. It is near a golf course as well as a nice, huge mall which has a number of restaurants. Overall a good place to have a conference and take a family as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceperry423
Reviews.Content: The Resort was excellent. It had nice pools, several restaurant options, a fitness center. It was clean and the people were nice. Pati Muklevicz, a server at one of the restaurants (the Trellaces I believe it was called) was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Greenery......... but expected more.”
Reviews.Author: Huskerpower1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the night of the Holiday Bowl Football game in December. I saw photos and read some reviews and figured it looked like a bargain for the $100 AAA Rate that we got. As soon as we got there we got a good feeling seeing all the nice trees and fountains and greenery all around the property. Check in was pretty quick and simple and we were told to drive to the back and we would be staying in one of the "towers". Well we soon found this was no "Trump Tower"... :-) The tower looked huge and dated and even the elevators looked and felt old... The rooms were not too bad, but definitely not of the quality of something with the word "Resort" in its name! The carpet was blue and plush and that was different. We were on the sixth floor and there was a small balcony overlooking the pool. It was a bit scary leaning on the railing hoping that it wouldn't give seeing as how the builiding seemed pretty old...... The TV worked, with quite a few channels to choose from but the reception on more than a few of the channels was not good. My biggest pet peeve though was the bathroom just didn't make the grade for me for a place called "Town and Country RESORT". It was just about as basic as a Motel 6 I think. Luckily everything worked. Found it interesting though that the showerhead was at eye level to me, and I am by no means a tall person! It was kind of uncomfortable having to bend your knees to have the water run down on your head. Other than those things, which might not bother some people, it was an o.k. stay.
