The BEST thing was the walk to the trolley station was only about a two minute walk... That was great. Also, after the game was over, we wanted to grab something to eat and wound up coming in out of the rain and entering a piano lounge that was part of the steakhouse there on the premises. The bartender was kind enough to offer us a booth in the corner and give us menus since there was a small line for the regular restaurant part of the place... He let us sit in the lounge and order food which I thought was really cool of him.... Even though the food was overpriced, we tipped him pretty good once we finished. Anyway, to sum it up, we only stayed there for one cold and drizzly night so we couldn't really enjoy the greenery and fountains. Not a bad stay, but I expected our room to be a lot nicer. Maybe if we had upgraded to one of the more expensive rooms that are more isolated, we would have stayed out of the gray unimpressive "Towers". Oh one more thing.... We heard doors opening and closing for what seemed like all night long, so I hope you're a heavy sleeper! And there was an $8 fee for parking. Would I stay here again? Probably Not. I think I'll try another place if I'm ever there for another Nebraska viotory. Go Huskers!

Reviews.Title: “International visitors love the Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: SpeakerSanDiegoCA
Reviews.Content: We arrange housing for over 400 international emerging leaders from over 120 countries for the past 30 years and often place them at the Town and Country during their stay in San Diego. They love it! Nice big grounds with lovely vegetaion with a staff that makes them feel at home. -Cath DeStefano, Executive Director, Citizen Diplomacy Council of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Freindly, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGW
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here during Christmas vacation. The room was clean & spacious. Heating/Air Conditioning worked well (it was warm in the day and cool at night). Staff were friendly and professional. The grounds are well maintained. I had breakfast at the Terrace Cafe each day. Lots of variety. Kelly's steakhouse was disappointing. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “extremely friendly, with rooms that make you feel like home.”
Reviews.Author: bryguy215
Reviews.Content: stepping into the check in area of the resort i was greeted with nothing but smiles. It was extremely easy to find my room on such a large spread of land. The room was super inviting and comfy to simply lounge. The resort itself had tons to offer and even just walking around at night was enjoyable. The late night drink spots were a pleasure to find and the bartenders there were very enjoyable. All around i have no complaints and would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with access to trolley”
Reviews.Author: MelanieAC77
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference here and found the property delightful. The property was undergoing renovations at the time, and I was pleased that the renovations were conducted during regular business hours so that the mornings and evenings were quiet. Each unit provides a balcony with gorgeous views of the landscape of San Diego. Palm trees and foliage surround the property. The property is also walking distance to the trolley stop, which can take you all over the San Diego area. There are several options for food and drink on site, including a restaurant, sports bar, and snack bar. This property is not close to anything in walking distance (except the trolley station and mall), so use the trolley, city bus, or rent a car. To visit the beach from this property without a car, it takes a minimum of one trolley ride and one bus ride.

Reviews.Title: “Angelica is an angel!!”
Reviews.Author: ladyaya
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Town & Country. The property is pretty and the rooms are nice. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I especially enjoyed having Angelica as a server at Trellisis. She is such a joy. Thanks for your wonderful customer service.

Reviews.Title: “have always stayed at town &country”
Reviews.Author: paperparker1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Town & Country many times in the last several years since we have relatives in San Diego. It is in a great area, walking close to a Macy's mall & Red Trolley station that can take you practically anywhere in San Diego. We have always had excellent service, with several fine restaurants to chose from , not to mention all the great swimming pools! But the thing we love the best about the Town & Country is the grounds, with all the trees, fountains, trellises & the incredible roses! The Town & Country had us from the first visit. We hope to return for years to come! Sincerely, Barry Parker ,Los Angeles Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Pati Muklevicz was a great server!”
Reviews.Author: KABOMAGS
Reviews.Content: We ate at the restaurant within the Town and Country, Trellises, and Pati was wonderful - kind, helpful, calm, and very bubbly and accommodating. Town and Country and Trellises are fortunate to have such a superb professional.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JulieFlynn1023
Reviews.Content: Took a trip to San Diego for a Chargers game, and found this spot to be a perfect place to stay. Great shopping just over the bridge, good spots to eat and drink, and a trolley stop right behind the property; made it a very enjoyable experience for my friend and I. Barbara Whitlock and the staff were very pleasant and helpful, when I had questions about the property and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this is a different kind of hotel - GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: nscbanks
Reviews.Content: The poor reviews on this hotel are pretty harsh - I can't speak for the experience of others but we loved the hotel. The grounds are the most captivating... what a releif to be OUTSIDE during a conference instead of trapped inside a modern facility (which are very nice, of course, I just usually never even get to step outside!). I felt like I was actually able toexperience San Diego even while the event was going on plus the access to the trolley is fantastic! Most of our group took advantage of the easy transportation to zip around the city for dinner. The staff is amazing - they keep the place immaculate and gorgeous. The hotel underwent millions of dollars in rennovations in the past year or so and it shows. Yes, it was built in the 1950s and has the architecture of that era. If you want a slick Marriott or Hyatt or Sheraton or such, choose that but if you want a lovely resort experience with flowers and pools and lazy, long walks on the rose garden grounds then definitely come here. Food was great, I thought - we ordered room service daily and it was all tasty (the pizza one night was different but yummy!). GREAT food breaks for our conference participants and it's nice to have five restuarants on site for those who cannot leave the property - lots of options. Many of our staff had the spa experience and it was just the thing to cap off the event - another perk onsite. Most of all for event planners, the T&C sales and event staff were at the top of my list of all people I've had to work with over the past ten years. They were calm, flexible, and kept a sense of humor even as we frantically made changes and additions right up to the last minute. We are all grateful for their patience and generousity - our final session was a spectacular fall fest and a fraction of what we expected to pay. Bonus kudos to the audiovisual staff who worked with us cheerfully and generously as well! I would most definitely bring a group here again. Again, I can't speak for everyone but I think if you change your expectations (again, this is not a sleek modern spot but a fantastic relaxation getaway with lots of perks) then you will be more than pleased. Thank you again to all the staff that made our event just what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, so-so rooms, ho-hum food”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at this hotel while attending a meeting on-site. This is a hotel that on the surface is just gorgeous. The landscaping at this site is the real star. Literally, it's quite hard to beat the landscaping for most hotels in the San Diego area. But enough of the landscaping. The hotels are functional but really in need of an update. The furniture is quite dated. For some crazy reason, the bathroom counters were too low for my tastes. The internet access had several problems during my stay. Along with the beautiful landscaping, however, comes an assortment of "critters" wandering about. We spotted several lizards and a few opossums wandering around. This could be unnerving to some. The food on site was fairly average. Pretty much what you would expect from an average hotel...nothing to write home about. Some pluses...very convenient location to Fashion Valley mall and the San Diego Trolley system. I really wanted to give this hotel a much higher rating based on my first impression, but once you get into the details of this hotel, it's hard to ignore the detractors of the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ptownpam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Town & Country twice, most recently with Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Team In Training to run in the San Diego Rock 'n Roll marathon. Nice property, good amenities, beautiful grounds. I would definately stay here again, in fact I'd probably plan a trip to San Diego specifically to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: LindaNYC
Reviews.Content: I was with a small group of women consisting of 5 double rooms & 2 suites. The rooms were in the towers each overlooking a nice pool. The rooms were clean. I don't care about the decor since I'm not buying the place. Beautiful gift baskets were left by management in our rooms. We all used the spa Saturday morning for massages. This is a top rate spa & I'm from NYC so I compare this to the finest spas in NY. We went in the large jacuzzi, steam & saunas. They had plush robes for us & wonderful refreshments. Of course the food was expensive, but this is a hotel. The buffet breakfast was $14.95pp but there was lots of food. The grounds are lovely & the location was ideal. It is 10 minutes by shuttle from the airport. The public transportation is right behind the hotel & the mall is right behind the hotel as well. It is off season now, so it wasn't busy. There was a wedding reception on the grounds one evening. I don't understand why anyone would give it a bad rating. We had a wonderful 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: LindseyMac
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at for a conference. Usually they are held at really nice places but this was a dump. I felt totally unsafe the entire time I was there. Two strange men approached me and cornered me in broad daylight on the way to my room and I had to threaten them. While at lunch we saw cops running through the grounds and a police helicopter flying above the hotel. It was dirty and looked like it hadn't been renovated since the 1950's. There were rats at the pool and the food was way too overpriced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “More like a cheap motel than a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mk721
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Town and Country because of a business convention being held there. The room in the tower closest to the convention center are more like a motel, with the doors being on the outside of the structure that anyone can access. Problems: --My door was not airtight...I could see daylight all around my door. Consequently, there was a cold draft all night that didn't go away even with the heat on. -- The floor was visibly sloping and the molding around the floor had big gaps. -- The furniture was cracked, chipped, and looked like it came from a garage sale. Nothing matched. --The bed was hard as a rock. --The toilet had rust stains on it. --The shower curtain was stained all over. -- The hair dryer was cracked. -- Lighting was poor and one of the lamps didn't work. -- Housekeeping tried to enter my room at 7:45 am--way too early! After my first night, I checked out and got a MUCH nicer room at the Courtyard Marriott for a lot less money. This "hotel" is a rip off...you can find much nicer accomodations at Hotel Circle!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the room! Better conference accommodations nearby”
Reviews.Author: Neylo
Reviews.Content: The conference facilities weren't bad, but the room was a terrible value. Besides the outdated, tired style, it was also inadequate for business travel; the room didn't have a desk, enough outlets, or a fridge. They charged exorbitantly for every amenity - $10/day for internet that wasn't working properly, $15-ish/day for parking, etc. Also, check ahead before having the hotel handle packages - they charge between $5 and $25 each to receive them or hold them for pick-up (not shipping, just the hotel's handling fee). There are plenty of less expensive, better equipped hotels within close proximity. If you have a conference at this resort, look across the street for lodging. Other conference attendees checked out early (another hefty fee) and moved to the Courtyard or Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Resort”
Reviews.Author: rollerskatejunki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located right in the valley with the trolley station being a few steps away, and the mall a 5 minute walk, you can't go wrong. This place is a lot bigger then I thought, they have three pools which I have yet to see two of them, and a awesome steak house located right on the property. Rooms are spacious and maybe I've been lucky, or maybe they all have views but both times I've been there we had a huge balcony overlooking the pool. A must stay at place if your visiting San Diego! Wendy Steinman

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel-Beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: rick053
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel.Beautiful city.Historic sites.Great food.If I have the chance to return, I will.I fully recommend Town and Country resort.

Reviews.Title: “pretty grounds and nice staff but....”
Reviews.Author: travelprof57
Reviews.Content: The roses were beautiful and the grounds well kept. Also, very helpful staff (especially bellman Justin) but overall I thought it a bit pricey considering the condition of the rooms. The rooms looked old and worn out. I wish I had stayed across the road at one of the cheaper hotels where the wi-fi is free. You have to pay $10 a day for wi-fi and it was very unreliable. Service at the onsite restaurants was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, just didn't care for the 'wildlife'.”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandMartini
Reviews.Content: Sonya, of the bell station, was the first person that I encountered, as she helped my grandmother out of the car and escorted her wherever she needed to go to fulfill the check-in process. Everyone at the front desk and bell station demonstrated outstanding customer service, made us feel welcome from the very start. The room was outdated but very clean...a fowl odor was present all throughout the property, was it sewage, mold or what? Stinky in some places, and pleasant in others. *Need to know Spanish to communicate special request or needs to housekeeping staff, but despite the language barrier, Maria I. was very sweet, professional, and courteous to our special needs and privacy. The whirlpool was the highlight of this stay...large, secluded and very hot. I enjoyed a great meal at the Terrazza Restaurant, including the Tiramisu which was to die for...Jamie our server was very nice. One thing that I truly must complain about was the presence of possum, lizards, and small creatures that while I was assured by the grounds department were not mice or rats, their presence were still unsettling...not in the room of course, but outside at the tables in the garden room areas. (I was in room 3534) No one wants to enjoy breakfast or lunch in the San Diego sunshine and see a small mammal/rodent 2 feet from your table outdoors. Overall, I would return after serious room renovations and fewer animals roaming around. Service was outstanding and I do believe that they were making up for the inadequacies this resort has, which is asking a lot from these employees. I plan to send my photos to the general manager of this resort of the 'animals', and see what he/she has to say.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! THIS PLACE IS HAUNTED!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: animallover99
Reviews.Content: Back in 2005, I stayed here for a conference. As others have mentioned, the wait in line for check-in is interminable; there were about 15 people in front of me, and only two women at the desk. No apologies for the wait, by the way. Well, I checked in to Room 1331, way in the back of the complex. Believe me, the last thing on my mind was possibly encountering paranormal activity. I had just entered my motel room, and began to feel very anxious, and didn’t know why. I was very tired, and just wanted to get a good night’s sleep. Well, unfortunately, I started to feel more uncomfortable in that room by the minute. I had a very restless night. The next morning the “presence” was still there in the room and I was left with the feeling that someone had either been murdered there or committed suicide. I was told sometime later that perhaps the property sits on Indian burial ground. The motel has refused to answer my emails. Does anyone happen to know anything about the history of this motel, or the land it sits on? I’d REALLY appreciate it. [--] is my email if you know something! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good service at the Restaurant trellises”
Reviews.Author: ST448844
Reviews.Content: Pat Muklevicz was very helpful and nothing was too nuch effort Thanks Stan

Reviews.Title: “You won't get the room you reserved, and your room will be full of mold!”
Reviews.Author: shereewolfe
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference September 27-30 at this hotel. I went along for the beautiful sites and weather of southern California. We paid the extra out of pocket for an upgrade to a "premium king bed Royal Palm Tower". When we arrived after a cross-country flight, It was fairly late in the evening. We were told that our room would be 3539..."not in the palm tower...but just as nice". The first thing that hit us as we opened the door, was the unbearable smell of mildew. I mean, it made my eyes water. As we entered the room, ready to collapse from exhaustion, the next thing we realized was that we weren't going to be sleeping anytime soon. I understand being green,,,and not using the AC except when the room is in use, but it was 80 degrees in there. That might have been tolerable, had it not been for rhe fact that due to the extreme need for a dehumidified, every surface in the room..including the sheets and pillowcases, ranged from damp to down right wet. We turned up the AC full blast, and went out for a late dinner. Unfortunately, when we got back, we realized that the AC was on it's last legs... I called the front desk, and told them that the AC needed service. When they sent the maintenance man over, he asked us why we were staying in this section. I explained that we had reserved the palm tower, but were told that these were identical. He looked at me incredulously, and said that we might want to check that out for ourselves...that the hotel was nowhere near full. I immediately called the front desk, and asked why we had been downgraded, and were still paying the same rate. I was told that there were "no king non-smoking rooms available". I explained that I was unhappy with the state of the room. The desk clerk said that she could put me in a queen smoking room in the tower. I reminded her that I PAID for a king NS. At which point she said "sorry, that's all I can do". My husband said we could try the smoking room, but I can't imagine adding smoke to mildew...not a great picture. I waited 20 minutes and picked up my cell phone and called reservations and asked for a king NS in the royal palm tower, for 3 nights...and you guessed it...They could accomodate me... The other things of note....the wall paper has gotten so wet in the dressing area from the humidity, it is peeling off in sheets. The staff in the restaurant are so desperate for good reviews, that they offer free dessert if only you will give them excellent remarks on the website...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: karreras1
Reviews.Content: Roses were beautiful and the grounds were quaint and sweet. Inside of the rooms - the blue shag carpet was gross.. There was no gym.. had to pay extra to use Gym in parking lot and that did not include use of the gym showers..????

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Princess35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Town and Country for business (convention was held there) in October. In general, the hotel was average. My room was very dated (can you say flashback to the 80’s?). There was floral wallpaper throughout and the carpet was stained. I will say it was pretty clean despite the wild floral bedspread and slight odor. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The landscaping was beautiful (looks like that is where they spent their money). We ate at the café there but the breakfast was good but overpriced. Parking was $14 daily. The convention center was very nice but dated as well. I think the hotel was average. You would probably find a better place to stay across the street at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, looking forward to our next visit”
Reviews.Author: IowaDavidE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country in San Diego for two nights to do planning for a conference we're directing between Christmas and New Year's for 400-500 international students. I am very impressed with the facility. We received excellent help and service from Tom Bisesi, Tina Rees, Rhianna Cultrona, Patty Muklevicz and more. We're really looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff-Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mcarew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Town and Country while visiting friends. Overall staff was friendly and I was impressed several had worked at the hotel for 10+ years. Room was slightly dated but very clean and comfortable. Beautiful landscaping thoughout. Loved having a mall and trolley station right behind the hotel. Concierge was very helpful with trolley information and times to the downtown gaslamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: KaBa_9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. The grounds are relaxing and lovely. The rooms were clean and the pool was amazing. We had a few problems with Kellys. One out of four meals had to go back and the Terrace Cafe was not even near Italian (which is what they advertise). We never got to eat at Trellis, but think that would have been good. Craig and Don at Trellises were friendly and very good at their job. We were there with friends and we all agree that we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingLatvian
Reviews.Content: Someone had the nerve to call "a resort" this sprawling motel right next to Interstate 8. So many things are wrong with this place... Tasteless and pathetic landscaping: a parking lot with fake fountains. Poor and overpriced breakfast. Constant hum of traffic. Average room cleaning quality: greasy surfaces, stale tobacco smell in a non-smoking room. I don't know why anyone would want to stay here on a leisure trip. Don't waste your money! To be fair, check-in at the front desk was swift. And parking space was ample, although not free: $15/night.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy and disgusting... I would even say unhealthy!”
Reviews.Author: Tourist100007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so poorly maintained! The first room I was placed in had black mold growing on the walls behind the curtains. The air conditioning did not work. I would describe the air inside my room as a soup of mold and the left over smells of smoke and bug poison. When I was moved to a new room (after a call to the front desk in which they offered to move me if I would pay extra!). The new room was just as bad! It smelled like someone had spilled a bottle of wine and it was left to ferment in the carpet for a decade. That is easily the most disgusting experience I have had in a hotel in the USA! I've traveled extensively in Eastern Europe, Southeast Asia, and Central America and even in these impoverished countries, I rarely had to tolerate the slovenly conditions found at the Town and Country "Resort" Hotel. Avoid this place! Do not book your group for a conference at this place, or the people who attend your conference will hate you for it!

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: gordonelwyn
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay during the Sub Vets Convention. The restruant service that Pat Muklevcz gave us was outstanding. She is to be commended for her outstanding service. Thanks to all. Gordon Holt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food and Service at the Trellises (37147)”
Reviews.Author: rjt8090
Reviews.Content: Robin, Manager of the Trellises, set up a dinner for 10 that exceeded our expectations. Having traveled worldwide, we are used to elegant dinners with fine food and service. What we were served at the Town and Country, was excellent in every regard. The preparation, from appetizers to desert, could not have been improved. The plating was elegant but not pretentious. The service was casual, friendly and completely appropriate for the setting. Robin and Don know how things should be done and it occurs in the most comfortable manner. Also had a great breakfast. Marvelous

Reviews.Title: “cross between english countryside and tropical”
Reviews.Author: ricrush
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days business and pleasure . If you stay in the one and two-story rooms (not the towers), then you will be treated to lush grounds with gazebos, mature plants and flowers. The secret to it's charm are its garden sitting areas scattered throughout in nooks. Rooms are nice wth a mix of cottage feel, edwardian bed valances and flowery linen patterns. Considering the age of the hotel, rooms are nice but on the small side for a "resort". Kudos to the Management for the VIP treatment as well as to Pat M. @ Trellises for the good service.

Reviews.Title: “The resturants are excellent”
Reviews.Author: dgklj
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Town and Country is association with a national convention. I ate often at the Terraces Resturant and was served by a fabulous wait staff. While all servers were exceptional Pati Muklevicz really stood out as pleasent, prompt and pleasent. I would return to the Hotel and resturant just so see Pati. The entire experience was wonderful!!! Thank you so much for the wonderful 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at T&C for 25 years. Rooms clean and well appointed. Restaurants are very good. Kelly's Steak House always serves very good meals at most reasonable prices. Having breakfast and/or lunch at Trellises Grille is a treat. Food very good, presentation always first rate and if your lucky enough you will have the pleasure of being served by Pati Muklevicz, an excellent server with full knowledge of the menu. Pleasant swift service with the kitchen doing their part. Hotel is right on the freeway giving easy access to anywhere. Trolley located immediately behind the hotel-a short walk to boarding platform. From the front desk, bellmen, and housekeepers, all very professional. A special note for Susie Weber in the Executive Office who always handles our arrangements with swift dispatch, going out of her way to make certain everything is ready upon arrival. Just a great place to stay when away from your home!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location for a conference.”
Reviews.Author: Fremont_GAP
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are lush and well maintained making for a nice area to walk around in and relax in, day or night. The location is very convenient to the I-8 freeway. The staff were all very friendly and the maid service was excellent. The hotel restaurants were good, but a bit more expensive than surrounding restaurants, but that's reasonable. The convention rooms were very nice. The only complaints were that the mattress in my room was too firm for me and I wasn't able to get a good night's sleep during my stay. Also the air conditioning duct blew right down on the bed with no way to redirect the air flow. Even with the fan at low speed, the breeze hitting the bed was annoying. We chose to sleep with the windows open which made for a fair amount of noise due to car traffic and the garbage truck which banged dumpsters around at 5:30 AM. Why the hotel allows garbage pickup at that hour I don't know. A later time when everyone is awake is a much better idea.

Reviews.Title: “Went for Comic-Con... no bed in our room.”
Reviews.Author: WSM75
Reviews.Content: Hopefully this is a once in a lifetime, but they gave us a room without a bed. We were placed in a room that was the living room to a suite, and some of other lucky person had the bedrooms that attached to our large living room... They couldn't move us b/c they were sold out. then our toilet didn't work. They comped our first night and put us in a really nice room on the second night. It sort of made up for it, plus it's a jaw dropping story to tell friends. "We stayed in a room without a bed and a functioning toilet." As they said the next morning, "well, at least we didn't put you out on the street sir." Will not be going back. Sad b/c the place has potential in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Always our 1st choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: EquiteClass
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that each year we visit San Diego we stay at the Town and Country and have done so for years. Barbara Whitlock, the Sales & Marketing Coordinator, is simply wonderful. She is always willing to work with us patiently on our reservations and requests. Her follow through on details is commendable. Thanks Barbara!!! The resort grounds and gardens are beautiful. There are many areas to sit and relax while enjoying the scenery. The rooms we have stayed in have been spacious and clean. Be sure to enjoy a few trips to the Bella Tosca Day Spa as well!. Very relaxing! The variety of restaurants on site makes dining with family easy - there is a different option for every day! As a family traveling with children, we love to frequent the sports bar "Charlies". The kids can play games while we relax over appetizers & beverages. Our server many times this summer at Charlie's was Carol and she made our visits fun! She was great. There are many more positives to staying at the Town & Country so give it a try and see for yourself. We truly enjoy our annual stays at the Town and Country!

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure Why This Hotel Exists”
Reviews.Author: KJUW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country for four nights in August for a business conference that was taking place at the convention center on the property. This is a really odd hotel and I'm not quite sure what type of traveler it is built for. Its not in an ideal location to be a relaxing resort, its not nice enough to be a good conference center, and its too expensive to be a budget hotel. First of all you have the location, on I-8 just east of I-5. While you're within a short drive of most of the San Diego area, you aren't really anywhere of interest. You're not downtown, not by the ocean, just kind of out among lots of other hotels. The property is large and spread out. Upon first look, it appears to be something out of 1960's Florida. There are several buildings and each contains different types of rooms. I stayed in the tower, which is at the back end (north end) of the property. It's about eight levels and has exterior corridors. Almost all rooms have a view of the pool below. The room I received was damp and dank, even with the air conditioner running all day. While it wasn't noticeably dirty, everything seemed to be sticky and there was a musty smell to the room. The bed was a murphy bed (pulled down from the wall). The TV cabinet doors would not stay open unless propped. There was a door that joined with the room next door that was paper thin and didn't even reach the floor. I could hear the slightest noise from the room next door, including every time the water was turned on and every footstep on the floor. Fortunately my neighbor was another business traveler, so there wasn't much noise from the room. After speaking with others who were staying in some of the other buildings on the property, it seems the tower offers the largest rooms. My room had a wet bar and mini-fridge as well as a couch and dining table. Rooms in the other buildings apparently did not have these amenities. The tower rooms also have a balcony. Even at the discounted conference rate, this hotel was no deal. Add on a $14 per day parking fee (no reason for it given the location) and a charge for internet, and this hotel is no value whatsoever. I was able to get around the internet fee by connecting to the wireless signal from the cafe below my room. For some reason that access was free and the signal was even stronger than the regular hotel signal. There are some aspects of the resort that were acceptable. The grounds are nice to stroll around (although it's easy to get lost or turned around). There are trees and rose gardens everywhere. There are also a couple pools that looked well maintained. The staff at the convention center was excellent. Fast and attentive. There is also a large shopping mall just north of the property, just across a small river and a street. There are plenty of dining options within the resort as well as a few at the mall, all within easy walking distance. But those aspects don't make up for the drawbacks or the high price. One colleague of mine said she saw a rat on the property one morning. Another checked out upon arrival when his room smelled so bad he couldn't stand it. I didn't find anything so awful I felt I needed to leave, but I certainly won't be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesalltaken
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Hotel location makes it easy to get around to any part of San Diego. Enjoyed the outdoor sitting areas adjacent to clean, attractive rooms. Several on-premise restaurants, and Pati Muklevicz was our bubbly, charming server for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: NJRobby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Town and Country for 8 days while attending my professional convention. We ate the majority of our meals at various dining facilities on site. We especially enjoyed Trellises Garden Grill were the waitress Pati Muklevicz made sure that we enjoyed our meals. Breakfast overlooking the pool and well maintained gardens was delightful. All of the resorts' employees were always busy with there assignments but never to busy to help make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: HockeyVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the middle of Aug for 4 nights. Reservation requested room in the courtyard of one of the pools. I confirmed this at check in. In short the room was down the hall from the pool not a courtyard room and worse the windows backed on to the parking traffic and staff smoking area. Worse yet the pool nearest to us was closed. We asked to move rooms and were given one in the rose garden. Very nice room but a walk across a driveway to the operating pool - not a courtyard (we have a 5 and 7 yearold). Requested to be moved to a courtyard to the pool for the next night. We were told we'd have to wait and call in the morning? Why? I don't know - don't they know who's checking out the nite before? Anyway it was too complicated to try to reason with the front desk. The second nite we were moved to a room in the courtyard to the pool!! We were happy but disappointed when the kids said that pool is freezing - I asked the front desk and she tells me that only the pool we had moved away from was heated. This info may have come in handy had we not just moved to our third room in 2 nights. In the end the kids walked 1/2 a block to the warm pool most nights. The hot water to the tub did not work right - it was extremely finnicky on how to get the magic 11 o'clock angle to get the hot water but after 30 minutes my husband figured it out. The only great thing was the bellmen they were all great and very helpful in moving our luggage from room to room and in suggesting places to eat and go out to.

Reviews.Title: “We come here every year for our Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: mmoreno24
Reviews.Content: Our family loves to stay at Town and Country resort in San Diego. We bring the whole family every year. They have something for everyone the adults have a fine dinning experience at Trellis's. The chef Patrick Kenna is amazing at what he does. Robin is always accomidating and our waiter Don always puts a smile on your face. Our grandchildren enjoy the pool and having pizza at Charleys. We will continue our summer tradition and stay at Town and Country Resort

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: GVCA
Reviews.Content: We agree w/ the most recent reviewer in terms of being relieved by the hotel after reading some earlier reviews. The grounds are beautiful... really make you feel like you're on vacation rather than just staying in a hotel. Staff was very accommodating. Room was clean and adequate ... nothing plush, but comfortable and we had a nice view of the pool and foothills beyond. The hotel is trying to offer something for everyone ... including a dance band for the older set in the Trellise Garden restaurant and the showing of the movie, Bolt, outside in the rose garden area for the youngsters (w/ blankets, chairs and free popcorn ... they were delighted). Only bummer is the entrance to the hotel, which can be confusing because of the barricades due to the paid parking. Can be a maze to find where you're going ... but not bad once you've figured out the lay of the land. Really give them kudos for maintaining the gardens ... we actually enjoyed out stay, which was aimed at moving our son into his college apartment. Can't review the restaurants as we didn't eat there ... but we did watch some sports in Charlie's, which was a good spot for that. All in all we were quite satisfied and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay and the staff was very accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: vicandcheryl
Reviews.Content: Make sure to visit the Terrace Restaurant. The atmosphere was beautiful and we had an outstanding waitress, Pati Muklevicz.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.....but if you stay you'll never shake the feeling you could've done better”
Reviews.Author: TrumpNYC
Reviews.Content: Mixed bag here. The Good: - Staff is incredibly helpful and courteous. Class act all the way - Kelly's Steak House is very good. Recommended - Nice pools - Located adjacent to a trolley stop The Bad: - Decor by your great grandmother - The main restaurant is just standard - should be a little nicer - Sunshine Deli should be avoided at all costs. You're better off finding a 7/11 - Unclear and insufficient signage makes it hard to locate pleces on the property - Hotel sundries shop charges prices like a Brooklyn loan-shark. AWFUL. - No in-room fridge, no free internet access It's an OK place, probably better for families but you can't shake that nagging sense of things going flaky around the edges: a broken lamp in the room, chipped plates in the restaurant, peeling paint in some spots. You can do worse, but you'll feel more comfortable in the DoubleTree across the street I think.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Savannah-Beth
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place, let me start at the beginning. I book at this hotel 10 months in advance asking for a room with two queen beds and on a high floor. The day I arrived they couldnt give me my booking as they were booked out so we were put in a room with one queen bed on the 4th floor and the bed was a pulldown bed from the wall at 209.00 a night. There was an adjoining door with the room next door and even quiet talk we might as well as of been sitting with each other on the sofa cause you could hear every word said. The bed was really old as were the pillows god knew when they had last been replaced there wasn't much stuffing left in them at all. We did ask for more but they were as bad as the ones we already had. the couple above us like to have sex 100 times a night and there is no insulation so lets just say they might as well be laying beside us we could hear every single movement. It was so noisy at night people running down the hallways etc. One night they rented out one of the rooms for an event and we had to listen to the loud music played there till 10.30pm at night. When we complained was told there was nothing they could do as it was booked out for them till 10.30pm. We had booked for 10 nights but we left two days early as we could just not take the noise the uncomfortable bed anymore. I was charged fully for the room for the two nights we did not stay plus and extra $100.00 per night for leaving early. After 3 international phone calls at my own expensive I am still fighting with them to get this money refunded as they say it is their policy to charge for early departure. They staff were not friendly at all and have been down right rude at trying to get our money back. I keep getting put on hold and told someone will call me back to which this has not happened as of yet. No matter what time of the day I call San Diego time I am told that there is no manager onsite to deal with this issue. Do not stay at this hotel you would do better sleeping on the side of the road. The rooms are old and in need for some furbreeze it is very noisy and they staff don't care and have no customer service at all. It really did spoil part of our holiday to America. To which I am still paying for with the extra charges to my credit card and phone calls. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend this to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mvf906
Reviews.Content: I must admit I nearly changed hotels after reading some of the reviews on this hotel but I'm glad I didn't. Very friendly staff, beautiful grounds and a stone's throw from a huge shopping mall and tram at the rear, what more could you ask for ! Yes, the room did smell a bit but only because it hadn't been aired for a while, after the first day it had gone and yes, there are some rooms that look onto a brick wall (why they built them like that who knows ! ) but if you don't want a view and just enjoy the resort, these rooms go for peanuts ! I know you can't please everyone but it seems easier to write a review if you've had a bad experience then a good one..........

Reviews.Title: “overall pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Felipe77
Reviews.Content: We were there on business at the San Diego Comic Con and some fun elsewhere in Southern California. Hotel is a short walk to trolley which runs to convention center. Rooms are good but not great where we were--air con fan was noisy needing repair, doors slam too loud, hard mattresses, views for less expensive rooms overlook parking lot which is noisy. Expensive parking overnight. But grounds are exotic and well-kept and food choices are many since there are 3 restaurants there. Magnificent service from Pati Muklevicz and Angelica at the Trellises Restaurant and the food was excellent every morning we ate there. I recommend hotel for convenience, even if far from Convention Center. Also has nice swimming pools, which we did not use. Last tip: always pay for your ride on the trolley, It's an honor system but one day the police got on and checked all tickets and you can get a court citation if you don't have one. Only one person on our car didn't have one, to my surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: chri5t0ph
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in a garden room which was excellent. There were two large beds and the bathroom was also nice. Its a pretty large hotel with i believe three swimmingpools and several restaurants. They are a bit pricey considering what we paid for our meals and beer in Point Loma later that week. The staff was very nice and helpful and there is a golf course next by with great rates for the guests. Also being close by Fashion Valley it is close to several malls and the tram down town or wherever is next to the hotel. All in all nothing unexpected, nice but perhaps a bit impersonal compared to a smaller hotel. You also have to pay for everything there. Wireless, fitness, breakfast, coffee...

Reviews.Title: “ok with flaws”
Reviews.Author: kindnessofstrangers
Reviews.Content: This is on the "hotel circle" which is a bunch of hotels set back from a freeway in mission valley. That sounds not so good but this Hotel has done a good job of isolating what is an extended complex from the freeway. Its a pretty quiet place with plants, palm trees and pools. Staff - they were very friendly, helpful and professional. Room - I was in the first floor of the tower block. The room was kind of elegant and very roomy and had a balcony facing the pool. It had a kitchenette but very lacked essentials like knives and forks. An issue was that the room had a connecting door and you could easily hear people next door though thankfully they werent that noisy. I think my room was part of a two room suite and so my "bed" was a sofa bed which was ok but I could have done with a real one thanks. Location - somewhat out of town but the good news is its right next to a trolley station which is very fast and takes you most places in town and is $5 for a day ticket. There is alot of parking but I came without a car. The main hassle during the stay was internet which was lousy - failed for 24 hours and was not free approximately $10 for 24 hours. There was free internet if you visited some cafe place which was pretty good for service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant tucked into this beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FrankieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town and Country on business all this week , and tonight had the pleasure of eating at one of the restaurants on the premises, Trellises. The food was delicious, but what really made it a memorable experience was the outstanding service provided by our waiter, Don and the bartender, Craig. Both gentlemen went above and beyond to ensure that we had not only great service, but also a great time. They made us feel so welcome! I can't wait to go back on my next trip to San Diego! F. Swank

Reviews.Title: “Look past the roses and maybe you can find the conference.”
Reviews.Author: likesToVacay
Reviews.Content: This resort and conference hall was an absolute delight. For starters, the grounds of the resort is a beautiful botanical garden. You can spot emerald beetles and humming birds fly from one bird of paradise flower to another. It is truly a place of tranquility. The conference space was spread through out the resort allowing for a nice change of scenery on the grounds. A catered banquet was held the first night of our conference which had food far beyond my taste expectations for an event for that many people. There were several restaurants on the grounds which allowed for some variability in food, but it was all fairly expensive. The service of the staff was in general friendly, but one particular server Angelica Stephens at Trellises Garden Grill truly made us feel like the resort was a home away from home. She always wanted to make sure we were enjoying ourselves and asked about our out of resort excursions. For shopping and other eating opportunities there is a nice mall just behind the hotel. Unfortunatley internet was not included in the rooms, which was unfortunate because the rooms are not inexpensive. You can purchase WiFi Internet costs $9.99 every twenty four hours. The high speed rail system is also right behind the resort. It takes you to down town, but you have to either have a rental car or take a taxi pretty much anywhere else of interest including the Balboa Park, the Zoo, or any of the beaches. In whole, the experience is quite enjoyable and I would recommend this spot to anybody who isn't on a tight budget and who's main destination goal is a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than sone of the negative reviews suggest - I'd recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: BevFd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens, well kept. The hotel was very clean and all the staff were very friendly and helpful - especially Patti and Jesus in Trellis's Restaurant. Good food and music at Kelley's. Conference facilities excellent. Nice and close to large Mall with a good mix of big stores and smaller specialist shops. Also close to trolley service so getting about was very easy.

Reviews.Title: “could do better!”
Reviews.Author: ljhackett
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, tee-tiny room, (two of us could not pass between end of bed and t.v.) poor lighting, tiny bathroom, tub would not drain, poor, poor service at Charlie's, HUGE sprawling facility and no offer to take our bags to our room which was a ten minute walk away! No concierge on duty when we checked in on a Sunday, With so other choices in San Diego, I would not return to this facility.

Reviews.Title: “You're kidding me.....”
Reviews.Author: dannysera
Reviews.Content: If you're into 60's style rooms and surroundings then this is the place for you. Hopefully you also like dirt, dust, zero service and a COMPLETE lack of "getting it" from the staff. Want to have internet service? $10.00 please! Want to use the treadmill or other health room facilities? $10.00 please...... This place is so out of the loop compared to the vast majority of other hotels...we stay at 18-20 properties per year and this is without a doubt the least desirable hotel we have ever visited. We were stuck here for 3 miserable nights!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Handle Large Groups!”
Reviews.Author: ieduca8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our state delegation. Problems began w/check-in, with no room being ready - even though it was after hotel check-in time. We had to come back later and wait in another long line to pick up hotel key. The place is so large you need to be ready to walk and lug your suitcases! We were in a stinky and small room, but located adjacent to pool and ice so we could go somewhere nicer than our room. Rooms were not cleaned very thoroughly...our ice bucket sat for days w/water in it until WE finally emptied it! We often did not receive washcloths with our towels and rarely received bath mats. (Instead, we were given a hand towel to use on the floor!) Our shower also drained so slowly that we stood mid-calf in our shower water by the end of our shower! We complained and were told someone would fix it. We never saw anyone come fix it, but it did drain better, however, we still stood in our shower water - just not as deep as previously/ We also found short, wiry hairs and nail clippings on the night stand between the beds, as if someone shaved in the mirror above the nights stand and let their clippings fall. This should have been cleaned by housekeeping! One advantage is there is an Avis car rental right on the premises and it makes for an easy rental while in san Diego. Parking is rather steep, though...$15/day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: viking189
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, great variety of restaurants. Friendliest staff of any hotel I've stayed in for years! Virtually every staff member had a smile and greeting everyday for my one week stay. Of particular note was the entire staff of Trellis Restaurant, managed by Robin. While the hotel is getting on in years, rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisBarb
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel. The first room I was in had a horrible odor. Second room had a very tiny bathroom. Had to carry make-up in to room every day. Lighting was very poor. No drapes on side windows. Very noisy. Keys did not work very well. No signs to tell you where to find rooms. Everything was out of date. Food was so-so and very expensive. Staff was friendly but did not help, just smiled and said sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but rooms need MAJOR updating!”
Reviews.Author: kansasteacher84
Reviews.Content: The website gave a great idea of the beauty of the grounds, but the rooms will extremely disappointing. First of all, the decor was extremely outdated with mirrored walls in the rooms, blue carpet, and brass accents everywhere. The same creepy picture of a Victorian-era girl was in each room in our building, along with torn wallpaper in some. There were no refrigerators, microwaves, or vending services in or near the rooms. There were a few machines near the pools, but that was a hassle from the 7th floor. Wi-fi internet was available for $9.95 a day, which was frustrating for a business trip. The gym also cost extra money. The restaurants on site were overpriced, but tasted good. Nothing like being nickeled and dimed the whole time! Our check-in was extremely chaotic, but the staff was very patient, helpful, and calm through the entire process. They even set out coffee and cookies while we waited. Overall, the staff was very friendly, but the amenities were disappointing. The hotel was within walking distance from a trolly and bus station which is what we used to visit Old Town and the Gaslamp district. The Fashion Valley Mall was also very close, which had great shopping and some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and BEAUTIFUL grounds!”
Reviews.Author: emmytee
Reviews.Content: I fully enjoyed my time at the town and country! All of the staff was amazing! Don Andrew at Trellises was SO FUN and totally turned my day around. :) Thanks for a great conference!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, relaxing, peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: cew8087
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Town and Country. Everything was clean, quiet and comfortable. The grounds are gorgeous. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Each day at the breakfast buffet we were greeted by Mary Mejia. She treated us like family or honored guests. Her hospitality set the tone for the entire day.

Reviews.Title: “Angelica was heaven sent!”
Reviews.Author: cobalt_330
Reviews.Content: Bengt Samuelson, who oversees all operations at the T&C suggested we eat at the Trellises Restaurant. Besides the fact that the Trellises is beautifully situated among a bed of roses and the food was remarkably magnificent, our server, Angelica Stephens, was an absolute treasure. I noticed the accolade on her name badge only after being charmed by her kindness and willingness to make our table very happy. Her service was swift, attentive and very enthusiastic. She was exceptionally earnest and her food suggestions were spot on. She was able to keep all of us at my table very happy with her service even in the face of a 60 person party happening inside. My appreciation to the Bengt, the staff at the Town & Country, and the wonderfully pleasant Angelica. You've more than amazed all of us!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Melody”
Reviews.Author: wikiSanMarcos_CA
Reviews.Content: Melody @ Kelly's made our 35th Anniversary celebration even more special than it was... With the economy this was a splurge for us and her service was impeccable, delightful and entertaining.. thank you so much Melody.. The evening was great!!! The hotel was great! Clean, comfortable and roomy. The grounds (roses) were beautiful!! Thanks for a great short but sweet night!! Tom & Mary from San Marcos

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: FIRFIR
Reviews.Content: The hotel definitely had valuable employees who were, Pati Muklevicz, Elisha, Angelica Stephens and Bahattin Kılıc. Although we were visitors coming from a long way, we felt like we were in our country. Thanks to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Melody at Kelly's turns a meal into a great dinner!”
Reviews.Author: TinChicken
Reviews.Content: My room was in the Palm Tower. I got the conference rate so I was expecting a terrible room. Although on a low floor, the room was nice and the balcony spacious. We had a drink at Charlies - dead as a post on a Sunday night, but friendly service. The fun to be had was at Kelly's. Our server, Melody, was a hoot! She turned a simple meal into a fun dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Gardenlover3
Reviews.Content: As an academic, I frequently stay at low budget hotels, but occasionally I am treated to real luxury when a conference is able to swing a deal with a hotel. This place is amazing! It has a golf course and a spa (wasn't able to take advantage of these) and a conference center. And it's only 4 miles to the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Gardens. ^_^ The staff were efficient and polite. I had the best sleep ever on the most luxurious king-size bed. And the roses! The resort must have a squadron of gardeners; every edge, sidewalk, building has roses in front - and this is a VERY big place - fabulous gardens, water features, and pools. If I am ever responsible for organzing a convention/meeting, I know this resort will be on the top of the list. ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Get away from it all without leaving civilization”
Reviews.Author: bubbadv
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, despite a snafu with a cancelled corporate credit card. Good food and a great waitress at the on-site steakhouse (ask for Melody and be prepared to be sassed, in the friendliest way possible). Spacious grounds with an Old World vibe and beautiful greenery, plus swimming pools to take full advantage of the San Diego weather. I wish I'd had a couple of extra days for leisure stay, but this trip was all about a technical conference.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: CGio
Reviews.Content: We went down to San Diego recently to visit our children. Our daughter picked the hotel for us, and it COULDN'T HAVE BEEN BETTER! We loved the gourgeous landscape, beautiful pool and gardens, and staff, expecially Barbara and Terry! All in all it was one of the best stays we've had in the 10 years we've been vacationing in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe what you see”
Reviews.Author: oscaraf70
Reviews.Content: Like most hotels they post pictures they want you to see, however; they forget to mention that they also have a separate building which will exclude you from all their amenities. If we would have know this at the time of check in we would have opted out!, Aside from the 30min check in wait.

Reviews.Title: “Kelly's at the Town and Country Resort, San Diego, ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: DiverDuane
Reviews.Content: Just finished dinner at Kelly's Restaurant at the Town and Country Resort, San Diego, and everything was great. Melody is an awesome server that gave great advice on menu chioces and always seemed to know what I wanted. I ordered Bleu Cheese dressing with my salad and when she brought it she asked if I'd like some Creamy Balsamic Vinnaigrette with it, what a great suggestion. The Prime Rib was awesome, the Veggies were perfectly Al Dente', and the Cole Slaw was to die for. All in all I was amazed that a hotel owned restaurant could be so good. I highly recommend it and Melody too.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - wonderful service - super employees”
Reviews.Author: jpsval
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a one day conference - but was overly impressed by the cleaniness, service, facitilites and overal appearance. I especailly enjoyed being served by Angelica Stephens - the best waitress in the world!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The resort is great and Melody & Kelly's is a great waitress.”
Reviews.Author: XPT_Dave
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about the resort other than the fact I don't like having to pay for internet service in the room with the cost per night. Melody @ Kelly's was a great waitress. Funny, sarcastic (as we started with the sarcasm) and just made our Sunday night dinner a topic of conversation for half the night. Hope to see her again next year! Dave from Fitchburg, MA who was hangin' with the Aussies!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: frommontana
Reviews.Content: Great location! Rooms very large and had space to invite friends over to "hang -out"! Was late for check in but they kept my room without me having to call! Pool area clean and a great treat! Freeway close but you do not know it by how quiet the hotel is! Staff will help locate points of interest to go to! I am a quilter and they found close shop for me!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful little hotels we've stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Indianhoosier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Town and Country resort while in San Diego for the National School Board convention a couple times now and absolutely LOVE this place!!!  They have the best restaurants, the most gorgeous flowers and grounds, and their rooms are so quaint!!  We will always stay at this resort when we come to San Diego!!!  Pati Muklevicz at the Trellis restaurant was extremely accomodating when she heard we were in a hurry to catch a flight!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful roses”
Reviews.Author: dora6969
Reviews.Content: This trip was to visit family in the San Diego area. My sister works at one of the hotel restaurants. She was my tour guide and as we walked around the grounds to get familiar with the layout I was delighted to see so many roses full of color and Healthy. Lucky for my to be there at the height of the blooming season. The room was very clean, it was quiet and I was very comfortable staying there.

Reviews.Title: “horrible internet”
Reviews.Author: erinmarie121
Reviews.Content: my biggest complaint about this hotel is with the internet service. they charge if you want internet access in your hotel room, but this is not at all worth it. the service has gone down both mornings i have been here, and there is barely a signal during most of the day - worse than dial-up. it was impossible to even check my email in my room. they have free internet at the restaurants at the hotel and you are probably better off using that. if you do have problems with the internet, you should complain to the front desk. i was told that 'they do not know that the internet is bad because no one ever complains about it'

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel with a very scary painting”
Reviews.Author: chocolateutah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the T & C during the holidays and had a wonderful time. We loved being right across the street from a fabulous mall. Since we were there during the "off" season most of the restaurants were closed so having a mall across the street was very convenient. We did order room service one night and were very impressed. The food and service were great. On the down side we were woken up early one morning by a work crew removing wall paper right outside our room. We also were a litle freaked out by the painting of the girl in the blue dress that is in every room and in many hallways. Her eyes follow you no matter which way you move. We finally had to put a towel over her picture so she would quit watching us sleep. Over all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pati is the Greatest - also Melody at Kelley's”
Reviews.Author: Bullneckmooseface
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent at Trellis' Restaurant. Her suggestion for breakfast was supurb. Service was excellent also. Melody provided excellent service and advice on the menu at kelley's Steak House - also don't miss the Piano Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Let Pati serve you @ The Trellises Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Travelcouple156
Reviews.Content: Besides the reunion (Red River Valley Fighter Pilots Association) we attended @ the Town & Country, having Pati Muklevicz serve us @ the Trellises Restaurant was the most enjoyable part of our stay. She was very attentive, friendly and provided several enjoyable food combinations not found on the menu. We looked forward to having "breakfast with Pati."

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JRWBTW
Reviews.Content: Belllmen and Front Desk staff were incredibly helpful and supportive when we (a conference) came to the hotel. They went above and beyond their normal duties. Without their support and assistance I would not have been able to have our event operate so successfully. Thank you for their friendly service and personal touch!

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good, but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: deltafan
Reviews.Content: I have to say that it was a nice place with a few pools and restaurants, but I was disappointed in a few things. Mostly, all the extras for which they charged. First, they charged a ridiculous amount for the use of the business center computers. Second, they had a steep parking fee which was not mentioned anywhere on their website-I looked several times. Third, they overcharged me for my room. The service was okay, and they reimbursed me after I realized that I was overcharged (good thing I realized). The room was fine-nothing too amazing. I was really looking forward to staying here, but it was only so so.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid stay”
Reviews.Author: TimLA
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location (just off a major freeway). Nice rooms, recently redecorated - 1950's-60's construction. Excellent service. Pati M in the breakfast restaurant was very nice. Just a little noisy given proximity to freeway. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Planner's Ideal in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ConferencePlannerLQ
Reviews.Content: As a Conference Planner, I would highly recommend the Town and Country (T&C) Hotel and Convention Center. For our yearly week-long conference of 2000 attendees, the T&C is able to accommodate all of meeting space needs, sleeping rooms at a reasonable rate, delicious catering, and onsite AV. We have held our conference at the T&C for the past 15 years, and have come to feel like the T&C extended family. What I find truly amazing (and rare) is that the majority of the staff has been there for many years. This consistency is so nice for a Conference Planner, as the T&C staff understands our mission, and works very hard to help us reach our goals for our attendees. In working closely with the directors of Sales/Marketing, Convention Services, Food and Beverage, and AV, I find them to all be highly professional. They are all approachable, friendly, reliable, experienced, dedicated, and extremely hard workers…giving over 100% consistently. They are very much a “family”, which shows in all their dealings with staff and guests. When I walk around the beautifully landscaped property, every staff member that I meet is friendly and always willing to assist with any needs. I find their attitude to be refreshing, and always sincere. There are several restaurants onsite, which makes it very convenient for the conference attendees. The restaurants choices range from a fun casual sports bar to beautiful fine dining with fabulous food. There is a beautiful Spa onsite with many amenities. I highly recommend the hot stone massage, a truly amazing experience! San Diego is such a beautiful, wonderful city with many attractions, but can be costly at times, and without a car may be challenging for visitors to navigate. However, for a resort, the T&C is an affordable destination in the very convenient location of Hotel Circle, with the trolley station (and Fashion Valley Shopping Mall) in walking distance. On the trolley, you can navigate easily to many parts of the city including San Diego’s Old Town and the downtown Gaslamp area for lots of fun and good food. The world famous San Diego Zoo, Sea World, and International Airport are each within several miles of the T&C…all very convenient. If you are considering hosting a conference, training, or meeting in San Diego, I would highly recommend the charming T&C.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaTootsie
Reviews.Content: The Town and Country is too good for words. The hotel itself is wonderful, but the views (flowers, mountains, pools, golf course, etc, ) are just beautiful. The Trellis restaurant is too die for. All the food I had was very good, much better than usual hotel restaurant food and the service was superior, like fine dining should be. Patti and Angelica in the Trellis take extra care of you. Charlies bar and Kelly's restuarant are also very good, but the Trellis was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Resort”
Reviews.Author: 50andholding
Reviews.Content: My wife was there on business and I wandered around the grounds. The rooms were very comfortable and the resturants were great. Trellises and Kelly's Steak House. Pati at Trellises is allways checking to see if you need anything. Very Professional! Jeff & Kathrin Fowler

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to sever Pati Muklevic”
Reviews.Author: HarrySeattle
Reviews.Content: I had lunch at the resort and was very impressed with server Pati Muklevic. She showed just the right balance between paying attention and respect for privacy, was efficient and, throughout, worked with a good and helpful spirit. John Graham

Reviews.Title: “Conference in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SactoCA2Rovers
Reviews.Content: The resort is a bit spread out, but the grounds are beautiful and it's conveniently located close to the mall and the trolley which can take you into San Diego easily. The staff in the different restaurants were very friendly and helpful --especially Mary at the Terrace Cafe, Karen at Kelly's Steak House, and Angelica at the poolside restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: lmaui
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with a central location adjacent to an upscale mall. The rooms in the 10 floor tower have been remodeled. We are big fans of the Trellises Restaurant. We have been staying at the Town and Country every other year for thirty years and Trellises is our spot for breakfast each morning and many days for lunch and at least one dinner. Great food and great service. Ask to sit in Pati's section for unbelieveable service. We have been requesting Pati as our server for all of our thirty years. Pati is wonderful and she treats every one as a VIP. . We are not fans of the other breakfast and lunch spot which is the Terrace Cafe. Very noisy and we have never found the services as good as we do at Trellises. Also, try Kelly's Steak House which is also on the property. Our only negative is in regards to their current internet service. It is not a consumer friendly process and often difficult to obtain a connection. One moment it works and the next moment it was down. This can be frustrating

Reviews.Title: “check out the Trellis”
Reviews.Author: DrSam_9
Reviews.Content: Although it is much more elegant and gracious, the prices in the Trellis resturant are comperable with those in the Terrace cafe. And the Trellis service staff (particularly Pati M.) make the meal more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Dir of Sales & Dir of F&B are the GREATEST!”
Reviews.Author: rdeanstone
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed at T&C many times but this time was the best. Awesome room. The hotel grounds are beautiful. I can't speak more highly of the Hotel employees especially in Sales and Food and Beverage. If you ever think of having a meeting in beautiful San Diego, do it at Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Are you Freakin' Kidding Me?”
Reviews.Author: FraserValleyal
Reviews.Content: If there were a zero, that would be my ranking. We stay at hotels around 75 days per year, for business and pleasure, and we have rarely if ever found a more customer not-friendly hotel outside of Russia. What do you mean you cannot guarantee a certain room? You cannot guarantee a non-smoking room, even if I book 5 months in advance? What do you mean, Kinkos 5 miles away when there is a business center at the conference center on site? What do you mean, 'we are a conference center, we cannot guarantee that service?" Is there a single hotelier on staff? What do you mean, the Sea World rate is cheaper than the conference rate, and I cannot get the Sea World rate because you now know that I am at the conference? I have never experienced a staff more trained at knowing nothing in all my travels. They were very well trained at being polite and not answering questions. While I am sure this is not their fault, who the heck is running this operation? Motel 6 is more customer friendly than this place, and less than half the price. The location is nice, the rooms are fine, the property is impressaive in many ways, but the brain is missing. I have already not recommended this hotel to several friends and business aquaintences.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the Town and Country our event was a success!”
Reviews.Author: sarahfsdhoc
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to tell you that we enjoyed our event very much. Alex was my contact for the T&C and has been for 3 years. As I am sure you know the recession has hit every walk of life. Our budget was slashed, tweaked, twisted and tortured this year. With a little help from Alex we pulled off our most beautiful event ever. I have been bombarded with phone calls, emails and voicemails congratulating us on a spectacular event. The food was fabulous! The service impeccable. The exhibit hall looked beautiful. Alex and I have bonded over that last few years. I have recommended your venue to several of my clients knowing that they are in good hands with Alex. You are very lucky to have such an employee. I envy you! I just wanted you to know that I am a satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Shelly057
Reviews.Content: While staying at the resort I was very pleased with the friendliness of the staff and their prompt service. We used the in room dining and our food arrived hot, on time and with a smile. The grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Would try to find better value for you dollar, but nice”
Reviews.Author: joyceinks
Reviews.Content: Nice Place, conviently placed- close to everything- clean but dated. Good customer service, polite staff. Grounds are beautiful, lots of trees and plants and flowers- lots of outdoor seating and gazebos. the Terrace Cafe had great cheesecake and polite servers, quick service. I had a pleasant stay. Had to pay for local calls, had to pay for internet- you may even have to pay for parking - might want to know that !

Reviews.Title: “Been here two times for a conference”
Reviews.Author: thedzoo
Reviews.Content: This a a great setting for a conference. Kind of cool wide open layout. Room were good. Clean and basic. Grounds were very well kept. Large variety of eating on site and a large mall next door wit hgood restaurants. If Coming for a conference you dont need a rental car unless you want to go out into SD.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Bad”
Reviews.Author: ProPoke
Reviews.Content: Due to the Oklahoma State Cowboys being invited to the Holiday Bowl, we started making plans to drive to San Diego and make a three day road trip. I found a 3 star resort on Hotwire and decided to give it a try. When we arrived at the hotel, we found total chaos at the front counter. We were given instructions to our room and when we opened the door, we found a king size bed with bed taking up the entire room. Because there was 3 of us, 1 being an 11 year old, I called Town & Country after I booked on Hotwire and was assured we were given a no smoking room with two beds. We drove back up to the front counter and explained that we needed two beds and we were given a king size bed. The employee stated since Town & Country was a resort, they only guaranteed a room, not anything else. I asked why I was told by an employee of Town & Country that we were given a no smoking room with two beds. The employee changed her story to our room being occupied by some people who wouldn't leave. Right beside me during this exchange was a lady who was at the counter when we checked in which was about 30 minutes ago. Turns out, she booked on Orbitz and Town & Country was claiming they didn't receive the reservation. All evidence was pointing to Town & Country overbooking and now they didn't have enough rooms. I told the employee that she was going call Hotwire and explain to them that they did not have the room that was promised. She did call Hotwire and told the employee that I did not find the facility acceptable so the Hotwire employee asked to speak with me. I explained the situation to Hotwire and was told they would refund the price immediately and asked to speak with the Town & Country employee. The Hotwire employee asked the Town & Country employee if they were going to find alternate arrangements for us and was told no. By this time, I had been lied to so much that I just wanted to leave and never come back. As I was leaving, I noticed the lady who had booked through Orbitz was still there without a room. Luckily, I had joined AAA before I left and had their California book with us. We called several hotels in the area and eventually found a Comfort Inn Hotel & Suites not far away. This room was much nicer and larger than the room at Town & Country plus parking was only $5.00 a day instead of the $14.00 charged at Town & Country. Why Town & Country Resort survives is beyond me. Worst service in the world, rooms that are no larger than a king size bed, furnishings that could be found at a flea market.. There is just no reason to stay here when there are so many other choices in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated, but good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLucyLucy
Reviews.Content: Its a decent hotel, a little dated in decor. Good mall next door. Nice swimming pool. Had good service at the restaurant with friendly waitress Pati Muklevicz.... Definitely not a bad experience at all, just not the most fabulous hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: vegastosd
Reviews.Content: We stay at Town and Country between five and ten times a year and absolutely love it there. Lori in reservations is the absolute best and has always made sure our room is perfect and our reservations are handled in a very professional manner. Lori recommended Kelly's restaurant, the steak house on property and Karen at Kelly's waited on us and was absolutely super as a waitress/foodserver. We will absolutely book again and will also visit Kelly's and ask for Karen on our next visit. We were there on January 29, 2009, on our most recent visit and brought our friends from Scotland, UK to introduce them to this wonderful place :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, just HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of a conference for work and this was the designated hotel for employees. Read the reviews on here but still decided to book here because it was the company's choice so I thought it must be OK. Arrived at the hotel only to be told that the hotel was overbooked (even after calling them the day before to confirm the room which I always do to make sure) and that they had a spare room w/a roll-away bed. Asked the staff if I would be given a discount if I stayed in this "spare room" for the night & was told "NO". They made no prior arrangements evening knowing that there would be others coming who booked the hotel. There were at least 3 others who were told the same thing that they overbooked and we had to look for other accommodations.
