Some of our group got angry and refused to give them a credit card #. One supervisor was told her credit card would be billed for the total cost of the group. Two of my coworkers said they had problems with their rooms, and called for maintanence, who promised to be right there and never showed up. The food at the restaurants onsite was overpriced, so most of us went to the mall next door to eat, or drove to other San Diego locations. The tram system is right behind the resort, and very handy to travel about town. It even goes all the way to Tijuana. I wouldn't stay at the T & C again, especially at the rates our employer was charged. The best things about the T & C are the grounds (lovely tropical flowers, vines and roses everywhere with gazebos, trellises, benches, and the pools), and the location next to the trolley system and mall. It's worth walking through to see the resort grounds, but stay somewhere else if you have the choice, unless you get a super deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference in late July. When we first checked in the staff was not in a hurry to help us. We had to talk loudly to the desk clerk because a janitor was using the vaccum behind the front desk. The first room we got was not very clean. Also, the decor is straight out of 1978. We asked to change rooms are were aloud to do so. The first room was dirty and the carpet was badly stained. It also smelled moldly. The second room was not much better than the first. The air conditioning did not work properly. This made things pretty uncomfortable with the hot summer weather. The hotel has beautiful grounds, however, the rooms are in bad need of a remodel. The conference rooms were large, but are also in need of a remodel. The hotel is very close to the freeway and downtown San Diego. This whole area needs an update however. Most of the hotels on North and South Hotel Drive are older and look like they were in their prime in the 1970's.

Reviews.Title: “When there is no other choice STAY HOME!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to even begin, let's start with the $12.00 a day parking fee that they throw at you when you check-in.. Has anybody ever heard of getting charged to park in a hotel parking lot in which you have reservations for? On top of that they charge $15.00 per day occupancy tax yet again adding more to the bottom line when checking in. We decided to rent a movie off of the service that is provided in the room which was a great movie but did not expect to pay $11.00 for it and the $2.00 movie tax they charge on top of that. So what ever your quote is to stay at this hole go ahead and tack on $54.00 and an additional $13 if you rent a movie. I won't even go into how over priced room service was. So if you like staying in a tiny room with paper thin walls and enjoy paying the inflated prices they charge by all means enjoy your stay!!.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: rgilmoreaz
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about staying on this property, based on what I had read previously. Turned out that this place was quite nice! The grounds of the property were in great shape...obviously people have invested a lot of time on the exterior upkeep! The rooms were fine. The bathroom, sink, closet area was a bit cramped for our family all trying to get ready at the same time. The maid service was great and the people working there were friendly. I absolutely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: sylbro
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and the hotel was very very clean. It was cozy we felt like we were staying at someones house in their bedroom. We booked 2 rooms as our son & his family of 5 also went. Both rooms were clean there were no complaints from any of us. Our rooms had 2 double beds. Our stay included free breakfest buffet each morning and 4 adult tickets to Legoland. The breakfest was good. We booked to nights in this hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent. Close to restaurants, mall, and freeway. We all felt we would stay here again. When we go to San Diego hotel circle is our favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at the Town and Country!”
Reviews.Author: lilypad53
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days, 3 nights at this hotel and I must say after reading many negative reviews on this site I was not expecting much, and I was very pleasantly surprised! We got a triple room in the Royal Palm Towers (I think) for $159/nt. It was in the building at the back of the resort. The room was on the bottom floor, had a beautiful outdoor patio accessible via sliding glass door from the room. Room was quite spacious with 2 queen beds, very clean, and beds were turned down in the evening with chocolates left on the pillows! We ordered pizza from room service and it was delicious and reasonably priced for a hotel room service. Staff was helpful, friendly and courteous. As stated in other reviews, the grounds on this resort are beautifully landscaped. There are 4 pools, and only one seemed to have mainly kids at it. Even for a busy weekend, adults could find a relatively quiet pool to relax at. Sea World is very easily accessed via a short freeway drive, and the trolly stop behind the hotel is great to get around San Diego. My daughter loved having the mall right behind the hotel as well. As some other reviews stated, the hotel does seem to cater to large groups and conventions, and several were present during the weekend of our stay as well. However, I did not find the hotel service to me or my family compromised due to this. The coffee shop had good food for breakfast/lunch, but didn't try any other hotel restaurants. There were periods of times of loud partying, etc, that could be heard either from your room or various parts of the property, however, by the time I was ready to hit the pillow (btw, the pillows were not very comfortable, the only negative of this place I can really state) and turn out the lights, it was a quiet night well into 8 or 9 am the next morning. My husband and daughter used the Spa for massages, facial and manicure and pedicure, and they had a wonderful experience there as well!! As stated before, this is not the Ritz, but in my experience for the price and location it is an excellent value. From reading the negative reviews on here I think perhaps your experience may depend on which room you get and where. I'd highly recommend a ground floor room in the tower at the rear of the property. My family and I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, centrally located, clean & cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how much we actually paid per night for the room, since we got a great package price on Travelocity (round-trip tickets on American Airlines from St. Louis to San Diego including 6 nights hotel for about $453 per person) -- maybe free! The hotel grounds were gorgeous - palm trees, enormous blooming bird of paradise plants, hundreds of varieties of roses in bloom. We had read the reviews and expected the outdated decor, but the room was freshly painted, remodeled, and immaculately clean. Sure, we had to pay $12 per day to park our car in the lot, but it wasn't a big deal. The heated salt water pool and whirlpool were a wonderful relaxer in the evening. Trellises restaurant had delicious pancakes and hot coffee for breakfast. The hotel is centrally located on Hotel Circle. The trolley stop at Fashion Valley Mall is convenience; my sister & her teenage daughter returned home on the trolley after a concert at the House of Blues and were just fine. We had no complaints; in fact, I would stay here again rather than staying where I've stayed before (Hotel Del and Loews on Coronado at #200+ per night).

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have no problems with the Town and Country. I have always found the T&C to be the best hotel for a relaxing getaway to San Diego. You will not find a more beautifully landscaped hotel in the city. They do a superb job of maintaining the grounds. The T&C is such a versatile hotel. Since the trolly station is directly across the street behind the property, you can leave the car parked and access many of the great sights and attractions of San Diego (we were in town to watch baseball at Petco Park). If you prefer sitting by the pool and relaxing with a good book, you are surrounded by the beautiful gardens and landscape. The rooms may be on the small side and show some age, but I much prefer the T&C to staying downtown because at the T&C, you have room to move about. If you think it's too noisy at one of the pools, you have 3 others to choose from. I have always found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. I would highly recommend the T&C to families, international travelers, or anyone on their first visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: *Dirty, ugly rooms with flea market furniture and decorations *Roaches in rooms *Had to pay to park the car we rented from the hotel *Rude staff in restaurants, front desk, front gate and spa *Lousy food for outrageous prices -- doubled Starbuck's prices for a lousy cup of coffee *Lots of foot traffic in front of rooms *Dirty windows that wouldn't close all the way, so we heard screaming children and (-) *Air-conditioner had no discernable controls, just a knob with an arrow written in magic marker *No pay channels (HBO, Cinemax, Showtime, etc.) -- When we tried to purchase a movie, it charged the room twice, but we only got static. When we called the front desk for help, they said they'd "send someone right away." Two hours later, when no one had shown up yet, we called back to learn, "Oh, yeah. We can't get some of the movies in tonight." *Broken remote control *Beds were so hard they hurt our bones, had to fold comforter and place on the bed to give it some semblance of cushion *Shower was abnormally narrow and had NO water pressure *Noisy pool activities ALL day *No in-room refrigerator *Electrical outlet in bathroom was on the other side of the toilet, so we had to wrap the cord around the toilet to prevent from possibly being electrocuted *Meager counter space in bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: aerostef
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a conference in San Diego and we used this hotel for our annual meeting as well. The meeting room was fine with a nice patio overlooking the gardens and pool. The pools were fine, hotel facilities too with a good choice of restaurants. Rooms are ok, they could do with a little revamp as the decor might seem a bit dated. The location of the resort is great with the trolley stop right there.

Reviews.Title: “Average... out of date hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My spouse and 9 month old son stayed at the hotel b/c it was the last hotel on the conference list that was not already booked. Overall, it was OK, but the hotel is outdated in the decor. We had a nice view of the pool (which is not heated). It was clean and service was OK. We brought our own play pen which was good b/c we saw them wheel out one in the hall and it looked like an old white metal cage with full -bed sheet used (and tucked underneath- not safe!). It is close to restaurants and walking distance to the mall. We had to pay for parking, but could go in and out as much as we wanted. It usually does not rain much in San Diego, but it rained most of the time when we were there. We enjoyed the San Diego Zoo and seeing the pandas! If we had a choice, we would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: Temporary
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in early 2000. The facility looked like it was two different hotels cobbled together--the "tower" and the "bungalows" I stayed in a "bungalow" room. Dreary looking and feeling, and the low water pressure in the shower reminded me of my college dorm.... Between meetings I walked around the property, and discovered whole rooms, taken out of service, and filled with mattresses, old toilets, and other junk. For the most part, the conference had its own meals, so I didn't check out the hotel restaurants. One good point: the nearby mall and trolley station (long walk across the back parking lot to get to these, though)

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: LVSaint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here not out of choice. After reading reviews on here and seeing website, opted for Garden rooms since they were the cheapest and possibling were going to be the nicest. Rather pleasantly suprised when we saw our room (close to check in, just down path, side of lobby). Seemed to be recently decorated, not at all shabby, clean and generally nice (although colonial decor a bit OTT and unneccessary). Looked out onto garden and pool and close enough to where we parked car. Bed seemed to be new, very firm (maybe too firm) Some of the bad... There is no guarantee that if you order a king online you'll get it (I booked via their website where you'll get a cheaper room than calling them directly). It's first come first serve. It's true, they will nickel and dime you! $10 extra for each of the following - cot, fridge, parking ($12) - cheap or what! Possibly many other things that'll be extra if you ask. Very little water pressure to shower. Room and bathroom although clean, were small. In a 3000 room hotel, to offer no coin operated laundry facilities is madness. Had to venture under freeway to Best Western. All in all, would not return. There are so many of this kind of place to stay in town. This resort seems dated and it's charging policies suck. Location is fine for some attractions but to be just off the freeway isn't the prettiest of locations.

Reviews.Title: “Bad business travel choice”
Reviews.Author: Garrideb
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the Town and Country, and stayed at the hotel for the convenience. The grounds are nice enough, but the hotel is showing its age--little to no sound insulation in the "bungalow" rooms, skimpy curtains that can't quite block the security light shining outside, budget-class linens. The hotel provides few business travel amenities. Yes, there's a gym, but you need to purchase a $10 per day spa membership to use the gym. In-room internet access is $5 a day, with no wireless capability. There's nowhere to lock down a computer, either. Conference facilities are dreary--everything is a bit faded, the exhibit space feels like the basement that it is, and there are no indoor venues for grabbing a quick snack. The hotel food was overpriced and bland. You'll do much better at the mall, or driving up the hill near the medical school. My family stayed in the area shortly before. We rented a "family" sized room at a more pedestrian motel, which gave us twice as much space as the Town and Country at half the price. Unless you're planning on hanging around your hotel and lounging poolside while waiting for a relative to finish up at the conference center, there's no point in staying at the Town and Country.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of my favorites.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every three or four years I have a conference in San Diego; it has been held at the Town & Country the last three times. The first time I attended one of these, I stayed at the Town & Country and swore never to do it again. My room was in one of their towers. It was a cinder-block hell hole. It just felt oppressive. If you have to be down at Hotel Circle in San Diego, there are a lot better options.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprized”
Reviews.Author: oorr
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor about the Town and Country, we were really dreading our stay there, which was for a large conference. We knew the grounds were wonderful, but heard the rooms were awful. We were totally shocked when we walked into our room in the Pavillion tower on the 5th floor and found it to be very clean, nicely decorated and stocked with plenty of big fluffy towels. We took 2 nieces with us, ages 12 and 13, and they went crazy when they saw that we had a real balcony to sit out on. They went swimming in the one pool which is heated. It was never crowded. They also enjoyed the hot tub, which was concrete, and more the size of a small pool. We appreciated the fact that the pool areas were always well-stocked with even bigger fluffy towels, so not only did the girls have something to wrap around them to keep warm walking back to the room at night, but we didn't have to waste our room towels at the pool. We found the restaurants to be a bit pricey, but very good, and the luncheons served as part of the conference were great and handled very efficiently, especially considering they served @ 1800 people in less than an hour. Considering its location and convenience to the tram stop and Fashion Valley Mall, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and the decor out of style, but even worse the rooms are in very poor condition. The wallpaper is falling off, the capet dirty, stained, and worn. The plumbing is very bad condition. This should be a $39 hotel, not a $119 hotel. I travel a lot for business and the Town & Country goes down as the absolute worst dump I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased....”
Reviews.Author: travelwhere
Reviews.Content: We went to the Town and Country on a work related trip. We stayed in "the bungalows" which by all accounts are superior to the towers. As long as you realize that they are not "bungalows" you will be fine. They must just be a newer wing of the hotel. I would gladly go back to stay in the bungalow rooms. The most important thing would be to make sure to ask for a downstairs room. The downstairs rooms have a small clean courtyard with tables. It would have been nice to sit out there to sip coffee or read. The upstairs were we stayed was like any other hotel room. The room was clean, well maintained and nicely furnished. Our room cost included a daily breakfast buffet which was really great. The trolly is located at the rear of the property. The trolly can go north as far as the San Diego Misson and south to the TJ border/Mexico. There were at least 2 grand malls, Gaslamp district, Seaport village and Old Town San Diego accessible by this inexpensive trolly. We took a cab to have ocean view dining at Pacific Beach. The round trip cab ride was $30. Although our conference was somewhere else, the convention center at the Town and Country was lovely. The grounds were very beautiful with roses galore. We did not use room service and the ill fitting sheets were not a problem to us. I would definately return to this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Town and Country Resort Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Hotel Circle North, San Diego, CA 92108
